PROGRAMME STRUCTURE:

Specialty A  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Regulation Management​
(MDMDM) Medical Device Management - 1 day
(MDMDR) Medical Device Regulation - 2 days
(MDMDC) Medical Device  Regulation for specific countries - 2 days

Specialty C  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Life Cycle Management

(MDPMS) Post Market Surveillance and Vigilance System - 1 day

*Candidate who has attended (MDIA) ISO 13485 Internal Auditor Course and (MDRFTC) Introduction of Risk Management (ISO 14971) offered by SGS within 18 months of the commencing date can apply for course exemption of the (MDRFTC) and (MDIA) modules.

GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

* Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking

Remark: Supporting Organisation: HKIE Biomedical Division
items.Keywords: MDD, MD, Pro, RAQA, MD/11, MDRAQA
items.Objectives:
PREPARATION FOR FUTURE REGULATIONS:

The regulatory frameworks guiding access for medical devices into different markets are frequently evolving and updating. The only way to ensure your products continue to meet the necessary requirements is to work with a certification partner who is constantly up-to-date and who  is therefore able to help you stay ahead of the changing requirements. With our support you stay aware of future changes, SGS enables you to stay close to the current requirements of market applications in line with the varying requirements of different counties and in particular, an emphasis in European and CE mark requirements.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Ir Prof. Albert Poon, Associate Specialist, Medical Device Program of SGS 
-  More than 30 years experience in Medical Device and Biomedical Engineering Services, for HK Government before he retired in aspects of Medical Device regulation, technology development, commissioning and maintenance engineering of medical equipment for 44 public hospitals in Hong Kong.

Mr. Kelvin Sze 
More than 6 years of working experiences in medical device and pharmaceutical industry
Experiences across R&D, Registration Regulation, Production Technique, Quality Control & Quality Assurance

(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement.)

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 80%):
Delegates who successfully completed each course will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

*Delegates who complete a specialty will be issued a certificate. In order to attain the overall Professional Certificate, candidates should complete all 3 specialties (9 modules) within 18 months from the course starts.
items.Title: (10 days) Professional Certificate in Medical Device Regulatory Affairs and Quality Assurance Programme

items.Audience:
SGS Hong Kong recognizes the increasing future demands of the ever-changing regulatory and quality landscape. SGS Hong Kong launches Professional Certificate in Medical Device Regulatory Affairs & Quality Assurance Programme in collaboration with regulatory specialist from May 2015 to address Medical device regulations that are coming up in Asia, European and International markets.

The Professional Certificate would benefit all stakeholders whom have substantial experiences in the medical device industry, in particular:

- Regulatory affairs specialist,
- Management Representative,
- Quality Management,
- Engineering Management,
- Management of Operation,
- Logistics and distribution professional
items.Description:
The course consists of 9 modules designed to address the knowledge requirements for regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialists described in the multi-countries’ medical device regulations, including the E.U., the United States as well as local regulations. The modules provide practical, face-to-face tuition in professional level details to prepare candidates for the challenging and ever-growing role of acting as a regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialist in today’s medical device industry. This course uniquely focuses on the practical exercises and professional knowledge necessary to build skills and competency for the role of regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialists. Sufficient time and depth are devoted to grow regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialists to be the best they can be and to prepare the candidates for the role ahead, not just the assessment process.

PROGRAMME STRUCTURE:

Specialty A  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Regulation Management​
(MDMDM) Medical Device Management - 1 day
(MDMDR) Medical Device Regulation - 2 days
(MDMDC) Medical Device Regulation for specific countries - 2 days

Specialty B  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Management Systems
(MDRFTC) Introduction of Risk Management (ISO 14971) * - 1 day
(MDIA) ISO 13485 Internal Auditor * - 2 days

Specialty C  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Life Cycle Management
(MDCEP) Medical Device Clinical Evaluation and Performance - 1 day
(MDPV) Process Validation for Medical Device - 1 day
(MDFPW) Medical Device Technical File Preparation and its writing skills (info received from SGS TW) - 2 days
(MDPMS) Post Market Surveillance and Vigilance System - 1 day

*Candidate who has attended (MDIA) ISO 13485 Internal Auditor Course and (MDRFTC) Introduction of Risk Management (ISO 14971) offered by SGS within 18 months of the commencing date can apply for course exemption of the (MDRFTC) and (MDIA) modules.

GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

*Early Bird Price will be offered to SGS certified clients, all enrolment made one month prior to the course or online booking
items.Keywords: MDD, MD, Pro, RAQA, MD/11, MDRAQA
items.Objectives:
PREPARATION FOR FUTURE REGULATIONS:

The regulatory frameworks guiding access for medical devices into different markets are frequently evolving and updating. The only way to ensure your products continue to meet the necessary requirements is to work with a certification partner who is constantly up-to-date and who  is therefore able to help you stay ahead of the changing requirements. With our support you stay aware of future changes, SGS enables you to stay close to the current requirements of market applications in line with the varying requirements of different counties and in particular, an emphasis in European and CE mark requirements.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Ir Albert POON, CCE, CEng, FIET, FHKIE, FCIE
Associate Specialist, Medical Device Program of SGS Academy Chairman of Biomedical Discipline Assessment Panel of HKIE Education & Training Committee Member of IUPESM (IFMBE & IOMP)
Ir Poon has more than 30 years experience in Medical Device and Biomedical Engineering aspects for HK Government with specialization in regulation and technology development. He contributed to Regulatory Affairs and regulatory framework of MD in HK and established the foundations for Medical Device Control Office in HK. He is technical expert on MD to Diagnostics and Imaging MD Unit of WHO and in MD nomenclature; actively participating in MD regulation and biomedical technical advice in projects of NGOs such as WHO, London School, EAC (Africa) and GIZ (Germany). Ir Poon is a Certified Medical Laser Safety Officer and Certified Clinical Engineer and he has major contributions in education and training for development of biomedical engineers in Hong Kong.
Mr. Kelvin SZE
Certification Officer of SGS Hong Kong
Mr. Sze has been working in Medical Device and pharmaceutical industry for more than 6 years. His experience covers R&D, Registration Regulation, Production Technique, Quality Control and Quality Assurance. Specially, in the past few years, he focused on developing Hong Kong guide on secondary packaging for pharmaceutical product, which includes quality management system research and implementation under WHO GMP / GDP / GSP guideline.
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement.)

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 80%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course and passed the tests will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

*Delegates who complete a specialty will be issued a certificate. In order to attain the overall Professional Certificate, candidates should complete all 3 specialties (9 modules) within 18 months from the course starts.

items.Audience:
Projektleiter, Ingenieure und Techniker aus Entwicklung, Qualitätswesen, Produktion; Geschäftsführer & Mitarbeiter mittelständischer Unternehmen mit technischem Hintergrund sowie Mitarbeiter aus Vertrieb, Einkauf, Zulassung.

Voraussetzung: Auch bei Vorkenntnissen empfehlen wir, vor diesem Seminar die Schulung „Homologation/Modul 01“ zu besuchen.

Sie erhalten eine Teilnahmebescheinigung der SGS.
items.Description: Nach dieser Schulung verstehen Sie die Abläufe und Verfahrensweisen des EU- und UN/ECE-Typgenehmigungsverfahrens, an das wir Sie systematisch und praxisorientiert heranführen. Wir befassen uns mit Kraftfahrzeugen und ihren Anhängern (EG-Rahmenrichtlinie 2007/46/EG) wie mit land- und forstwirtschaftlichen Fahrzeugen (EU-Rahmenverordnung 167/2013).
items.Keywords: Homologation; Fahrzeug; Typgenehmigungsverfahren, EG-Rahmenrichtlinie 2007/46/EG, 2007/46/EG, EU-Rahmenverordnung 167/2013,
items.Objectives:
• Detaillierter Ablauf des Typgenehmigungsverfahrens – von der Kontaktaufnahme mit der Genehmigungsbehörde und dem Technischen Dienst bis zur Typgenehmigung
  • Aufbau und Inhalt der Rahmenrichtlinien/Rahmenverordnungen sowie deren Anwendung
  • Vor- und Nachteile zu verschiedenen Typgenehmigungsverfahren: Einphasen-, Mehrphasen-, gemischtes Verfahren
  • Erstellung und Optimierung von Beschreibungsmappen
  • Mehrstufen-Typgenehmigungsverfahren
items.PDF_Certificate_Description:
1. Detaillierter Ablauf des Typgenehmigungsverfahrens – von der Kontaktaufnahme mit der Genehmigungsbehörde und dem Technischen Dienst bis zur Typgenehmigung

2. Aufbau und Inhalt der Rahmenrichtlinien 
/Rahmenverordnungen sowie deren Anwendung

3. Vor- und Nachteile zu verschiedenen Typgenehmigungsverfahren:
Einphasen-, Mehrphasen-, gemischtes Verfahren

4. Erstellung und Optimierung von Beschreibungsmappen

5. Mehrstufen-Typgenehmigungsverfahren
items.Title: (2019) EU- und UN/ECE-Typgenehmigungsverfahren für Hersteller von Fahrzeugen und Fahrzeugteilen (Homologation Modul 02)

items.Audience:
QM-Beauftragte, verantwortliche Personen sowie Führungskräfte und Mitarbeiter von Herstellern, Großhändlern und Großhandelsvertrieben, Lagerdienstleistern und Logistikunternehmen, die Pharmaprodukte beschaffen, lagern, transportieren oder vertreiben

Sie erhalten nach dem Training eine Teilnahmebescheinigung der SGS.
items.Description: Die GDP-Schulung führt in die Good Distribution Practices (GDP) für die Pharmaindustrie ein. Grundlage ist die EU-Leitlinie 2013/C 343/01, deren Ziel es ist, entlang der gesamten Lieferkette sicherzustellen, dass die Qualität gewährleistet und die Arzneimittel unversehrt bleiben. Die Schulung richtet sich an Pharmahersteller und Großhändler, aber auch an Lagerdienstleister und Logistikunternehmen, die Pharmaprodukte herstellen, beschaffen, lagern, transportieren oder handeln. Vom Pharmahersteller bis zu den Apotheken sorgen sie dafür, dass die Produktqualität in der integrierten Lieferkette garantiert ist. Die Schulung vermittelt Ihnen die Grundprinzipien der GDP und ihre Anforderungen. Sie werden in die Lage versetzt, Schwachstellen zu erkennen, Lösungsansätze zu ermitteln und die Anforderungen der GDP im eigenen Betrieb umzusetzen.
items.Keywords:
GDP,
Good Distribution Practices,
Medical,
Medizin,
Pharma
items.Objectives:
• Qualitätsmanagement, Dokumentation, Selbstinspektionen
  • Anforderungen an Personal und Personalhygiene
  • Auslegung und Eignung von Räumlichkeiten und Ausrüstung, z. B. Temperatur-Mapping, Kühlkettenmanagement
  • Aufrechterhaltung der Produktqualität während der Betriebsaktivitäten sowie während typischer Tätigkeiten beim Vereinnahmen, Lagern, Umpacken, Kommissionieren oder Transportieren von pharmazeutischen Produkten
  • Umgang mit Beschwerden, Rückgaben und Rückrufen
  • Umgang mit gefälschten Arzneimitteln
  • Besonderheiten für Vermittler
items.PDF_Certificate_Description:
1. Grundlagen: Begriffe, Hintergründe und Entwicklung der GDP

2. Anforderungen an Qualitätsmanagement, Personal, Dokumentation, Selbstinspektion

3. Eignung von Lagern, Ausrüstung, betrieblichen Tätigkeiten und Transport

4. Umgang mit Beschwerden, Rückgaben, Rückrufen und gefälschten Arzneimitteln

5. Umgang mit und Überwachung von ausgelagerten Tätigkeiten

6. Besonderheiten für Vermittler
items.Title: (2019) GDP Good Distribution Practices (GDP) Pharma

Projektleiter, Ingenieure und Techniker aus Entwicklung, Qualitätswesen, Produktion; Geschäftsführer & Mitarbeiter mittelständischer Unternehmen mit technischem Hintergrund sowie Mitarbeiter aus Vertrieb, Einkauf, Zulassung.

Voraussetzung: Vorkenntnisse sind nicht erforderlich.

Sie erhalten eine Teilnahmebescheinigung der SGS.
items.Description: Diese Schulung vermittelt Ihnen praxisnah, welche Anforderungen für die Erteilung von Typgenehmigungen gestellt werden. Wichtige Aspekte dabei sind die Qualitätssicherung und die Übereinstimmung der Produktion (CoP) sowie die Marktüberwachung.
items.Keywords: Homologation, Genehmigungsrelevante Anforderungen, Typgenehmigung
items.Objectives:
• Hersteller-Anfangsbewertung
  • Rechte und Pflichten des Typgenehmigungsinhabers
  • Conformity of Production (CoP), Übereinstimmung der Produktionund Marktüberwachung
  • Qualitätssicherung
  • Kennzeichnung der Genehmigungsobjekte
  • Erstellung von CoC-Dokumenten und Zulassungsdokumenten
  • Beantragung von auslaufenden Serien und Ausnahmegenehmigungen
items.PDF_Certificate_Description:
1. Hersteller-Anfangsbewertung

2. Rechte und Pflichten des Typgenehmigungsinhabers

3. Conformity of Production (CoP), Übereinstimmung der Produktion und Marktüberwachung

4. Qualitätssicherung

5. Kennzeichnung der Genehmigungsobjekte

6. Erstellung von CoC-Dokumenten und Zulassungsdokumenten

7. Beantragung der Zulassung auslaufender Serien und Ausnahmegenehmigungen
items.Title: (2019) Genehmigungsrelevante Anforderungen, Übereinstimmung der Produktion, Marktüberwachung und Zulassungsverfahren (Homologation Modul 03)

items.Audience:
Mitarbeiter und Führungskräfte, die ein Umweltmanagementsystem aufbauen oder betreuen, wenn sie eine umfassende Einführung in das Thema Umweltmanagement brauchen und den Standard ISO 14001 verstehen möchten.

Voraussetzung: Vorkenntnisse sind nicht erforderlich.

Sie erhalten eine Teilnahmebescheinigung der SGS.
items.Description: Für den Einstieg in ein Umweltmanagementsystem sollten Sie den weltweit anerkannten Standard ISO 14001:2015 kennen. In diesem Training lernen Sie, seine Anforderungen zu verstehen und zu interpretieren, um diese erfolgreich umzusetzen.
items.Keywords: Umweltmanagement, ISO 14001, DIN EN ISO 14001:2015, Umweltmanagementsystem, Umwelt
items.Objectives:
• Inhalte und Anforderungen der DIN EN ISO 14001:2015
  • Aufbau und Struktur von Umweltmanagementsystemen
  • Kontext der Organisation und interessierte Parteien
  • Risikobasierter Ansatz
  • Umweltaspekte und Umweltauswirkungen
  • Kennzahlen und Umweltziele
  • Rechtliche Anforderungen

items.Title: (2019) Grundlagen Umweltmanagement (UM1)

items.Audience:
Projektleiter, Ingenieure und Techniker aus Entwicklung, Qualitätswesen, Produktion; Geschäftsführer & Mitarbeiter mittelständischer Unternehmen mit technischem Hintergrund sowie Mitarbeiter aus dem Vertrieb und Einkauf.

Voraussetzung: Vorkenntnisse sind nicht erforderlich.

Sie erhalten eine Teilnahmebescheinigung der SGS.
items.Description: In diesem Seminar lernen Sie die rechtlichen Grundlagen der Homologation kennen – der Genehmigung von Fahrzeugen und Fahrzeugteilen, die zur Teilnahme am Straßenverkehr vorgesehen sind. Wir machen Sie systematisch und praxisorientiert mit den verschiedenen Genehmigungsarten vertraut.
items.Keywords: Homologation, Fahrzeug, Straßenverkehr, Schwerpunkte 2007/46/EG; VO (EU) 167/2013, EU-Typgenehmigung
items.Objectives:
• Rechtskreise EU, UN/ECE, StVZO
  • Übersicht über die EG-Rahmenrichtlinien bzw. EU-Rahmenverordnungen (Schwerpunkte 2007/46/EG; VO (EU) 167/2013)
  • Genehmigung von Fahrzeugen, Systemen, Bauteilen und selbständigen technischen Einheiten
  • Überblick über den grundsätzlichen Ablauf des Genehmigungsverfahrens
  • Übersicht über die verschiedenen Genehmigungsarten: Genehmigung von Einzelfahrzeugen, EU-Typgenehmigung, Kleinserien-Typgenehmigung,

items.Description:
Alle Unternehmen, die Lebensmittel produzieren, verarbeiten oder vertreiben, müssen ein System haben, mit dem sie diese nach HACCP-Grundsätzen selbst kontrollieren – unverzichtbar für Lebensmittelsicherheit und -hygiene. Dieses Training vermittelt Ihnen in kompakter Form das HACCP-Konzept nach der Verordnung (EG) 852/2004.
Sie erfahren, wie Sie kritische Kontrollpunkte festlegen sowie überwachen und das HACCP-Konzept in Ihrem Betrieb umsetzen.

Im Rahmen einer Inhouse-Schulung bei Ihnen vor Ort würden wir ein Kombitraining mit einem theoretischen und einem praktischen Teil empfehlen, um die theoretischen Grundlagen in der Praxis umzusetzen.

items.Audience:
Planungsverantwortliche von Kommunen, Bundesländern und Bund, gewerbliche Investoren, Bestandshalter, Öffentliche Auftraggeber, Architekten, Ingenieure, Projektsteuerer, Bauträger und Bauunternehmen, Sachverständige und Juristen, Verbände und Gewerkschaften

Sie erhalten nach dem Training eine Teilnahmebescheinigung der SGS.
items.Description:
Die Minimierung von Schadstoffen in der Raumluft, professionelle Lichtplanung, optimierte Raumakustik und günstiges Raumklima machen Büroimmobilien werthaltiger. Krankheitsstände werden reduziert und die Zufriedenheit der Mitarbeiter sowie deren Leistungsfähigkeit erhöht. Das bedeutet auch: Reduktion von Rechtsrisiken bei gleichzeitiger Steigerung der Wirtschaftlichkeit.

  • Sie erhalten eine Übersicht zu den geltenden Regeln bzgl. Schadstoffen in Baumaterialien, Büromöbeln und Reinigungsmitteln und sind vertraut mit den Kriterien für korrekte Materialauswahl für gesündere Büroimmobilien.
  • Sie wissen, was beim Sanieren, Modernisieren und Betreiben von Immobilien mit optimalen Bedingungen zum Schutz der Gesundheit von Mitarbeitern zu beachten ist.
  • Sie erhalten Zugriff auf - ein kompetentes Sachverständigennetzwerk - das Portal „Bauverzeichnis Gesündere Gebäude" mit geprüften und freigegebenen Produkten - Rechtsleitfaden zum Projekt "My Future Office" - Ansätze für die Öffentlichkeitsarbeit zum Thema Innenraumhygiene & Nachhaltigkeit
  • Last but not least vernetzen Sie sich mit einem der besten Netzwerke zu gesünderen Gebäuden
items.Objectives:
• Aktuelle Studienergebnisse zum gesünderen Bauen und Modernisieren sowie Infos zum Forschungsprojekt „My Future Office“
  • Gesundheitswirkung von Bauprodukten, Büromöbeln und Reinigungsmitteln
  • Gesundheitsgefährdungen durch aktuelle Produkte
  • Auswahlkriterien beim Einkauf schadstoffarmer und nachhaltiger Produkte
  • Strategien zur Reduzierung der Schadstoffbelastung bei der Sanierung
  • Lüftung und die Vermeidung von Schimmelpilzbildung
  • Praxisbeispiele zum schadstoffreduzierten/ nachhaltigen Bauen und Renovieren
  • Normen und technische Regeln
  • Rechts- und Haftungsfragen
  • Zertifikate und Label als Orientierungshilfe
  • Formulierungsempfehlungen zu Ausschreibungstexten
  • Öffentlichkeitsarbeit in Zusammenhang mit Innenraumhygiene und Nachhaltigkeit
items.Title: (2019) My Future Office

items.Description: Das Training erläutert Ihnen, welche Änderungen die „Revision" der Lebensmittelsicherheitsnorm ISO 22000:2018 mit sich bringt und wie sich diese auswirken. In diesem Seminar erlangen Sie die Kenntnisse und Fähigkeiten, die Sie benötigen, um die Anforderungen der ISO 22000:2018 besser zu verstehen und effektiv zu implementieren. Sie lernen, wie Sie ein FSMS innerhalb einer Organisation aufrechterhalten und Prozesse kontinuierlich verbessern.

items.Audience:
The program will be suitable for business / social entrepreneurs, industry practitioners, educators, trainers and promising talents who are seeking for innovations and impacts.

ABOUT SDGs

The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), which is also known as Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.  It consists of 17 goals with 169 targets covering a wide range of sustainable development issues such as ending poverty and hunger, improving health and education, making cities more sustainable, combating climate change, and protecting oceans and forests.

United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDGs) becomes widely use now. Our Sustainable Development Practitioner Course Series will give you idea of how to change our world towards sustainable future.
items.Description:
The program will introduce the ideas of Demand Chain Management (DCM) / Supply Chain Management (SCM) that disruption for existing practices is needed for corporate sustainability.  It will integrating the ideas of DCM/ SCM with Design Thinking, Mootee (2013)/ entrepreneurial spirit and United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDGs) for synergy and for becoming a sustainable development practitioner which will be demanded in the future world.  

COURSE OUTLINE:

Demand Chain Management and Supply Chain Management

  • Introduction to Demand Chain Management 
  • Introduction to Supply Chain Management
  • Supply Chain Operations Reference Model

Design Thinking/ Entrepreneurial Spirit and Sustainable Development Goals / Mindset

  • Introduction to Design Thinking / Entrepreneurial Spirit in new product/ service development
  • Application of UNSDGs and Sustainable Development Mindset into Demand Chain / Supply Chain Operations  
  • Case study and role play      

Practices for Managing SDGs to Bridge the Gap

  • Introduction to gaps observed and identified
  • Application of SDGs for learning how to achieve good practices in operations 
  • Application of 4Cs / DLDDC Model / SY model/ ISO 100015 training standards for good practices to close the gap
  • Case study / video production 

 

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 100%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course with 100% attendance will be issued a certificate by CCSI and SGS HK Ltd.
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: Hang Seng Management College, Shatin
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking
items.Keywords: SustainableDevelopment, Practitioner, Bridge the Gap, SSSDP, Practitioner
items.Objectives:
ABOUT THE COURSE

This training course is designed by Dr. Shirley Yeung , who is a nominee as  UN Local Change Maker, 2016 with her Training SY Model assessed by SGS, HK. The training contents are innovative to address Global UN Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDGs) adopted by world leaders and implemented locally in HK for a better world.

Our Training Partner, Center for Corporate Sustainability and Innovations (CCSI), is the 1st one and only one in HK to adopt ISO 10015 for training effectiveness under the clientele of SGS, HK.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Dr. YEUNG Mo Ching, shirley - Director, Centre for Corporate Sustainability and Innovations (CCSI), Hang Seng Management College (HSMC) ;nomiee of the UN Local Change Maker, 2016

Dr. Shirley Yeung, an Institute of Environment Management and Assessment (IEMA) approved Sustainability (CSR) Practitioner, RABQSA, ISO9000 Principal Auditor, US, IRCA ISO 9000 Auditor, UK, AQIP Assessor, US, HKCAAVQ Subject Specialist . In 2016, Dr Yeung was one of panels of PRME Colloquium on Higher Education workshop of 7th PRME Asia Forum in Hong Kong. Dr Yeung was also invited by Harvard University, HPAIR to deliver a seminar on "Entrepreneurial Spirit and Sustainable Mindset". In 2015, Dr. Yeung awarded “Pioneer Professor Certificate” from UN Flourish Prizes, US for guiding a student in writing a story on FujiXerox’s sustainable development achievements; and she was also the convener for the 1st Forum on Sustainable Development in Higher Education co-organized with UNESCO, APEID and the Chair of the 2nd International Conference on Supply Chain for Sustainability, Hong Kong.

In 2014, Dr. Yeung was nominated by Nobel Prize Winner for Wenhui (文暉) Award for Educational Innovation, UNESCO, APEID. And, she was a Visiting Scholar of National Taipei University (NTPU), Taiwan and Visiting Professor of Lipscomb University, US. In 2013, Dr. Yeung received professional training certificates from different Schools in Harvard University, US. Also awarded “Fellowship/ FMBA/ Chartered Manager” from Chartered Canadian Institute of Business Administration (CCIBA). Dr. Yeung also awarded the “Outstanding Employee Award” and obtained “Best Teacher Certificate” from HKQAA and Hang Seng School of Commerce (HSSC) in 2006 and 2007 respectively.

items.Description:
This training provides an approach to business management strategy that aims to help you with techniques to manage and develop dynamic teams in order to deliver Lean Six Sigma projects.
 
Our unique blend of theory and practical application provides you with the skills and confidence to deliver both projects and develop coaching skills in other Six Sigma coaches.
 
COST SAVING FROM SUCCESSFUL PROJECTS:

  • Reduce the pre-production lead time non-compliance of selected ladies wear from 58% to 29.1% by saving amount of HK$3.8M in a garment manufacturer
  • Reduce idle material by 20% in shoe manufacturer with saving amount of HK$2M
  • Increase selection rate of cosmetic company product from 75% to 100% with saving amount of HK$6.5M
  • Improve unplanned SMT machine breakdown of from 850hr monthly to 800 hr with saving amount of HK$727K in an electronic company

COURSE OUTLINE:

  1. This is an experimental learning training with extensive Six Sigma real cases will be shared in class
  2. Project Application, apply many practical tools in your Project
  3. Provide a detailed overview of how organizations can use Six Sigma to simultaneously improve quality and reduce costs.
  4. Understand how Six Sigma complements and improves upon other approaches to quality improvement and quality management
  5. Recognize areas of opportunity for Six Sigma approach
  6. Understand how to develop a strategy for deploying Six Sigma within your organization
  7. Written examination
  8. Group project 

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 75%):
SIX SIGMA BLACK BELT (SSBB) Certificate will be issued to those who passed the individual project (50%) and written examination (50%) in proportion administered by SGS Hong Kong Limited; Participants need to fulfill the attendance rate of at least 75% & the overall passing mark of at least 70%
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials
Fee: HK$20,800 / *HK19,760 

*Early Bird Price will be offered to all enrolments made one month prior to the course
items.Keywords: blackbelt, Six Sigma, black belt, MGT/2, BPO/2, BPOSSBB, BPOSSB
items.Objectives:
PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
The trainer has over 25 years of industrial, training and consultancy experience in the field of operations management. As an American Society of Quality (ASQ) certified Six Sigma Black Belt and Master Black Belt for a Fortune 500 company, He has trained over 500 Black Belts and consulted with many organizations in both manufacturing and service industries in China and Hong Kong.
 
Besides, the trainer has incorporate Lean & Kaizen practices into an organization by applying relevant tools such as VSM, waste reduction to achieve a lean result. To name a few about the project, it includes inventory reduction of 20%, lead time reduction of 60% and delivery performance improvement of 30%.

items.Audience: All managers involved in the review and negotiation of commercial contracts but not intended for legal practitioners.
items.Description:
Project managers and professional from other business units involved in the world of contracts must be able to work effectively together and with customers, vendors, suppliers, contractors and subcontractors to accomplish key organisational objectives through complex contracts.  Effective contract negotiation and administration can ensure project success, speed performance and reduce risks and costs along the way.  A solid understanding of the contracting process and contractual terms is critical and can give you an advantage whether you are a customer or supplier.

This course explores a lot of vital issues from the manager’s perspective, highlighting risky clauses and how to counter the effect of these clauses. 

The course is highly interactive and combined with exercises and group discussions to maximize the learning experience. 

PROGRAM HIGHLIGHT:

In additional to training material, samples of

(i) non-disclosure agreement, and

(ii) memorandum of understanding will be provided.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:

Sander TING is a solicitor in Hong Kong and consultant at Ella Cheong Law Office.  Prior to joining Ella Cheong, Sander worked in numerous multi-national corporations and listed companies as their legal advisor.  Sander has advised on many cross-border technology and manufacturing transactions and has developed particular expertise in the area of contract management.  Sander is often involved in complex transactions which requires him to identify and address legal risks and commercial imperatives in a transaction.  Sander has also advised on many cross-border M&A and joint venture deals.

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 100%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking

* 10% discount will be offered to HKIE Members (CPD Code:CPD)
items.Keywords: Effective Contract Management Training, Avoiding Legal Risks in Commercial Contracts, BPOECM, CPD, HKIE
items.Objectives:
The attendees will learn how to -

  • Identify contract components and understand the process from start;
  • Select the right contract type and provisions for their project;
  • Decipher contract legalese; and
  • Negotiate favourable terms and make revisions to the contract.

• Corporate sustainability officers and managers
  • Corporate communications, marketing and responsible investment practitioners;
  • Sustainability communications or assurance consultants;

items.Description:
COURSE OUTLINE:

AGENDA

CONTENT

PART1:
Introduction and background
  • SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT
  • SUSTAINABILITY REPORTING
  • ABOUT GRI
  1. GRI STANDARDS
  2. GRI’S GLOBAL SUSTAINABILITY STANDARDS BOARD (GSSB)
  3. PMULTI-STAKEHOLDER APPROACH

PART 2: Overview of the GRI Standards
  • USEFUL TERMINOLOGY
  • INTRODUCTION TO GRI STANDARDS
  • STRUCTURE OF GRI STANDARDS
  • HOW TO USE THE GRI STANDARDS
  • OTHER STANDARDS AND FRAMEWORKS

Part 3: GRI Standards
  •   UNIVERSAL STANDARDS
  1. GRI 101: FOUNDATION
  2. GRI 102: GENERAL DISCLOSURES
  3. GRI 103: MANAGEMENT APPROACH
  •   TOPIC-SPECIFIC STANDARDS

PART 4:  Start your reporting process using the GRI Standards
  • APPLYING THE REPORTING PRINCIPLES
  • REPORTING GENERAL DISCLOSURES
  • IDENTIFYING MATERIAL TOPICS AND BOUNDARIES
  • REPORTING ON MATERIAL TOPICS
  • REPORTING IN ACCORDANCE
  • PRESENTING AND COMPILING INFORMATION
  • END OF COURSE EXERCISE 

PART 5: Additional resources
  • GRI SUPPORT SUITE
  • GETTING INVOLVED
  • USEFUL RESOURCES
  • END OF COURSE EVALUATION

Professional GRI Nominated Trainer possessing a Pass in GRI G4 Exam with considerable field and theoretical background.

items.Keywords: GRI, GRI Standards Certified Training Course, SSGRIS, CPD, HKIE
items.Objectives:
The current climate of international and local business is requiring companies to be more transparent and to consider the full impact of their activities policies. Following the surge in production of ESG/CSR/Sustainability Reports, there is now added pressure for independent verification of these reports against the most recognised international standards such as Global Reporting Initiative (GRI).

This program gives you knowledge of the GRI Standards and reporting to facilitate their use within your organization. 

Whether you are thinking about preparing your first report, or you’re a seasoned sustainability specialist, you can learn the  latest reporting knowledge and skills with our Professional GRI Nominated Trainer. The Certified Training Course helps you develop your sustainability reporting know-how, so you can run a smooth and effective reporting process, producing the best possible GRI report.

There’s a lot to learn when it comes to sustainability reporting, and the Certified Training Course offers you the way through the five phases in the GRI sustainability reporting process, focusing on local sustainability issues throughout with reference to HKEx ESG Reporting Guide.

Signing up for a course means you will be building your knowledge, gaining skills and improving your report. You will leave with a certificate and a toolkit for success.

BENEFITS OF THIS COURSE:

  • Standardized training materials directly certified by GRI;

items.Audience:
This course is directed toward those who are responsible for research, development, manufacture, marketing, quality, and/or regulatory compliance involved in one or more stages of the life-cycle of medical device.

The course will benefit individuals whose job functions include operations governed or overseen by various regulations including personnel involved in preparing for, participating in and responding to medical device inspections.
items.Description:
This program is designed to provide attendees with the tools and knowledge necessary to upgrade their quality system to an international recognized medical device standard.

In addition to providing the requirement for compliance with the latest standard - ISO 13485:2016, attendees will learn how to prepare, manage and successfully complete an inspection by the certification bodies.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
Personnel attending this program will have an opportunity to learn how to prepare for an ISO 13485 audit, what to expect during interaction with auditors and how to respond to the findings.

Additionally, this course provides compressive review on the latest ISO 13485:2016 which including the new requirements in version 2016 and its relationship with ISO 9001:2015.

This course is a good refresher for all personnel involved in the medical device business and an opportunity to compare your internal audit system against what a leading internal audit expert believes is the best approach to implement. The course is provided in an informal atmosphere and an easily understood format.  A test will be arranged during the course.

items.Description:
This training has been designed to help demonstrate commitment to quality and customer satisfaction, as well as continuously improving your quality management systems (QMS). The objective of the training is to provide participants with an overview of the purpose and requirements of ISO 9001 as a tool for business improvement.


Prior Knowledge Requirements

Before starting this course, you must inform students that they are expected to have the following prior knowledge:

a) Management systems

  • The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle
  • The core elements of a management system and the interrelationship between top management responsibility, policy, objective, planning, implementation, measurement, review and continual improvement.

b) Quality management

The fundamental concepts and the seven quality management principles (see ISO 9001)

  • Customer focus
  • Leadership
  • Engagement of people
  • Process approach
  • Improvement
  • Evidence-based decision making
  • Relationship management
  • The relationship between quality management and customer satisfaction.

c) Quality management terms and definitions

The commonly used quality management terms and definitions (see ISO 9000)


IRCA Accreditation

We are accredited by the International Register of Certified Auditors (IRCA) globally. This course is accredited by IRCA, 17992 - FD 116.

Trusted ISO 9001 foundation training from a leading course provider

Our courses are delivered by tutors who are quality management system experts and experienced trainers. Your knowledge and skills will be developed through an interactive and practical approach to learning. Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are assessed and are required to pass the continuous assessment.

Contact your local SGS office for full details of the courses available in your region.


Remarks:

  • Course successful completion only satisfies part of the requirement for certification of auditor.
  • The successful completion certificate is valid for 5 years for the purpose of certification by IRCA. 


CERTIFICATION (ATTENDANCE 100%)

Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued an attendance certificate by IRCA.

items.Description:
Social Accountability 8000 (SA8000®) is the first global standard for ethical sourcing which is applicable to most industries worldwide. The Standard was initially published in October 1997 by Social Accountability International SAI (previously called CEPAA). “The SA8000 Standard, established by SAI and one of the world’s preeminent social standards, is a tool for implementing international labor standards to protect workers along each step of the supply chain.” It sets out specific auditable provisions regarding child labor, forced labor, health and safety, trade union rights, discrimination, disciplinary practices, compensation, working hours and management system.  SGS  is the world’s leading certification body in CSR field. We have conducted thousands of independent audits against the requirements of companies’ code of conduct. Some of our clients are: Avon, Disney and McDonalds etc.

 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  • The development of SA8000 and why;
  • What is SA8000?;
  • Basic requirements of SA8000:2014, their intent and  interpretation;
  • The benefits of SA8000 certification;
  • Highlight on applicable law and regulations;
  • Effective development and implementation of SA8000 management system & achieve certification

 
PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Registered Lead Auditor and SGS approved tutor with considerable field and theoretical background.

items.Description:
COURSE OUTLINE:

1. Stories in presentations bring to life abstract data

  • How to enable listeners to better hear, understand and remember what you say
  • Make sweet reason has its place

2. The art of good storyteller

  • Plain (Keep it simple)
  • Light (Make sure your story is appropriate to your audience)
  • Obvious (Be clear and focused)
  • Tight (Keep it short)

3. How to give your story a heart

  • Create and satisfy desire
  • Make it memorable
  • Be conversational
  • Respect your listeners

4. 8 classic storytelling techniques for presentations

  • Monomyth (hero’s journey)
  • The mountain
  • Nested loops
  • Sparkline
  • In medias res
  • Converging ideas
  • False start
  • Petal Structure

5. How to make your customer the hero

  • What is your hero’s power?
  • How did your hero become ‘super’?
  • What threatens your hero?
  • What drives your hero to do well?

6. The power of storytelling

  • Telling your stories helps you to express what makes you different in the workplace

WORKSHOP FORMAT:

  • Lecture
  • Discussion and reflection
  • Role plays
  • Practice and feedback

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 100%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

items.Keywords: Storytelling for Engaging Presentation , CEMSEP, CPD, HKIE
items.Objectives:
Storytelling is your most powerful means of communication. It connected people. The most successful presenters are storytellers, by mastering business storytelling skills to achieve business results.

After a presentation, 63% of audience remembers stories but ONLY 5% remember statistics (Source: Authors Chip & Dan Heath). Stories work and stories have value because they help audience understand the facts and raw data with business meaning. Stories are how we best learn and visualize information, simplify and clarify even the most complex information. We can hook an audience with emotion. What's more, stories help people remember what they have heard.

OBJECTIVES:

  • Build engagement and inspire people to take action
  • Master storytelling techniques in business presentation
  • Understand your audience and match your stories relevant to their experience and interests
  • Apply emotional power to the stories by eye focus, voice, posture and gestures to have a much better chance of resonating with the listeners
  • Master the art as a good communicator to incorporate storytelling seamlessly into “best and natural style”

  • Designed and delivered well-received personal effectiveness and leadership programs, including Effective Communication, Customer Services, Professional Image, Business Etiquette and Presentation Skills for Retail, Manufacturing, Telecommunication, Information Technology and Hospitality Sectors in Hong Kong and the Mainland China

items.Audience: Existing and potential young executives who have the roles and responsibilities to lead and develop a team of young members.
items.Description:
​COURSE OUTLINE:

The course consists of two parts. The first part is about the right mind set and right management skills that modern managers should possess for managing the new generation workforce. The second part is about using the right system and tools to manage the results.

Part 1: Mindsets and Skills 

(1) Communication (對嘴溝通力) - talk as equal peers, never talk down

(2) Motivation (勁爆推動力) - be encouraging, nurture and do not beat people up

(3) Leadership (Orz領導力) - ‘easier to command, better to inspire’ and provide direction

(4) Affinity (真-親和力) - be inclusive, make it enjoyable, equal respect and, ‘be a partner, not a boss’ , establish friendship

(5) Execution (神級執行力) - don’t be ordering, don’t stereotype, allow freedom but provide clear goals and flexible process

Part 2: System and Tools: PDCA Management System v2.0

Using the PDCA management system ver.2.0, tools and techniques to apply the skills that participants learned from part 1 in order to create behaviourial change and achieve tangible results such as higher productivity, improved services and cost savings. The Management System to be presented will be focusing on the following key elements and tools : Plan > Do > Check > Act

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:

Paul Ma

Paul has over 20 years of managerial experience in HR, learning and development. His areas of expertise include customer service system, brand culture building, operation efficiency system and managerial development scheme. He has been serving as the Chairman of Hong Kong Retail Management Association Service & Courtesy Award from 2001, 2002, 2008 to 2016. Paul is also currently serving the working committee of Accreditation of Assessment Agency (RPL- Retail).

(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)

Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

items.Keywords: LSHM; The HEA Management Style, CPD, HKIE
items.Objectives:
The young executives are gradually becoming team leads or department managers in the job market. As they are facing different challenges while managing the new generations workforce. The leadership and management style they learned from their seniors are no longer applicable now.

The challenges that they are currently facing are:

  • Being seen roistering when they follow the old school management style
  • Confronting team members but afraid of jeopardizing their relationships
  • Experiencing discipline issues with subordinates
  • Communicating the right ways with new generations
  • Addressing different life value of younger generation
  • Searching for the appropriate motivational factors for new generation

The “HEA! Management Style” is designed for the characteristics of modern managers to manage the new generation workforce. It emphasizes on “Working smart not working hard!”, “Do less for more” and the “80/20” philosophy (不做多餘嘢！). All it does is to help new managers to stay focus on the key issues and deliver the results in this challenging time

COURSE STRUCTURE:

We believe that the best way to learn is by doing therefore this course is designed as an experiential training workshop. It is more than just being fun, entertaining and easily applicable to on the job responsibility. Participants will learn the theory by actual experience it through games and exercises. The whole process will make sure participants are fully involved, engaged and get the best out of the workshop. The course will take approximately 6 hours. Specific fun games and business relevant exercises will be designed to process all the learning topics. There will be debriefing after each exercise to elaborate and reinforce the application of theories into real business environment. The training approach of this course is illustrated.

The benefits of PDCA system and tools are as follows:

  • It enables modern managers to establish standards of performance, and Customer Service requirements for the purposes of planning and scheduling.
  • It enables modern managers to organise plan and assign the work within the agreed needs of the business.
  • It enables modern managers to follow-up on work assignments to ensure that work is completed on time to service standards, and conforms to all business requirements.
  • It enables modern managers to monitor progress (evaluating progress on a short interval basis allows managers to compare where performance is to where it should be). Problems are identified and categorised within a real time frame, and corrective action can be initiated to ensure all off schedule conditions are addressed.
items.Title: (CPD Program) The “HEA! Management Style” for Modern Managers

items.Description:
This workshop will show you the skills to improve your public image and readiness on crisis management in Food Industry. Using management tools to prepare for crisis management plans by running regular simulations can sharpen responses and expose gaps in a food safety management. Also, practice the crisis management plan developed in the class, ensuring that participants gained experience on handling the difficult situation.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

Preparation for Crisis:

  • ISO 22000 / FSSC22000 requirement on Emergency response and product withdraw
  • Establish Crisis management team, roles within the team
  • Establish a procedure (information that needed on this procedure)
  • Consideration on alternative sourcing and emergency supplies
  • Mock exercise for emergency response procedure
  • Review of the effectiveness of the crisis management response

items.Description:
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), EU’s new framework for data protection will come into full force on 25 May 2018 and will overhaul the way the companies handle and process personal data. The GDPR applies to the personal data of a natural person who is in EU. The law not only applies to organizations in EU, it also applies to all companies processing and holding personal data in EU, regardless of their location. When the GDPR comes into effect, all companies, based inside Europe or not, have to comply with the Regulation if they collect, store, and/or process any personal data in EU.

COURSE OUTLINE(1 DAY) :

 

PREPARE TO BE GDPR-READY!

The following topics will be covered in this 1-day course.

The objective of this course is to provide the attendees with the high-level requirements, key changes that matter the most and the most significant actions companies should take to comply with the Regulation.

CERTIFICATION:
Learners who attend the full course and pass the exam will be issued a certificate by SGS HK

GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

*Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking

To learn how SGS can help you overcome the legal challenges, contact hk.cbe@sgs.com for more information

GRI Standards are periodically reviewed to provide the best and most up-to-date standards for effective sustainability reporting. This course allows the trainee to make a smooth transition from GRI G4 Guidelines to GRI Standards and provide an insight on the differences between GRI G4 Guidelines and GRI Standards. The GRI Standards were released in October 2016 and will be fully effective in July 2018.

items.Objectives:
COURSE OUTLINE:

Part 1: GRI Standards Introduction

1.1 – Why transition to GRI Standards

1.2 – What does transition to GRI Standards mean

1.3 – Summary of main features

1.4 – Benefits of the new Standards

1.5 – Main G4 concepts and disclosures carry through

 

Part 2: Overview of the GRI Standards

2.1 – How to use the Standards

2.2 – New structure and format

2.3 – Summary of content clarifications

2.4 – Employee/worker terminology revision

 

Part 3: Universal Standards

3.1 – GRI 101: Foundation

3.2 – GRI 102: General Disclosures

3.3 – GRI 103: Management Approach

 

Part 4: Topic-specific Standards

4.1 – Overview of the topic-specific Standards

4.2 – Merged Aspects

4.3 – Group Exercise 1

 

Part 5: Key content clarifications

5.1 – Clarification of the term ‘Impacts’

5.2 – Topic boundary

5.3 – Reporting on material topics not covered by the GRI Standards

5.4 – Group Exercise 2

 

Part 6: Additional Resources

6.1 – Resources to support your transition to GRI Standards reporting

6.2 – Resources about the transition to GRI Standards project

items.Keywords: GRI, GRI Standards Certified Training Course, SSGRIS
items.Objectives:
The current climate of international and local business is requiring companies to be more transparent and to consider the full impact of their activities policies. Following the surge in production of ESG/CSR/Sustainability Reports, there is now added pressure for independent verification of these reports against the most recognised international standards such as Global Reporting Initiative (GRI).

This program gives you knowledge of the GRI Standards and reporting to facilitate their use within your organization. 

Whether you are thinking about preparing your first report, or you’re a seasoned sustainability specialist, you can learn the  latest reporting knowledge and skills with our Professional GRI Nominated Trainer. The Certified Training Course helps you develop your sustainability reporting know-how, so you can run a smooth and effective reporting process, producing the best possible GRI report.

There’s a lot to learn when it comes to sustainability reporting, and the Certified Training Course offers you the way through the five phases in the GRI sustainability reporting process, focusing on local sustainability issues throughout with reference to HKEx ESG Reporting Guide.

Signing up for a course means you will be building your knowledge, gaining skills and improving your report. You will leave with a certificate and a toolkit for success.

BENEFITS OF THIS COURSE:

  • Standardized training materials directly certified by GRI;
  • Hands-on and step-by-step instruction on applying GRI Standards with HKEx ESG Reporting Guide;
  • Interactive learning through real-life case studies from Hong Kong;
  • Receive GRI certified training certificate upon successful completion (and examination) of the training course;

items.Audience: Anyone implementing or auditing against the Global Standard for Storage and Distribution.
items.Description:
HACCP (Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points) is an internationally accepted technique for preventing microbiological, chemical and physical contamination along the food supply chain. It is a system that identifies where hazard might occur in the food production process and puts in place control measures to prevent the hazard from occurring.

The course aims to introduce the requirements of HACCP Management System and impart knowledge, and to understand the infrastructure needed to implement the HACCP system. The in-depth knowledge of HACCP auditing and certification process will also be included.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  • Overview of HACCP requirements
  • Seven principles of HACCP for managing risks associated with food and beverage safety
  • Developing and implementing an HACCP Plan
  • HACCP auditing techniques and certification process
  • Test

items.Description:
This program is designed to provide attendees with the tools and knowledge necessary to upgrade their quality system to an international recognized medical device standard.

In addition to providing the requirement for compliance with the latest standard - ISO 13485:2016, attendees will learn how to prepare, manage and successfully complete an inspection by the certification bodies.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
Personnel attending this program will have an opportunity to learn how to prepare for an ISO 13485 audit, what to expect during interaction with auditors and how to respond to the findings.

Additionally, this course provides compressive review on the latest ISO 13485:2016 which including the new requirements in version 2016 and its relationship with ISO 9001:2015.

This course is a good refresher for all personnel involved in the medical device business and an opportunity to compare your internal audit system against what a leading internal audit expert believes is the best approach to implement. The course is provided in an informal atmosphere and an easily understood format.  A test will be arranged during the course.

items.Certificate_PDF_Template: 521 - IRCA - Generic Certificate of Successful Completion
items.Description:
This training is designed to give you the relevant skills and knowledge to carry out audits of environmental management systems (EMS) against ISO 14001.

IRCA Accreditation
We are accredited by the International Register of Certified Auditors (IRCA) globally. This course is accredited by IRCA, 17972 - PR 315.

Prior Knowledge Requirements

Before starting this course, you must inform students that they are expected to have the following prior knowledge:

  1. Management systems
  • The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle
  • The core elements of a management system and the interrelationship between top management responsibility, policy, objectives, planning, implementation, measurement, review, and continual improvement
  1. Environmental management

The intended outcomes of an environmental management system:

  • Enhancement of environmental performance
  • Fulfilment of compliance obligations
  • Achievement of environmental objectives
  1. ISO 14001

Knowledge of the requirements of ISO 14001 and the commonly used environmental management terms and definitions, as given in ISO 14001, which may be gained by completing an IRCA certified EMS Foundation Training course or the equivalent.
 

Trusted ISO 14001 Lead auditor training from a leading course provider

Our courses are delivered by tutors who are environmental management system experts and experienced trainers. Your knowledge and skills will be developed through an interactive and practical approach to learning. Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete an end-of-course written examination.

Contact your local SGS office for full details of the courses available in your region.
items.Keywords: ISO 14001, ISO 14001:2015, Environment, Environmental, Management Systems, Lead Auditor, EMS, Environmental Management Systems.
items.Objectives:
What will you learn on our ISO 14001 lead auditor course?
On completion of the training you will be able to:
 

  • Apply an in-depth knowledge of the purpose of an environmental management systems and the ISO 14001 audit and certification process
  • Describe the principles, processes and techniques used for the assessment and management of risk and the significance of these in all environmental management systems
  • Explain the purpose, content and inter-relationship of ISO 14001, the ISO 14000 series guidance standards and the legislative framework relevant to an EMS
  • Apply the skills and knowledge needed to conduct third party audits against the requirements of the ISO 14001 Environmental Management Systems
  • undertake the role of an auditor to plan, conduct, report and follow-up an audit in accordance with ISO 19011 and by interpreting the requirements of ISO 14001.    

Please note: For this course a split date 5-day option is available. This gives you time to reflect on new material before you sit the final exam.

items.Audience: This course is suitable for personnel with roles and responsibilities in the development, implementation & management of Environmental Management System, and in particular senior management staff of EMS certified organizations, in particular IRCA Registered Auditors.
items.Description:
This training course with two modules consists of introduction of features of Annex SL and content relating to ISO 14001:2015 requirements. The purpose of this IRCA recognized course is to equip participants with an understanding of the difference between ISO 14001:2004 and ISO 14001:2015. By undertaking the transition training at the earliest opportunity, you can also equip yourself with the knowledge and understanding to audit against these new standards, placing yourself ahead of the competition.


COURSE OUTLINE:

  1. Introduction of Annex SL and High Level Structure;
  2. Scope and structure of ISO 14001;
  3. Discuss key differences in ISO 14001:2015 to ISO 14001:2004;

Delegate needs to submit certificate for approval in advance. 3. A 17905).

items.Description:
ISO 14001 is now the most recognized Environmental Management System (EMS) standard. It provides the most effective way to assist organizations to continually improve their ability in identifying, minimizing, avoiding and managing environmental impacts.

  1. Introduction of Annex SL and High Level Structure;
  2. Incorporation of risk based thinking and determination of Context of the Organization in Environmental Management System;
  3. ISO 14001 requirements and Standard Interpretation;
  4. The management systems approach to managing environmental risks and opportunities

items.Description:
This is a 2-days training course and it is comprehensive to provide delegates with practical workshops on environmental Management System (EMS), and demonstrate general way to establish practical environmental documentation in accordance with the ISO 14001:2015 standard. This course will help delegates to gain understanding in ISO 14001:2015  and assist them to develop their own EMS.

COURSE OUTLINE:

1) Basic understanding of ISO 14001:2015 EMS under high-level structure (Annex SL)

2) Use of Risk-Based Thinking via Plan-Do-Check-Act  (PDCA) approach

3) Demonstration of effective general ways for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continual improving the EMS

4) Introduction of system documentations

5) How to prepare documented EMS procedures

6) How to establish and maintain EMS records

7) How to tackle certification audit

8) Cases studies and examples discussion

The tutor is registered Lead Auditor and SGS-approved Tutor with extensive audit experience and theoretical knowledge.

items.Audience: This course is designed for experienced food safety professionals with an understanding on the management system approach to food safety and the skills required to internal audit effectively against FSMS.
items.Description:
Food safety management systems (FSMS) are intended to provide organizations with the elements of an effective food safety system in order to achieve the best practice in food safety and to maintain economic goals.  The intention is that these systems may be integrated with other management requirements such as those for quality and the environment. The system upon which this Course is based is the ISO 22000:2005;
Food safety management systems – Requirements for any organization in the food chain. This Standard has been developed in response to customer demands for a recognizable Standard against which an FSMS can be audits may be conducted and the organization certificated.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  1. Introduction to food safety management systems auditing
  2. Food safety hazards and control measures
  3. Processed-based FSMS
  4. Audits: definition and principles
  5. Planning and preparing for the internal audit
  6. Conducting the audit.
  7. Audit reporting and follow-up

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Lead auditor in SAS/UKAS accredited ISO 22000:2005 certification scheme. Our facilitators, with food focused academic and work background, had plenty of food management system audit experience from various food industries.

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 80%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking

Remark: This course doesn’t cover interpretation of ISO 22000:2005 requirements. Delegates who are not familiar with the requirements should attend ISO 22000: 2005 Foundation Training Course first.

items.Audience: Those who audit an organization's processes as part of the internal audit program
items.Description:
Information security management systems (ISMS) are intended to provide organisations with the elements of an effective information security system in order to achieve the best practice in information security and to maintain economic goals. ISO 27001 also provides requirements for ISMS to enable an organisation to establish, implement, operate, monitor, review, maintain and improve a documented ISMS within the context of the organisation’s overall business risks. This course will equip delegates with knowledge and skills required to perform audits of information security management systems against the national and international specifications, standards, statutory requirements and regulations
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  1.  Introduction to information security management systems
  2.  Process-based ISMS
  3.  Audit definition and principles
  4.  Planning and preparing for the internal audit
  5.  On-site audit activities
  6.  Audit reporting and follow-up
  7.  Auditor competence and certification

 
PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Mr. Chris Yau - Senior Manager, Global Product Management, IRCA Certified ISO 27001 Lead Tutor and RABQSA registered ISO 27001 Lead Auditor with over 15 years of security-related audit and teaching experience including information security, cargo and freight security. He is also a lead auditor in ISO  9001, ISO  14001, ISO 28000, and ISO 20000.
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 

​CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 80%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

items.Description:
This training is designed to give you the relevant skills and knowledge to carry out audits of Quality Management Systems (QMS) against the ISO 9001  requirements. The principles of ISO 9001 set out an explicit management system to audit, examine and continually improve systems for a QMS.

IRCA Accreditation

We are accredited by the International Register of Certified Auditors (IRCA) globally. This course is accredited by IRCA, 17977 - PR 328.

Prior Knowledge Requirements

  1. Management systems
  • The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle
  • The core elements of a management system and the interrelationship between top management responsibility, policy, objectives, planning, implementation, measurement, review, and continual improvement
  1. Quality management

The fundamental concepts and the seven quality management principles (see ISO 9000):

  • Customer focus
  • Leadership
  • Engagement of people
  • Process approach
  • Improvement
  • Evidence-based decision making
  • Relationship management
  • The relationship between quality management and customer satisfaction.
  1. ISO 9001

Knowledge of the requirements of ISO 9001 and the commonly used quality management terms and definitions, as given in ISO 9001, which may be gained by completing an IRCA certified QMS Foundation Training course or the equivalent.

Trusted ISO 9001 lead auditor training from a leading course provider

Our courses are delivered by tutors who are quality management system experts and experienced trainers. Your knowledge and skills will be developed through an interactive and practical approach to learning. Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete an end-of-course written examination.
 

Remarks:

  • Course successful completion only satisfies part of the requirement for certification of auditor.
  • The successful completion certificate is valid for 3 years for the purpose of certification by IRCA. 

CERTIFICATION (ATTENDANCE 100%)

Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate of Successful Completion by IRCA, which designate fulfillment of the training requirements for IRCA Lead Auditor registration.

Orginal Price: 12,500  Membership Promotion: $10,000
items.Keywords: QMS, ISO 9001, Quality Management Systems, Quality, Lead Auditor.
items.Objectives:
What will you learn on our ISO 9001 lead auditor course?

On completion of the training you will be able to:
  • Describe the purpose of a quality management system and explain the eight principles of quality management
  • Explain the purpose, content and interrelationship of the ISO 9000 family of standards
  • Interpret the requirements of ISO 9001 in the context of an audit
  • Plan and conduct an audit and report on the audit in a manner that adds value to the organization
  • Meet the training requirements for registration as a QMS Auditor or Lead Auditor with the IRCA
items.Title: (For Promotion) ISO 9001:2015 - Quality Management Systems Auditor/Lead Auditor Training Course

items.Audience: This course is suitable for personnel with roles and responsibilities in the development, implementation & management of Quality Management Systems, and in particular senior management staff of QMS certified organizations, in particular IRCA Registered Auditors.
items.Description:
This training course with two modules consists of introduction of features of Annex SL and content relating to ISO 9001:2015 requirements. By undertaking  the transition training at the earliest opportunity, you can equip yourself with the knowledge and understanding to audit against these new standards, placing yourself ahead of the competition.


COURSE OUTLINE:

1. Introduction of Annex SL and  new ISO High Level Structure;
2. Scope and structure of ISO 9001:2015;
3. Discuss key differences in ISO 9001:2015 to ISO 9001:2008;
4. Specific new requirements on leadership, context and risk-based thinking;
5. Roadmap to transition arrangement of QMS certification;
6. Test

Exemption:

Delegate who has successfully completed the IRCA Certified ANNEX SL Auditor Course (IRCA Registration no. A 17902) can exempt the 1st day training of the course.
Delegate needs to submit certificate for approval in advance.
Delegate who successfully completed the 2nd day training and passed the exam will be only issued a certificate - ISO 9001:2015 Module 2 – Auditor Transition Course by IRCA (IRCA Registration no. A 17906)
Remark: For IRCA Registration, those who may apply for IRCA’s ISO 9001:2015 auditor status (any grade) may need to present their ISO 9001:2008 course certificates to IRCA.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER: 
The tutor is registered IRCA Lead Auditor and  approved tutor with considerable audit experience and knowledge.

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 100%):

Delegates who successfully completed the course and passed the test will be issued Two Certificates by IRCA, which designate fulfillment of the training requirements for updating Auditor registration from ISO 9001:2008 to ISO 9001:2015.

(IRCA No.: M1: A17902: M2: A17906 Certified Course)   

GUIDELINE for IRCA REGISTERED AUDITOR

As refer to IRCA link: http://www.irca.org/en-gb/training/Transition-training/Transition/About-transition-courses

items.Audience: Professional / personnel who are likely or currently involved in implementing and maintaining an Energy Management System to meet the ISO 50001 Standard. Personnel who wish to know more about the standard and its requirements.
items.Description:
With increasing pressures on organizations to improve energy efficiency and reduce costs, effective management of resources is now more essential than ever.

The purpose of this course is to make learners aware of the differences between ISO/DIS 50001:2017 and ISO 50001: 2011.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  • Session 1: ISO/DIS 50001:2017: Overview and Clauses 4-6
  • Session 2: ISO/DIS 50001:2017 Clause 7: Support
  • Session 3: ISO/DIS 50001:2017 Clause 8: Operation
  • Session 4: ISO/DIS 50001:2017 Clauses 9 and 10

 

PRIOR KNOWLEDGE:

  • Before starting this course, Learners are expected to have the following prior knowledge:
  • Knowledge of the requirements of ISO 50001:2011.
  • Knowledge of the following energy management principles and concepts:
  • The principles of fuel combustion, heat transfer and energy flow.
  • The relevant sources of energy regulation, guidelines and standards.
  • The typical methods and technologies for increasing energy efficiency.
  • Interpret energy measurement units, sources, costs, tariffs and scheduling.
  • Energy use data analysis methods.
  • Energy baseline, energy performance indicators, monitoring and performance measurement.
  • The impact of organisational processes and equipment on energy efficiency.

 

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Registered EnMS Lead Auditor and IRCA approved tutor with considerable field and theoretical background.

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 100%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

items.Description:
ISO 22000 lead auditor training from SGS teaches you the skills required to audit a food safety management system (FSMS).On this training course you will learn to assess the design, implementation and improvement of a FSMS against the requirements of ISO 22000.

IRCA Accreditation

SGS are accredited by the International Register of Certified Auditors (IRCA) globally.  This course is accredited by IRCA, reference number 17304 - PR 318.

Prior Knowledge Requirements

Prior to attending this training course, learners must have knowledge of ISO 22000 or acceptable equivalent standard and the following food safety management principles and concepts:

• Implementing or operating a management system within a food sector context. This includes private schemes such as BRC, GLOBALGAP, FSSC and/or other schemes which include management system components.

• Relevant key food safety legislation (this may be specific to students’ food industry context and location).

• ISO 22000 and also of prerequisite programmes as specified in ISO/TS 22002-1.

• Good Practice guides for Agriculture (GAP), Veterinary (GVP), Manufacturing (GMP), Hygiene (GHP), Production (GPP), Distribution (GDP) and/or Trading (GTP) depending on the segment of the food chain in which the student operates.

• The principles of HACCP as defined by the Codex Alimentarius Commission.

Trusted ISO 22000 FSMS training from a leading course provider

Our courses are delivered by tutors who are food safety management system experts and experienced trainers. Your knowledge and skills will be developed through an interactive and practical approach to learning. . Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete a midcourse test along with an end-of-course written examination.

Contact your local SGS office for full details of the courses available in your region.
items.Keywords: ISO 22000, Food Safety, Food management system
items.Objectives:
What will you learn on our ISO 22000 lead auditor course?
On completion of the training you will be able to:

  • Possess in-depth knowledge of the ISO 22000 audit and certification process
  • Have the skills and knowledge needed to conduct third party audits against the requirements of ISO 22000
  • Be able to support your claim as part of the overall requirements for registration as a Registered Lead Auditor

Please note, before attending this training you must have the following:

  • Experience of working within the food chain (including implementing or operating a management system)
  • Understanding of relevant key food safety legislation
  • Completion of prerequisite courses (Introduction & Awareness ISO 22000 and ISO 22000 Internal Auditor)
  • Knowledge of Good Practice guides for Agriculture (GAP), Veterinary (GVP), Manufacturing (GMP), Hygiene (GHP), Production (GPP), Distribution (GDP) and/or Trading (GTP) – depending on your food chain segment
  • Understanding of the principles of HACCP as defined by the Codex Alimentarius

 

Remarks:

  • Course successful completion only satisfies part of the requirement for certification of auditor.
  • The successful completion certificate is valid for 3 years for the purpose of certification by IRCA. 

CERTIFICATION (ATTENDANCE 100%)

Delegates who successfully completed the course and passed the continuous assessment & written examination will be issued a Certificate of Successful Completion by IRCA, which designate fulfillment of the training requirements for IRCA FSMS Auditor/Lead Auditor registration.

The personnel who need to:

  • Set up and/or implement a Social Accountability System;
  • Understand the SA System for further planning and action in order to meet the needs of customers;
  • Carry out audit for suppliers/ vendors and/ or their own companies’ SA System;
  • Conduct any social audit and / or 3rd party SA8000 audit

 

SUGGESTED PRE-REQUISITE BY Social Accountability Accreditation Services (SAAS):

  • It is suggested that  students attending this course should understand fundamental auditing principles and protocols at a basic level;
  • It is recommended that all students have at least a familiarity with ISO/IEC 19011 before attending
  • For those who would like to take Module 2, it is a must to take the Module 1 in advance as entry requirement;
items.Description:
Social Accountability 8000 (SA8000®) is the first global standard for ethical sourcing which is applicable to most industries worldwide. The Standard was initially published in October 1997 by Social Accountability International SAI (previously called CEPAA). “The SA8000 Standard, established by SAI and one of the world’s preeminent social standards, is a tool for implementing international labor standards to protect workers along each step of the supply chain.” It sets out specific auditable provisions regarding child labor, forced labor, health and safety, trade union rights, discrimination, disciplinary practices, compensation, working hours and management system.  SGS  is the world’s leading certification body in CSR field. We have conducted thousands of independent audits against the requirements of companies’ code of conduct. Some of our clients are: Avon, Disney and McDonalds etc.

The 5 Days SA8000 Basic Auditor Training Course has recently been updated to reflect the SA8000:2014 changes as well as incorporating the emerging issues and techniques in the field of social compliance auditing. The Basic course has drawn auditors, corporate compliance staff, managers from brands, retailers and manufacturers, government officials, academics, and trade union and NGO representatives. 

As of July 1, 2015, the SA8000 Basic Auditor training course has been fully updated and is now structured differently. This course now takes a Modular Approach, so that our increasingly diverse audiences can tailor the training for their needs:

SGS Academy is one of the few organizations to be able to run the above course and has an extensive CSR and SA training portfolio. In Hong Kong and China we have taught thousands of delegates from different industries such as toys & gifts, textile & garments from organizations such as retailers, agents/ suppliers, factories and consultant firms.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  • Module 1: 3 days Basic Social Auditing Course. 
  • Module 2: 2 days Introduction to SA8000 Course. 
  • Test

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Registered SA 8000 Lead Auditor, SAAS and SGS approved tutor with considerable field and theoretical background in Social Systems.
 
CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 100%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course and passed the written examination will be issued a Certificate of Successful Completion by SAI

GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC
Medium: (Chinese class) Cantonese supplemented with English materials
                (English class) English supplemented with English materials     

*Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking
items.Keywords: SAAS, SA 8000, SA8000, basic auditor,(SS/8) 2014, SS/8, SSABA, SSSABA
items.Objectives:
• To provide delegates with a detailed understanding of the criteria of SA8000:2014 Standard, the background of the social responsibility movement in the market place, the roles of NGOs and other interested parties
  • To enable delegates obtaining the techniques and skills to audit a social accountability system
