items.Description:
SGS Hong Kong recognizes the increasing future demands of the ever-changing regulatory and quality landscape. SGS Hong Kong launches Professional Certificate in Medical Device Regulatory Affairs & Quality Assurance Programme in collaboration with regulatory specialist from May 2015 to address Medical device regulations  that are coming up in Asia, European and International markets.

The SPECIALTY consists of 3 modules designed to address the fundamental requirements for managing medical device. By describing the medical device regulations in various regions, including the EU, the United States, ASEAN, China and as well as local regulations, the modules provides practical experiences, face-to-face tuition in professional level details to prepare candidates for the challenging and ever-growing role of acting as a regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialist in today’s medical device industry. 

PROGRAMME STRUCTURE:

Specialty A  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Regulation Management​

(MDMDM) Medical Device Management - 1 day

  • Understanding the basics of medical device,  and health technology assessment, regulation and management (HTA, HTR and HTM) of the MD life cycle.

(MDMDR) Medical Device Regulation - 2 days

  • Understanding regulation ensures public health benefit and the safety of patients, health care workers and the community through regulatory guidance, training, coordination and promotion of international best practices harmonization.

(MDMDC) Medical Device  Regulation for specific countries - 3 days

  • Exploring the characteristics and differences between the US regulatory requirements and those of the European medical devices directives as well as other regions such as China, ASEAN and Hong Kong.

GENERAL INFORMATION:

Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

Orginal Price: 12,650  Membership Promotion (25% Off): $9,487.5
items.Keywords: MDD, Medical Device, MDRM, Professional Certificate for Medical Device Regulation Management (Specialty A)
items.Objectives:
WORK WITH A CERTIFICATION PARTNER WHO IS CONSTANTLY UP-TO-DATE AND ABLE TO HELP YOU STAY AHEAD OF GLOBAL MEDICAL DEVICE REQUIREMENTS

PREPARATION FOR FUTURE REGULATIONS:

The regulatory frameworks guiding access for medical devices into different markets are frequently evolving and updating. The only way to ensure your products continue to meet the necessary requirements is to work with a certification partner who is constantly up-to-date and who  is therefore able to help you stay ahead of the changing requirements. With our support you stay aware of future changes, SGS enables you to stay close to the current requirements of market applications in line with the varying requirements of different counties and in particular, an emphasis in European and CE mark requirements.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Ir Prof. Albert Poon, CCE, CEng, FIET, FHKIE, FCIE - Associate Specialist, Medical Device Program of SGS Academy, Chairman of Biomedical Discipline Assessment Panel of HKIE, Education & Training Committee Member of IUPESM (IFMBE & IOMP)
Ir Poon has more than 30 years experience in Medical Device and Biomedical Engineering aspects for HK Government with specialization in regulation and technology development. He contributed to Regulatory Affairs and regulatory framework of MD in HK and established the foundations for Medical Device Control Office in HK. He is technical expert on MD to Diagnostics and Imaging MD Unit of WHO and in MD nomenclature; actively participating in MD regulation and biomedical technical advice in projects of NGOs such as WHO, London School, EAC (Africa) and GIZ (Germany). Ir Poon is a Certified Medical Laser Safety Officer and Certified Clinical Engineer and he has major contributions in education and training for development of biomedical engineers in Hong Kong.

Mr. Kelvin Sze - Certification Officer of SGS Hong Kong 
Mr. Sze has been working in Medical Device and pharmaceutical industry for more than 6 years. His experience covers R&D, Registration Regulation, Production Technique, Quality Control and Quality Assurance. Specially, in the past few years, he focused on developing Hong Kong guide on secondary packaging for pharmaceutical product, which includes quality management system research and implementation under WHO GMP / GDP / GSP guideline.

(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement.)

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 80%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course and passed the tests will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

items.Description:
SGS Hong Kong recognizes the increasing future demands of the ever-changing regulatory and quality landscape. SGS Hong Kong launches Professional Certificate in Medical Device Regulatory Affairs & Quality Assurance Programme in collaboration with regulatory specialist from May 2015 to address Medical device regulations  that are coming up in Asia, European and International markets.

The SPECIALTY consists of 4 modules designed to address the curial requirements in the medical device life cycle, including pre-market clinical evaluation and performance, design transfer, technical documentation preparation and post-market management. The modules focus on the latest requirements within life cycle of medical device and provide practical, face-to-face tuition from the angles of regulators and certification bodies to prepare candidates for the challenging and ever-growing role of acting as a regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialist in today’s medical device industry

PROGRAMME STRUCTURE:

Specialty C  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Life Cycle Management

(MDCEP) Medical Device Clinical Evaluation and Performance - 1 day

  • Introduce MEDDEV 2.7.1 and  GHTF guidance documents in clinical evaluation. Knowledge and experience sharing in how to developing the necessary clinical evaluation documents.

(MPV) Process Validation for Medical Device - 1 day

  • Awareness in medical device regulatory and quality management system requirements in process validation, such as USA FDA and ISO 13485. Introduce how to establish master plan and validation protocol; and sharing the knowledge in IQ, OQ and PQ completion.

(MDFPW) Medical Device Technical File Preparation and its Writing Skills - 2 days

  • Explain the technical documentation requirements as specified in EU directives and USA FDA regulation and knowledge sharing in the creation and maintenance of technical files. 

(MDPMS) Post Market Surveillance and Vigilance System - 1 day

  • Understanding the regulatory requirements of post market surveillance/ vigilance system in medical device industry and investigating the application of the proactive and reactive sources of information in cost effective way.

Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

SGS Hong Kong recognizes the increasing future demands of the ever-changing regulatory and quality landscape. SGS Hong Kong launches Professional Certificate in Medical Device Regulatory Affairs & Quality Assurance Programme in collaboration with regulatory specialist from May 2015 to address Medical device regulations that are coming up in Asia, European and International markets.

The Professional Certificate would benefit all stakeholders whom have substantial experiences in the medical device industry, in particular:

- Regulatory affairs specialist,
- Management Representative,
- Quality Management,
- Engineering Management,
- Management of Operation,
- Logistics and distribution professional
items.Description:
The course consists of 9 modules designed to address the knowledge requirements for regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialists described in the multi-countries’ medical device regulations, including the E.U., the United States as well as local regulations. The modules provide practical, face-to-face tuition in professional level details to prepare candidates for the challenging and ever-growing role of acting as a regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialist in today’s medical device industry. This course uniquely focuses on the practical exercises and professional knowledge necessary to build skills and competency for the role of regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialists. Sufficient time and depth are devoted to grow regulatory affairs & quality assurance specialists to be the best they can be and to prepare the candidates for the role ahead, not just the assessment process.

PROGRAMME STRUCTURE:

Specialty A  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Regulation Management​
(MDMDM) Medical Device Management - 1 day
(MDMDR) Medical Device Regulation - 2 days
(MDMDC) Medical Device Regulation for specific countries - 3 days

Specialty B  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Management Systems
(MDRFTC) Introduction of Risk Management (ISO 14971) * - 1 day
(MDIA) ISO 13485 Internal Auditor * - 2 days

Specialty C  :  Professional Certificate for Medical Device Life Cycle Management
(MDCEP) Medical Device Clinical Evaluation and Performance - 1 day
(MDPV) Process Validation for Medical Device - 1 day
(MDFPW) Medical Device Technical File Preparation and its writing skills (info received from SGS TW) - 2 days
(MDPMS) Post Market Surveillance and Vigilance System - 1 day

*Candidate who has attended (MDIA) ISO 13485 Internal Auditor Course and (MDRFTC) Introduction of Risk Management (ISO 14971) offered by SGS within 18 months of the commencing date can apply for course exemption of the (MDRFTC) and (MDIA) modules.

GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC 
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

Orginal Price: 29,030  Membership Promotion (25% Off): $21,772.5
items.Keywords: MDD, MD, Pro, RAQA, MD/11, MDRAQA
items.Objectives:
PREPARATION FOR FUTURE REGULATIONS:

The regulatory frameworks guiding access for medical devices into different markets are frequently evolving and updating. The only way to ensure your products continue to meet the necessary requirements is to work with a certification partner who is constantly up-to-date and who  is therefore able to help you stay ahead of the changing requirements. With our support you stay aware of future changes, SGS enables you to stay close to the current requirements of market applications in line with the varying requirements of different counties and in particular, an emphasis in European and CE mark requirements.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Ir Albert POON, CCE, CEng, FIET, FHKIE, FCIE
Associate Specialist, Medical Device Program of SGS Academy Chairman of Biomedical Discipline Assessment Panel of HKIE Education & Training Committee Member of IUPESM (IFMBE & IOMP)
Ir Poon has more than 30 years experience in Medical Device and Biomedical Engineering aspects for HK Government with specialization in regulation and technology development. He contributed to Regulatory Affairs and regulatory framework of MD in HK and established the foundations for Medical Device Control Office in HK. He is technical expert on MD to Diagnostics and Imaging MD Unit of WHO and in MD nomenclature; actively participating in MD regulation and biomedical technical advice in projects of NGOs such as WHO, London School, EAC (Africa) and GIZ (Germany). Ir Poon is a Certified Medical Laser Safety Officer and Certified Clinical Engineer and he has major contributions in education and training for development of biomedical engineers in Hong Kong.
Mr. Kelvin SZE
Certification Officer of SGS Hong Kong
Mr. Sze has been working in Medical Device and pharmaceutical industry for more than 6 years. His experience covers R&D, Registration Regulation, Production Technique, Quality Control and Quality Assurance. Specially, in the past few years, he focused on developing Hong Kong guide on secondary packaging for pharmaceutical product, which includes quality management system research and implementation under WHO GMP / GDP / GSP guideline.
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement.)

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 80%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course and passed the tests will be issued a certificate by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

*Delegates who complete a specialty will be issued a certificate. In order to attain the overall Professional Certificate, candidates should complete all 3 specialties (9 modules) within 18 months from the course starts.

This five day course provides an opportunity for both Environmental and Quality professionals to update their skills in interactive and supportive surroundings.
Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete a midcourse test along with an end-of-course written examination.
items.Certificate_PDF_Template: 5860 - IRCA - Generic Certificate of Successful Completion (OLD)
items.Description:
This training is designed to give you the relevant skills and knowledge to carry out audits of environmental management systems (EMS) against ISO 14001.

IRCA Accreditation
We are accredited by the International Register of Certified Auditors (IRCA) globally. This course is accredited by IRCA, 17972 - PR 315.

Prior Knowledge Requirements

Before starting this course, you must inform students that they are expected to have the following prior knowledge:

  1. Management systems
  • The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle
  • The core elements of a management system and the interrelationship between top management responsibility, policy, objectives, planning, implementation, measurement, review, and continual improvement
  1. Environmental management

The intended outcomes of an environmental management system:

  • Enhancement of environmental performance
  • Fulfilment of compliance obligations
  • Achievement of environmental objectives
  1. ISO 14001

Knowledge of the requirements of ISO 14001 and the commonly used environmental management terms and definitions, as given in ISO 14001, which may be gained by completing an IRCA certified EMS Foundation Training course or the equivalent.
 

Trusted ISO 14001 Lead auditor training from a leading course provider

Our courses are delivered by tutors who are environmental management system experts and experienced trainers. Your knowledge and skills will be developed through an interactive and practical approach to learning. Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete an end-of-course written examination.

Contact your local SGS office for full details of the courses available in your region.
items.Keywords: ISO 14001, ISO 14001:2015, Environment, Environmental, Management Systems, Lead Auditor, EMS, Environmental Management Systems.
items.Objectives:
What will you learn on our ISO 14001 lead auditor course?
On completion of the training you will be able to:
 

  • Apply an in-depth knowledge of the purpose of an environmental management systems and the ISO 14001 audit and certification process
  • Describe the principles, processes and techniques used for the assessment and management of risk and the significance of these in all environmental management systems
  • Explain the purpose, content and inter-relationship of ISO 14001, the ISO 14000 series guidance standards and the legislative framework relevant to an EMS
  • Apply the skills and knowledge needed to conduct third party audits against the requirements of the ISO 14001 Environmental Management Systems
  • undertake the role of an auditor to plan, conduct, report and follow-up an audit in accordance with ISO 19011 and by interpreting the requirements of ISO 14001.    

Please note: For this course a split date 5-day option is available. This gives you time to reflect on new material before you sit the final exam.

items.Audience:
This five day course provides an opportunity for Health and Safety professionals to update their skills in interactive and supportive surroundings.
Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete an end-of-course written examination.
items.Certificate_PDF_Template: 5860 - IRCA - Generic Certificate of Successful Completion (OLD)
items.Description:
CQI / IRCA Accreditation
We are accredited by the Chartered Quality Institute (CQI) and  International Register of Certified Auditors (IRCA) globally. This course is accredited by IRCA, 1910 - PR 357.

This is a Chartered Quality Institute and International Register of Certificated Auditors Certificated Training Course.

PRIOR KNOWLEDGE

Before starting this course, delegates are required to have the following prior knowledge:

  • Knowledge of the following OHS management principles and concepts:
    • The concept of OHS sustainable development whereby an organisation must ensure that actions of today do not degrade the environment of the future.
    • The purpose of an initial review as the basis for establishing an OHS management system where none currently exists.

Evaluation of activities, products and services in order to establish the risks and hazards associated with normal operating conditions, abnormal conditions such as start-up and shutdown and emergency situations and accidents.

  • Considerations of risks and hazards in respect of:
    • workplace locations;
    • workplace activities;
    • work-related activities carried out away from the normal place of work or base;
    • employees, visitors and other interested parties in areas where the organisation has control and influence over health and safety;
    • vulnerable individuals within the workplace or control of the organisation.
  • Occupational Health and Safety legislation and how legal compliance forms part of an OH&S management system.
  • A good appreciation of typical methods for evaluation of risks and hazards and their mitigation and the identification of improvements (e.g., risk assessments and method statements).
items.Keywords: ISO 45001, ISO 45001:2018, OHS, Occupational Health and Safety, Management Systems, Lead Auditor
items.Objectives:
The objective of this course is to provide Learners with the knowledge and skills required to perform first, second and third-party audits of Occupational Health and Safety Management Systems against ISO 45001:2018 in accordance with ISO 19011 and ISO 17021, where appropriate.

Upon completion of this Course, delegates will be able to:

  • Explain the purpose of an OHS management system and the business and societal benefits of improving OHS performance.
  • Explain the role of an auditor to plan, conduct, report and follow up an OHS management system audit in accordance with ISO 19011 and ISO 17021-1 where appropriate.
  • Plan, conduct, report and follow up an audit of an OHS management system to establish conformity (or otherwise) with ISO 45001:2018 and in accordance with ISO 19011 (and ISO/IEC 17021-1 where appropriate).

items.Certificate_PDF_Template: 521 - IRCA - Generic Certificate of Successful Completion
items.Description:
This training is designed to give you the relevant skills and knowledge to carry out audits of Quality Management Systems (QMS) against the ISO 9001  requirements. The principles of ISO 9001 set out an explicit management system to audit, examine and continually improve systems for a QMS.

IRCA Accreditation

We are accredited by the International Register of Certified Auditors (IRCA) globally. This course is accredited by IRCA, 17977 - PR 328.

Prior Knowledge Requirements

  1. Management systems
  • The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle
  • The core elements of a management system and the interrelationship between top management responsibility, policy, objectives, planning, implementation, measurement, review, and continual improvement
  1. Quality management

The fundamental concepts and the seven quality management principles (see ISO 9000):

  • Customer focus
  • Leadership
  • Engagement of people
  • Process approach
  • Improvement
  • Evidence-based decision making
  • Relationship management
  • The relationship between quality management and customer satisfaction.
  1. ISO 9001

Knowledge of the requirements of ISO 9001 and the commonly used quality management terms and definitions, as given in ISO 9001, which may be gained by completing an IRCA certified QMS Foundation Training course or the equivalent.


Trusted ISO 9001 lead auditor training from a leading course provider

Our courses are delivered by tutors who are quality management system experts and experienced trainers. Your knowledge and skills will be developed through an interactive and practical approach to learning. Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete an end-of-course written examination.
 

Remarks:

  • Course successful completion only satisfies part of the requirement for certification of auditor.
  • The successful completion certificate is valid for 3 years for the purpose of certification by IRCA. 

CERTIFICATION (ATTENDANCE 100%)

Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate of Successful Completion by IRCA, which designate fulfillment of the training requirements for IRCA Lead Auditor registration.

Orginal Price: 12,500  Monthly Promotion: $7,500

*The 40% discount is only available for the first 3 online enrollments made between October 1, 2018 and October 10, 2018
items.Keywords: QMS, ISO 9001, Quality Management Systems, Quality, Lead Auditor.
items.Objectives:
What will you learn on our ISO 9001 lead auditor course?

On completion of the training you will be able to:
  • Describe the purpose of a quality management system and explain the eight principles of quality management
  • Explain the purpose, content and interrelationship of the ISO 9000 family of standards
  • Interpret the requirements of ISO 9001 in the context of an audit
  • Plan and conduct an audit and report on the audit in a manner that adds value to the organization
  • Meet the training requirements for registration as a QMS Auditor or Lead Auditor with the IRCA
items.Title: (For Promotion: 40%off) ISO 9001:2015 - Quality Management Systems Auditor/Lead Auditor Training Course
(Half day) Basic Food Safety Training Course

items.Audience: This course is suitable for personnel with roles and responsibilities in the development, implementation & management of Quality Management Systems, and in particular senior management staff of QMS certified organizations.
items.Description:
INTRODUCTION:
The purpose of this course is to equip participants with an understanding of the difference between ISO 9001:2008 and ISO/FDIS 9001:2015.
This programme is useful as an introduction for anyone involved in the development, implementation and management of an organisation’s quality management systems.
 
COURSE OUTLINE (1 DAY):
- Introduction of Annex SL and High Level Structure ;
- Scope and structure of ISO/FDIS 9001:2015;
- Discuss key differences in ISO/FDIS 9001:2015 to ISO 9001:2008;
- Roadmap to transition arrangement of QMS certification;

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
The tutor is registered Lead Auditor, approved tutor with considerable audit experience and knowledge.

CERTIFICATION
Delegates who successfully complete the FULL course will be issued a Certificate of Attendance by SGS Hong Kong Limited.

GENERAL INFORMATION: 
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material Fee: HK$1,700 / $1,530* per person


*Early Bird Discount will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking

*SpecialOffer

15% discount of nominal course fee is offered to enrolment made two months prior to the course commencement (available for the courses to be commenced between 3 April to 31 Dec of 2015)
items.Keywords: ISO 9001, Quality, Management System
items.Objectives:
Upon completion of this course, learners will be able to:
- Understand the differences between ISO/FDIS 9001:2015 and ISO 9001:2008 Standards;
- Appreciate the timetable for moving to certification to the 2015 Standard.

items.Audience:
The program will be suitable for business / social entrepreneurs, industry practitioners, educators, trainers and promising talents who are seeking for innovations and impacts.

ABOUT SDGs

The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), which is also known as Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.  It consists of 17 goals with 169 targets covering a wide range of sustainable development issues such as ending poverty and hunger, improving health and education, making cities more sustainable, combating climate change, and protecting oceans and forests.

United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDGs) becomes widely use now. Our Sustainable Development Practitioner Course Series will give you idea of how to change our world towards sustainable future.
items.Description:
The program will introduce the ideas of Demand Chain Management (DCM) / Supply Chain Management (SCM) that disruption for existing practices is needed for corporate sustainability.  It will integrating the ideas of DCM/ SCM with Design Thinking, Mootee (2013)/ entrepreneurial spirit and United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDGs) for synergy and for becoming a sustainable development practitioner which will be demanded in the future world.  

COURSE OUTLINE:

Demand Chain Management and Supply Chain Management

  • Introduction to Demand Chain Management 
  • Introduction to Supply Chain Management
  • Supply Chain Operations Reference Model

Design Thinking/ Entrepreneurial Spirit and Sustainable Development Goals / Mindset

  • Introduction to Design Thinking / Entrepreneurial Spirit in new product/ service development
  • Application of UNSDGs and Sustainable Development Mindset into Demand Chain / Supply Chain Operations  
  • Case study and role play      

Practices for Managing SDGs to Bridge the Gap

  • Introduction to gaps observed and identified
  • Application of SDGs for learning how to achieve good practices in operations 
  • Application of 4Cs / DLDDC Model / SY model/ ISO 100015 training standards for good practices to close the gap
  • Case study / video production 

 

CERTIFICATION (Attendance: 100%):
Delegates who successfully completed the course with 100% attendance will be issued a certificate by CCSI and SGS HK Ltd.
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: Hang Seng Management College, Shatin
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking
items.Keywords: SustainableDevelopment, Practitioner, Bridge the Gap, SSSDP, Practitioner
items.Objectives:
ABOUT THE COURSE

This training course is designed by Dr. Shirley Yeung , who is a nominee as  UN Local Change Maker, 2016 with her Training SY Model assessed by SGS, HK. The training contents are innovative to address Global UN Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDGs) adopted by world leaders and implemented locally in HK for a better world.

Our Training Partner, Center for Corporate Sustainability and Innovations (CCSI), is the 1st one and only one in HK to adopt ISO 10015 for training effectiveness under the clientele of SGS, HK.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Dr. YEUNG Mo Ching, shirley - Director, Centre for Corporate Sustainability and Innovations (CCSI), Hang Seng Management College (HSMC) ;nomiee of the UN Local Change Maker, 2016

Dr. Shirley Yeung, an Institute of Environment Management and Assessment (IEMA) approved Sustainability (CSR) Practitioner, RABQSA, ISO9000 Principal Auditor, US, IRCA ISO 9000 Auditor, UK, AQIP Assessor, US, HKCAAVQ Subject Specialist . In 2016, Dr Yeung was one of panels of PRME Colloquium on Higher Education workshop of 7th PRME Asia Forum in Hong Kong. Dr Yeung was also invited by Harvard University, HPAIR to deliver a seminar on "Entrepreneurial Spirit and Sustainable Mindset". In 2015, Dr. Yeung awarded “Pioneer Professor Certificate” from UN Flourish Prizes, US for guiding a student in writing a story on FujiXerox’s sustainable development achievements; and she was also the convener for the 1st Forum on Sustainable Development in Higher Education co-organized with UNESCO, APEID and the Chair of the 2nd International Conference on Supply Chain for Sustainability, Hong Kong.

In 2014, Dr. Yeung was nominated by Nobel Prize Winner for Wenhui (文暉) Award for Educational Innovation, UNESCO, APEID. And, she was a Visiting Scholar of National Taipei University (NTPU), Taiwan and Visiting Professor of Lipscomb University, US. In 2013, Dr. Yeung received professional training certificates from different Schools in Harvard University, US. Also awarded “Fellowship/ FMBA/ Chartered Manager” from Chartered Canadian Institute of Business Administration (CCIBA). Dr. Yeung also awarded the “Outstanding Employee Award” and obtained “Best Teacher Certificate” from HKQAA and Hang Seng School of Commerce (HSSC) in 2006 and 2007 respectively.

items.Audience:
• This course is suitable for Personnel who are involved in organizing and conducting internal audits against ISO 9001:2015;
  • Personnel who are likely or currently involved in implementing and maintaining an Quality Management System to become internal auditor;
  • Quality / Sustainability / CSR / Compliance Managers, Executives and Supervisors who wish to know more about the internal audit against ISO 9001 requirement.
items.Description:
This comprehensive training course is certificated by the IRCA Registration Governing Board of UK. Course content fulfils the training requirements for IRCA (U.K.), RAB (U.S.A.) and JAS-ANZ (Australia & New Zealand) lead auditor or internal auditor. (IRCA Reference No.: A17993)

On the other hand, China Certification & Accreditation Association (CCAA) and Hong Kong Institution of Certified Auditors (HKICA) have concluded a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to embark on the collaboration arrangement of mutual recognition of both sides’ certified auditors. (HKICA approved course number: HKICA 2016/30)

This training course is certificated by IRCA and HKICA, it enables delegates to have the skills and knowledge to conduct internal audit against ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management Systems with incorporation of consideration about risks and opportunities, context of the organization in fulfilling needs, expectation of interested parties and report on the effective implementation and maintenance of the management system in accordance with ISO 19011. Delegates would be equipped with proficiency and confidence in performing an efficient internal audit against ISO 9001:2015.

COURSE OUTLINE (2 DAYS):

  • Introduction to systematic framework of quality management system and emphasized concepts in managing quality management system with updated ISO 9001:2015
  • Review of key requirements in specifications of ISO 9001:2015
  • Principles and responsibilities of internal QMS auditors
  • Planning, preparation and skill for conducting internal audit with consideration of risk and opportunities together with processes approaches in audit trails.

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:

The tutor is IRCA, HKICA and SGS registered ISO 9001 lead tutor with considerable audit experience and knowledge of quality management.

CERTIFICATION (100% Attendance):

Delegates who successfully complete the course will be issued two certificates by IRCA and HKICA separately.

GENERAL INFORMATION: 

Time: 9:30 am - 5:30 pm

Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC

Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English Material

*Early Bird Price is offered to SGS certified clients and HKICA members, all enrolment made one month prior to the course or online booking

Remark:

  1. This course doesn’t cover interpretation of ISO 9001:2015 requirements. Delegates who are not familiar with the requirements should attend ISO 9001:2015 foundation course
  2. Course successful completion only satisfies part of the requirement for certification of auditor.
items.Keywords: HKICA, CSQMSA, 9000, 9001, IA, ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System Internal Auditor
items.Objectives:
PRIOR KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS:

You are expected to have the following prior knowledge:

 

a) Management systems
  • The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle
  • The core elements of a management system and the interrelationship between top management responsibility, policy, objective, planning, implementation, measurement, review and continual improvement.

 

b) Quality management

The fundamental concepts and the seven quality management principles (see ISO 9001)

  • Customer focus
  • Leadership
  • Engagement of people
  • Process approach
  • Improvement
  • Evidence-based decision making
  • Relationship management
  • The relationship between quality management and customer satisfaction.

 

c) ISO 9001
  • An understanding of the requirements of ISO 9001 and the commonly used quality management terms and definitions, as given in ISO 9000, which may be gained by completing an HKICA Certified Foundation Training course or equivalent
items.Title: (New) ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System Internal Auditor Training Course

items.Audience:
• This five day course provides an opportunity for quality management professionals to update their skills in interactive and supportive surroundings.
  • Case study materials and role-play exercises are used to develop and practice skills in all phases of auditing. Participants are continually assessed and required to complete a midcourse test along with an end-of-course written examination.
items.Description:
This comprehensive training course is certificated by the IRCA Registration Governing Board of UK. Course content fulfils the training requirements for IRCA (U.K.), RAB (U.S.A.) and JAS-ANZ (Australia & New Zealand) lead auditor or internal auditor.

On the other hand, China Certification & Accreditation Association (CCAA) and Hong Kong Institution of Certified Auditors (HKICA) have concluded a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to embark on the collaboration arrangement of mutual recognition of both sides’ certified auditors.

This comprehensive training course is separately certificated by both IRCA (IRCA Reference No.: A17977) and HKICA (HKICA approved course number: HKICA 2016/32), it enables delegates to acquire the skills as a lead auditor for both internal audit and third-party audit including the preparation of audit checklists, audit planning, conducting the assessments, reporting of audit results, and audit follow-ups against ISO 9001:2015 in accordance with ISO 19011 and ISO/IEC 17021 (as applicable).

COURSE OUTLINE:

  • Standard interpretation;
  • Registration, Certification and Auditor competence;
  • Audit: Definition, Principles and Types
  • Audit Planning; Documentation Review;
  • Prepare Checklist; Conducting on-site Audit;
  • Audit review; Audit Reporting and Follow up;
  • Case Study, Audit Role Play;
  • Examination Review;
  • Case Study Presentation;
  • Course Review & Summary;
  • Written Examination;

PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:

The tutor is a registered Lead Auditor, IRCA, HKICA and SGS approved tutor.

CERTIFICATION (ATTENDANCE 100%):

Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued two Certificates of Successful Completion by HKICA and IRCA separately which designate fulfillment of the training requirements for IRCA/HKICA Lead Auditor registration.

GENERAL INFORMATION: 

Time: 9:30 am - 5:30 pm

Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC

Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English material

*Early Bird Price is offered to SGS certified clients and HKICA members,  all enrolment made one month prior to the course or online booking

Remarks:

  1. Course successful completion only satisfies part of the HKICA requirement for certification of auditor under IRCA/HKICA.
  2. This course doesn’t cover interpretation of ISO 9001:2015 requirements. Delegates who are not familiar with the requirements should attend ISO 9001:2015 foundation course
items.Keywords: HKICA, CSQMSA, 9000, LAC,  ISO 9001:2015 – Quality Management Systems Auditor/ Lead Auditor
items.Objectives:
On completion of the training you will be able to:

  • Describe the purpose of a quality management system and explain the eight principles of quality management
  • Explain the purpose, content and interrelationship of the ISO 9000 family of standards
  • Interpret the requirements of ISO 9001 in the context of an audit
  • Plan and conduct an audit and report on the audit in a manner that adds value to the organization
  • Meet the training requirements for registration as a QMS Auditor or Lead Auditor with the HKICA

 

PRIOR KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS

Before starting this course, you are expected to have the following basic knowledge of QMS:

 

A) Management systems

The Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) cycle

  • The core elements of a management system and the interrelationship between top management responsibility, policy, objectives, planning, implementation, measurement, review, and continual improvement

 

B) Quality management

The fundamental concepts and the seven quality management principles (see ISO 9000):

  • Customer focus
  • Leadership
  • Engagement of people
  • Process approach
  • Improvement
  • Evidence-based decision making
  • Relationship management
  • The relationship between quality management and customer satisfaction.

 

C) ISO 9001

  • Knowledge of the requirements of ISO 9001 and the commonly used quality management terms and definitions, as given in ISO 9001, which may be gained by completing a HKICA certified QMS Foundation Training course or the equivalent.

items.Description:
Het doel van deze training is om deelnemers op de hoogte te stellen van de veranderingen in de ISO-normen. Tevens voorziet deze training de deelnemers van kennis en inzicht in de Annex SL en te begrijpen wat de impact hiervan is op de eigen organisatie en het auditeren van de nieuwe eisen.

 

De Transition Training is opgedeeld in twee modules.

  • Annex SL – Module 1 (van toepassing voor alle ISO-normen)
  • Normspecifiek – Module 2 (i.e. 9001, 14001:2015 etc.)

Om te voldoen aan de IRCA vereisten moeten deelnemers module 1 en 2 succesvol afronden. Module 1 hoeft maar eenmalig gevolgd te worden. Daaropvolgend wordt module 2 gevolgd in de gewenste normvariant.
items.Objectives:
Na het volgen van deze trainingsmodule zijn de deelnemers in staat:

  • De Annex SL te begrijpen als een kader voor ISO management-systemen;
  • De Annex SL toe te passen op diverse managementsystemen.

La realización del curso está condicionada a un número mínimo de participantes; en caso de no contar con ese mínimo, el curso será suspendido.

items.Description:
1. Introducción. Desarrollo del estándar.

items.Keywords: brc iop, envase, embalaje, material, alimentario, packaging, versión 5
items.Objectives:
Todas las organizaciones que participan en la fabricación de todo tipo de envases y materiales de envasado pueden mostrar su compromiso con la producción de un producto legal, funcional y seguro mediante la obtención de la certificación conforme a la norma BRC IOP. La certificación suelen solicitarla los clientes, como parte de sus procesos de aprobación de proveedores.

Esta formación le prepara para superar con éxito la certificación conforme la norma BRC IOP de envasado alimentario y materiales de envasado; certificación que mejorará  sus credenciales y le ayudará a satisfacer las expectativas de los clientes. Además los asistentes tras finalizar el curso serán capaces de:

 

  • Analizar los fundamentos de los requisitos previos de higiene y el sistema APPCC.

  • Conocer los requisitos específicos de la Norma BRC/IOP para envases y materiales de envasado, como por ejemplo, los relacionados con las instalaciones, el control de producto y procesos, o el personal.

  • Adquirir habilidades para diseñar e implantar eficazmente un Sistema de Gestión acorde a la Norma BRC/IOP.

  • Planificar y desarrollar las auditorías internas, así como defender inspecciones o auditorías externas en base a esta norma.

items.Audience:
APÓS A PALESTRA VOCÊ GANHA:

- Conhecimento em ferramentas de redução de custos no trabalho

- Ferramenta para redução de custos na empresa

- Cartilha digital com o passo a passo para que você já possa aplicar a metodologia apresentada no seu dia-a-dia

 

Invista este tempo e participe desta experiência rumo ao sucesso pessoal e profissional!

Dúvidas: marlon.ribeiro@sgs.com
items.Author: Marlon Ribeiro
items.Description:
Venha desenvolver ideias e aplicar ferramentas junto com um time de profissionais experientes! Convidamos você à participar do nosso simpósio que acontece dia 09/06 e fazer parte desta rede de relacionamentos. Confira a programação e faça sua inscrição abaixo. 

E uma Mesa Redonda trazendo o Papel Estratégico da área da Qualidade para identificar os novos desafios e oportunidades que teremos neste ano.

____

PALESTRA: REDUÇÃO DE CUSTOS
Preparando o terreno para o crescimento - 1h
Nesta palestra estaremos apresentando estratégias e metodologias de alto impacto e  eficácia para redução de custos, tendo como principais temas:

  • Metodologias para diagnosticar e identificar oportunidades de redução de custo
  • Estruturação de projetos de redução de custos alinhados a estratégia da empresa
  • Coordenação e condução de projetos de redução de custos
  • Estratégia para capacitação e mobilização de pessoas nas iniciativas de redução de custos
  • Construção de uma cultura focada na redução de custo

PALESTRA: INFLUENCIANDO PESSOAS
A importância dos aspectos comportamentais para se destacar - 1h

CONTEUDO:

  • Autoconhecimento como Alavanca do Sucesso
  • Exercício Pratico: Roda das Competências
  • Seja o melhor que puder
  • Influencie pelo exemplo
  • A Importância do Relacionamento

MESA REDONDA: O PAPEL ESTRATÉGICO DA QUALIDADE
Desafios, soluções e tendências da área, discutidos com você - 1h30

Casos reais e um bate-papo descontraído para você tirar suas dúvidas e interagir com os demais participantes: vamos discutir com grandes nomes do mercado a importância da Qualidade em diversos segmentos e como transformar os desafios de 2016 em oportunidade de desenvolvimento.
items.Keywords: Simpósio, Redução, custos, 1º, terreno, preparar, preparando, crescimento, SGS, Academy, evento
items.Objectives:
Este evento tem como objetivo apresentar aos participantes estratégias e metodologias que podem ser adotadas na empresa para estruturação de processos sustentáveis para a Gestão, Controle e Redução de Custos. 

COMO REDUZIR CUSTOS NA MINHA ÁREA
Diagnostico de oportunidades >> mobilização de pessoas >> estruturação do projeto >> aplicação da ferramenta >> SUCESSO!

INFLUENCIANDO PESSOAS
Planejamento >> comunicação >> aplicação da metodologia certa >> SUCESSO!

ESTRATÉGIAS DA QUALIDADE
Bate-papo descontraído >> apresentações de cases >> especialistas renomados >> SUCESSO!

2 Day Reminder Notification Test

items.Audience:
Los participantes han de cumplir el siguiente perfil:

  1. Titulación universitaria relacionada con la alimentación (Biología, Tecnología de los Alimentos, Farmacia, Veterinaria…)
  2. Cinco años de experiencia profesional en empresas relacionadas con el sector de alimentación, dos de ellos deberán necesariamente ser en empresas de producción alimentaria.

Interesados en participar en el proceso de selección, enviar Curriculum Vitae a es.formacion.spain@sgs.com.  

 

La realización del curso está condicionada a un número mínimo de participantes; en caso de no contar con ese mínimo, el curso será suspendido.
items.Author: SGS Academy
items.Description:
Fase 1 - Formación On Line (3 semanas)

Módulo: Técnicas de auditoría. Formación online.

Módulo: Higiene y HACCP. Formación online.

Fase 2 - Formación Presencial (4 jornadas de 8 horas)

Módulo: IFS In House Training. Formación presencial. 16 horas. Presencial en las oficinas de SGS en Madrid.

Módulo: Metodologías y operaciones de SGS. 6 horas. Presencial en las oficinas de SGS en Madrid.

Módulo: Técnicas y metodología de auditoría. 8 horas. Presencial en las oficinas de SGS en Madrid.

Módulo: Compliance. 2 horas. Presencial en las oficinas de SGS en Madrid.

Fase 3 - Preparación Examen IFS (Duración supeditada a fecha examen)

Preparación del examen IFS. Apoyo y tutoría a través de plataforma online, con la realización de ejercicios y la tutorización por profesionales experimentados. Este apoyo en ningún caso exime al alumno de estudiar por su cuenta y preparar los materiales del examen IFS para obtener los mejores resultados.

Fase 4 - Prácticas de Auditoria (Fechas supeditadas a fecha examen)

Prácticas de auditoría. De acuerdo a los requisitos marcados por IFS, el programa incluye la realización de 10 auditorías en prácticas (según esquemas GFSI). Las tres primeras auditorías en prácticas pueden realizarse antes o después del examen IFS, según se acuerde entre el alumno y SGS. La realización de las auditorias 4ª-9ª, requieren haber aprobado el examen de IFS previamente.

La 10ª auditoria se realiza bajo supervisión de un Auditor calificado por SGS en el esquema IFS. Una vez realizadas 10 auditorías en prácticas, SGS propone a IFS el expediente del candidato/-a y aprueba en su caso IFS su calificación o solicita información adicional al candidato/-a para completar el proceso de registro.

Fase 5 - Formación y Auditorias en BRC (Fechas supeditadas a fecha examen)

(Se requiere haber obtenido previamente la calificación como auditor IFS)

Formación en BRC, 3 jornadas presenciales, en oficinas SGS Madrid.

Examen BRC. Modaliad On Line.

Realizar 3 auditorías adicionales de IFS para completar la calificación en BRC. Dichas auditorias se realizarían ya como auditor calificado. 

 

NOTA: El participante dispone de un máximo de 2 años para completar las prácticas de auditoría, una vez superado el examen de IFS. Transcurrido este plazo, su proceso de calificación quedará cancelado si este no se hubiese completado en ese plazo.
items.Keywords: calificacion, auditor, BRC, IFS,
items.Objectives:
Preparar a los participantes en el programa para incorporarse al mercado laboral como auditor de certificación, calificado para IFS y BRC.

 

Nota: El precio del Programa no incluye las tasas de derecho a examen IFS y BRC.

  • Módulo: IFS In House Training (16 horas)

 Fase 3 - Preparación Examen IFS (Duración supeditada a fecha examen)

Apoyo y tutoría a través de plataforma off line, estudio de casos y tutorización por profesionales experimentados. Este apoyo en ningún caso exime al alumno de estudiar por su cuenta y preparar los materiales del examen IFS para obtener los mejores resultados.

Tutorias Off Line. Duración supeditada a la fecha de examen. Próxima Convocatoria: 23-Octubre-2017 (Madrid).

Fase 4 - Prácticas de Auditoria (Fechas supeditadas a fecha examen)

De acuerdo a los requisitos marcados por IFS, el programa incluye la realización de 10 auditorías en prácticas (según esquemas GFSI). Las 3 primeras auditorías en prácticas pueden realizarse antes o después del examen IFS, según se acuerde entre el alumno y SGS. La realización de las auditorias 4ª-9ª, requiere haber aprobado el examen de IFS previamente. La 10ª auditoria se realiza bajo supervisión de un Auditor calificado por SGS en el esquema IFS.

Una vez realizadas 10 auditorías en prácticas, SGS propone el expediente del candidato/-a a IFS y este aprueba su calificación o solicita información adicional al candidato/-a para completar el proceso de registro.

Presencial: Región. Fechas supeditadas a la fecha de examen

Fase 5 - Formación y Auditorias en BRC (Fechas supeditadas a fecha examen)

(Se requiere haber obtenido previamente la calificación como auditor IFS)

  • Formación en BRC. 2 jornadas presenciales en SGS-Madrid + 1 jornada teleformación.
  • Examen BRC. Modalidad on line.
  • Realizar 5 auditorías adicionales de BRC para completar la calificación en BRC, en Región

 

NOTA: El participante dispone de máximo 1 año para completar las prácticas de auditoría, una vez superado el examen de IFS. Transcurrido este plazo, su proceso de calificación quedará cancelado si este no se hubiese completado en ese plazo.

items.Title: 2017 - Programa de Calificación de Auditores de Certificación en Seguridad Alimentaria (IFS y BRC). Edición 4 - 2017

items.Audience:
Los participantes han de cumplir el siguiente perfil:

  • Titulación universitaria relacionada con la alimentación (Tecnología de los Alimentos, Biología, Agrónomos, Agrícolas, Química, Farmacia, Veterinaria,…)
  • Mínimo 5 años de experiencia profesional en empresas relacionadas con el sector de la alimentación, 2 de ellos deberán necesariamente ser en empresas de producción de alimentos (calidad, producción, I+D,....).
  • Se recomienda conocimiento idioma inglés a nivel escrito, necesario para la elaboración de informes de auditoría.
  • Se recomienda nivel medio de inglés leído y escrito

 

Interesados en participar en el proceso de selección, enviar Curriculum Vitae a es.formacion.spain@sgs.com  

La realización del Programa está condicionada a un número mínimo de participantes; en caso de no contar con ese mínimo, el programa será suspendido.
items.Author: SGS Academy
items.Description:
FASE 1. FORMACIÓN PRESENCIAL

Curso 1. Auditor Jefe ISO 9001:2015 ó ISO/FSSC 22000 (Certificado SGS). 40 h. Consultar convocatorias AQUÍ. Barcelona, Sevilla, Bilbao, Madrid (*) (**) (***)

Curso 2. APPCC. 16 horas (2 jornadas). Consultar convocatorias AQUI. Barcelona, Sevilla, Bilbao, Madrid (**)
Curso 3: In House Training IFS. 16 h + Revisión Técnica y Calificación de Auditores BRC/IFS. 6 h + Compliance. 2 h (3 jornadas). 2 convocatorias a elegir:

  • SGS Sevilla: 21, 22 y 23 de Febrero de 2018 (**)
  • SGS Madrid: 23, 24 y 25 de Abril de 2018

(*) Posibilidad de realizar el curso con acreditación IRCA (suplemento 400 €).
(**) Convocatorias supeditadas a un mínimo de alumnos. Se garantiza la convocatoria de Madrid.
(***) Convalidable acreditando superación de un curso de Auditor Jefe ISO 9001 ó ISO/FSSC 22000, certificado por IRCA o entidad de certificación reconocida internacionalmente.

 

FASE 2. PREPARACIÓN EXAMEN IFS

Apoyo y tutoría a través de plataforma offline, estudio de casos y tutorización por profesionales experimentados.

Este apoyo en ningún caso exime al alumno de estudiar por su cuenta y preparar los materiales del examen IFS para obtener los mejores resultados.

Tutorias Off Line. Duración supeditada a la fecha de examen. Convocatorias exámenes IFS 2018 (Madrid):

  • 07-Mayo-2018
  • 11-Sept-2018
  • 06-Nov-2018

 

FASE 3. AUDITORIAS DE ACOMPAÑAMIENTO IFS (Prácticas)

De acuerdo a los requisitos marcados por IFS, el programa incluye la realización de 10 auditorías en prácticas (según esquemas GFSI).

  • Las 3 primeras auditorías en prácticas pueden realizarse antes o después del examen IFS, según se acuerde entre el alumno y SGS.
  • La realización de las auditorias 4ª-9ª, requiere haber aprobado el examen de IFS previamente.
  • La 10ª auditoria se realiza bajo supervisión de un Auditor calificado por SGS en el esquema IFS.
  • Una vez realizadas 10 auditorías en prácticas, SGS propone el expediente del candidato/-a a IFS y este aprueba su calificación o solicita información adicional al candidato/-a para completar el proceso de registro.

Presencial: Región. Fechas supeditadas a la fecha de examen

 

FASE 4. FORMACION Y AUDITORAS ACOMPAÑAMIENTO EN BRC

(Se requiere haber obtenido previamente la calificación como auditor IFS)

  • Formación en BRC. 2 jornadas presenciales en SGS-Madrid + 1 jornada teleformación.
  • Examen BRC. Modalidad on line.
  • Realizar 5 auditorías adicionales de BRC para completar la calificación en BRC, en Región.

Fechas pendientes de definir

items.Objectives:
El objetivo del Programa es dotar a los participantes de la competencia profesional necesaria para desarrollar auditorias de certificación (3ª parte).

A la finalización del Itinerario Formativo el participante será capaz de:

  • Planificar y Desarrollar una auditoria de certificación (3ª parte).
  • Completar y gestionar un Expediente real como Auditor Jefe TriCalificado en Sistemas de gestión ISO 9001, ISO 14001 y OHSAS 18001, obteniendo así la calificación como Auditor Jefe por SGS.

 

Condiciones generales:

  1. Se realizará proceso de selección de los candidatos. Imprescindible aportar CV y cumplir los requisitos de acceso.
  2. El candidato al programa garantiza la veracidad de la información de su Curriculum Vitae así como de cualquier otro documento aportado durante el proceso de selección
  3. Grupo mínimo de 8 participantes y máximo 16.
  4. SGS se reserva el derecho de cancelar el Programa si no hay un mínimo de participantes en el itinerario o cualquiera de los cursos asociados al mismo.
  5. No se aceptan cancelaciones una vez iniciado el Programa.
  6. Es indispensable completar cada fase antes de iniciar la siguiente.
  7. El participante en el Programa de Calificación de Auditores firmará un Compromiso de Confidencialidad .
  8. Gastos de alojamiento, manutención y transporte no incluidos en toda la duración del Programa (Formación y Acompañamientos). El alumno deberá asumir estos gastos durante la formación presencial y la realización de los acompañamientos de auditoria.
  9. Los acompañamientos de auditoría se realizarán preferentemente en el ámbito provincial/autonómico de la residencia del participante.
  10. En caso de no abonar la cuota en los plazos indicados se procederá a la baja del participante en el programa.
  11. Una vez finalizado el programa, en caso de no abonar alguna de las cuotas SGS procederá a suspender la calificación hasta que no esté satisfecha la cuota pendiente.
  12. La duración de la fase 2 está condicionada a la disponibilidad del participante y del permiso del cliente para la realización del acompañamiento en las auditorias. Plazo medio estimado: 1 año.
  13. Si el alumno acredita cursos de Auditor Jefe en las versiones anteriores deberá acreditar la realización de un curso de actualización o realizar un curso presencial de cambios en cualquier convocatoria a lo largo del territorio.
  14. La superación del presente programa no implica por parte de SGS un compromiso de colaboración profesional con el alumno.

items.Keywords: BRC, IFS, AUDITOR JEFE, AUDITORIA, CERTIFICACIÓN, CERTIFICACION, BRIF22, PCAFOOD, PCA1819, IRCA
items.Objectives:
Para llegar a ser Auditor Jefe IFS - BRC es necesario:

  • Experiencia profesional en la industria alimentaria
  • Tener amplio conocimiento de la/-s norma/-s
  • Acreditar Formación en Auditorias, APPCC y normas
  • Acreditar la realización de auditorías de acompañamiento en los esquemas IFS y BRC en Entidades de Certificación
  • Superar los exámenes oficiales de IFS y BRC.

 

Tras el éxito de ediciones anteriores, SGS organiza una nueva edición del Programa de Calificación de Auditores de Certificación en Sistemas de Gestión de Seguridad Alimentaria IFS y BRC.

El objetivo del Programa es dotar a los participantes de la competencia profesional necesaria para desarrollar auditorias de certificación (3ª parte).

La superación de la formación, así como los exámenes teóricos y prácticos, conllevará la cualificación para ejecutar auditorías en los sectores alimentarios en los que el participante tenga experiencia laboral previa.

 

Condiciones generales:

  1. Se realizará proceso de selección de los candidatos. Imprescindible CV, cumplir requisitos de acceso y entrevista.
  2. El candidato al programa garantiza la veracidad de la información de su Curriculum Vitae así como de cualquier otro documento aportado durante el proceso de selección.
  3. El participante deberá acreditar documentalmente su titulación académica, formación complementaria y experiencia profesional antes de iniciar el Programa.
  4. Grupo mínimo de 8 participantes y máximo 12.
  5. SGS se reserva el derecho de cancelar el Programa si no hay un mínimo (8) de participantes en el itinerario o cualquiera de los cursos asociados al mismo.
  6. No se aceptan cancelaciones una vez iniciado el Programa.
  7. Es indispensable completar cada fase antes de iniciar la siguiente.
  8. El participante en el Programa de Calificación de Auditores firmará un Compromiso de Confidencialidad.
  9. Gastos de alojamiento, manutención y transporte no incluidos en toda la duración del Programa (Formación y Acompañamientos). El alumno asumirá estos gastos durante la formación presencial y la realización de los acompañamientos de auditoria.
  10. Los acompañamientos de auditoría se realizarán preferentemente en el ámbito provincial/autonómico de la residencia del participante.
  11. En caso de no abonar la cuota en los plazos indicados se procederá a la baja del participante en el programa.
  12. Una vez finalizado el programa, en caso de no abonar alguna de las cuotas SGS procederá a suspender la calificación hasta que no esté satisfecha la cuota pendiente.
  13. El candidato dispone de un máximo de 1 año para completar las prácticas de auditoría, una vez superado el examen de IFS. Transcurrido este plazo, su proceso de calificación quedará cancelado si este no hubiera sido completado aún.
  14. El tiempo medio para completar la calificación en IFS y BRC es de 2,5 años aproximadamente.
  15. La superación del presente programa no implica por parte de SGS un compromiso de colaboración profesional con el alumno.

items.Author: Julia Gimenez
items.Description:
1. Definición de los trabajos.
- Fachadas (fábrica de ladrillo y revestimiento de cemento).
- Distribución interior (tabiquería).
- Materiales (cerámicos, cartón-yeso, escayola,…).
 
2. Técnicas preventivas específicas.
- Identificación de riesgos.
- Evaluación de riesgos del puesto (genérica).
- Medios auxiliares: andamios, plataformas de trabajo,…
- Equipos de trabajo y herramientas: Riesgos y medidas preventivas.
- Manipulación manual de cargas.
- Medios de protección colectiva (colocación, usos, obligaciones y mantenimiento).
- Equipos de protección individual (colocación, usos, obligaciones y mantenimiento).
- Materiales y productos (etiquetado, fichas de datos de seguridad, frases R y S,…).

items.Audience: Delegates are expected to have knowledge of Quality, Environmental, Health and Safety audits within organisations before attending this training. This background knowledge is provided on the relevant ISO 14001, ISO 9001 and OHSAS Awareness Training.
items.Description: This training offers an introduction to the principles of auditing an Integrated Management System. The purpose of this training is to equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to perform internal audits on all three standards and to contribute to the continual improvement of the management system.
items.Objectives:
On training completion you will be able to:

  • Explain the purpose and structure of ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001
  • Describe the responsibilities of an internal auditor and describe the role of internal audit in the maintenance and improvement of management systems, in accordance with the three standards
  • Explain the principles, process and selected techniques used for the assignment and management of the aspects and impacts, including the significance of these for Integrated Management Systems auditors
  • Plan and prepare for an internal audit, gather audit evidence through observation, interview and sampling of documents and records
  • Write factual audit reports that help to improve the effectiveness of the management system
  • Suggest ways in which the effectiveness of corrective action might be verified
items.Title: 3 Day Intergrated Management Systems Training
3-Day General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Intensive Training

items.Audience: This qualification is aimed at all Supervisors, Line Managers and anyone involved in Health, Safety, Environmental and Quality Management in the workplace.
items.Description:
About IIRSM

IIRSM is the risk institute for industry and organisations that provide products and services to them. We provide practical education, training, advice, networking and resources to help people and organisations manage the challenges they face. We are an independent charity. We speak freely, helping businesses, public organisations, charities and policymakers appreciate the vital role that sustainable and targeted risk management practice plays – from saving money to saving lives.

 

SGS RISKSTAR qualification approved by IIRSM brings the value of IIRSM’s brand and expertise together with SGS’ skills and expertise. It gives delegates the assurance that the training course content and materials, and the quality of delivery meet the standards of an independent international professional body in risk and safety management.
items.Objectives:
Upon completion of this subject you will be able to:

  • Have an overview of the ILO
  • Have an overview of Legal Liability
  • Have an overview of National Policy on OHS
  • Interpret the duties of employers and employees
  • Interpret a strategy to implement health and safety in the workplace
  • Interpret the Inspector’s Statutory Interventions

items.Audience:
• Operadores de plataformas elevadoras de cualquier ámbito productivo.
  • Otros trabajadores que puedan realizar inspecciones, supervisión de trabajos, emitir permisos de trabajo, etc.
items.Author: SGS Bilbao
items.Description:
TEORÍA:

  1. Legislación y normativa.
  2. Clasificación y tipos.
  3. Características y descripciones.
  4. Aplicaciones.
  5. Seguridad antes de poner en marcha el equipo.
  6. Puesto de mando.
  7. Entorno de trabajo.
  8. Nivelación.
  9. Principales peligros y factores de riesgo.
  10. Medidas de protección y prevención.
  11. Normas de seguridad debidas a otros riesgos.
  12. Puesta en marcha.
  13. Normas específicas de seguridad en el uso.
  14. Normas de seguridad al finalizar los trabajos.
  15. Equipos de protección individual.
  16. Mantenimiento y revisiones.

PRÁCTICA:

  1. Introducción a la máquina.
  2. Reconocimiento del entorno y señalización de la zona de trabajo.
  3. Reconocimiento visual perimetral de la máquina.
  4. Componentes principales: identificación y función.
  5. Comprobaciones e inspección previa al uso.
  6. Puesta en marcha y parada de la máquina.
  7. Procedimientos correctos de operación.
  8. Maniobrabilidad de la máquina en circuito de prácticas.
  9. Rescate y procedimiento de bajada de emergencia.
  10. Procedimiento adecuado para estacionar la máquina en su posición de transporte.
items.Keywords: prevención, seguridad, plataformas.
items.Objectives:
• Transmitir los conocimientos fundamentales para operar con plataformas elevadoras
  • Dar a conocer los sistemas de protección que deben cumplir las plataformas elevadoras y las principales prácticas de trabajo seguro.
  • Proporcionar la práctica necesaria para manejar los equipos, y realizarlo de forma segura.

items.Audience: Employees from all levels
items.Description:
***From July onwards, SGS also provide e-certificate and e-document (e-document will be provided for In-house training only). This enables leaners to be free from certificate loss, to reduce storage space, and ultimately to be environmental-friendly to which SGS’s current policy is attached.***

The 5 S is a structured program to implement workplace organization and standardization. A well organized workplace motivates people from front-line staffs to managements. 5 S also improves safety, work efficiency, productivity and establishes a sense of ownership.

In order to implement 5 S with Kaizen, it is important to have continuous education about maintaining standards. When there are changes affect the 5 S programs such as new equipment, new products, and new work rules. It is essential to make changes in the standards and provide sufficient training. 

CONTENT

  • What is 5 S?
  • 5 S activities
  • An implementation of 5 S system
  • What is Kaizen?
  • An implementation of 5 S with Kaizen
  • Continuous follow-up plan and suggestion for improvement from Kaizen reports
  • Summary
  • Question and Answer

In-depth theory lecturing Group presentation, workshop, brainstorming activity.

items.Audience: 報讀深造班的學員，須完成審核領袖(綠帶)培訓課程
items.Description:
舊式5-S在日本廣為採用，但則重安全及衞生兩個範疇，且欠缺審核表，故何廣明教授决定放棄日式5S，並全球首創50點五常法審核表(此乃日式5S所缺少)，並定名及已在香港及中國註冊5-S® 和五常法®。   
 

課程內容

第一天 第二天

第一節

怎樣作五常法審核

  • 審核應有的技巧及行為
  • 審核表格的應用
  • 建立五常法認證手冊 （附送「五常法標準手冊」及教學軟件）

第二節

實地考察模擬審核 （需外出實習）

現場模擬實習審核五常法認證機構之技巧

第三節

如何推行五常法

  • 遞交五常法手冊或教學投影片
  • 案例分享
  • 五常法道具的介紹 （進一步促進五常法在企業內的實施）
  • 探討執行五常法在不同機構所遇到的困難及克服方法

Systematise         常整頓 10            所有東西都有名和家、30秒內就可找到
Sanitise                常清潔 5              個人清潔責任的劃分及認同和環境明亮照人
Standardise          常規範 15            貯藏的透明度和防止出錯方法
Self-discipline       常自律 10            履行個人職責 (包括優良環境、問責和守時)

課程內容
第一節                                            
怎樣作五常法審核
- 審核應有的技巧及行為
- 審核表格的應用
  建立五常法認證手冊 (附送「五常法標準手冊」及教學軟件)
第二節
實地考察模擬審核 （需外出實習）
現場模擬實習審核五常法認證機構之技巧
第三節
如何推行五常法
- 遞交五常法手冊或教學投影片
- 案例分享
- 五常法道具的介紹 (進一步促進五常法在企業內的實施)
  探討執行五常法在不同機構所遇到的困難及克服方法

items.Title: 5-S Lead Auditor Course - Green Belt
5.8.4 online course test

items.Audience: Managers / Executives / Supervisors and those who wish to embark on continual improvement of their workplace
items.Description:
This 1-Day course is designed primarily to equip participants with the understanding of the concepts and benefits of 5S.

  • What is 5S?

  • Training and execution of 5-S

  • Applying 5-S at the workplace
items.Keywords: 5S, improvement, foundation
items.Objectives:
The 5-S Principle is a tool to help organizations build a culture of continuous improvement and a technique to maintain superior quality and environment. On top of its easiness to operate, the 5-S Principle can effectively improve quality, environment, occupational health and safety, hygiene, productivity, image and improve competitiveness.  It is therefore the first step of any quality improvement plan. The 5-S Principle is strongly recommended to work alongside management systems.

The benefits of 5-S

  • Providing organization with an excellent work environment and superior quality management system

  • The first step to superior management (efficiently helps organizations to run other quality management system)

  • 5-S can help organizations in managing employees systematically

  • Cultivate good habits among the employees and a mindset of continuous improvement

  • Regular audit ensures the 5-S Principle is effectively executed

  • Establish an institutional culture and standardized system

  • Applying 5-S at the workplace

The 5-S Principle is strongly recommended to work alongside management systems.

The benefits of 5-S

  • Providing organization with an excellent work environment and superior quality management system

  • The first step to superior management (efficiently helps organizations to run other quality management system)

  • 5-S can help organizations in managing employees systematically

  • Cultivate good habits among the employees and a mindset of continuous improvement

  • Regular audit ensures the 5-S Principle is effectively executed

  • Establish an institutional culture and standardized system

items.Audience: Managers / Executives / Supervisors and those who wish to embark on continual improvement of their workplace practices and environment, occupational health and safety, hygiene, productivity, image and improve competitiveness.
items.Description: 5S is the name of a workplace organization method that uses a list of five Japanese words: Seiri, Seiton, Seiso, Seiketsu, and Shitsuke. Transliterated or translated into English, they all start with the letter "S". The list describes how to organize a work space for efficiency and effectiveness by identifying and storing the items used, maintaining the area and items, and sustaining the new order. The decision-making process usually comes from a dialogue about standardization, which builds understanding among employees of how they should do the work. This training guides the participants through the 5S methodology and showing how to effectively implement it within their workspace.
items.Keywords: SS, LEAN, Six Sigma, Improvement Project
items.Objectives:
The objectives of this training are:

  1. Introducing individuals to an excellent work environment and superior quality management system
  2. Understanding the concepts and benefits of 5-S principles
  3. Learning how to manage work environment and employees efficiently
  4.  Cultivate good habits among the delegates and a mindset of continuous improvement
  5. Learning how to audit the 5-S principles to ensure proper implementation
  6. Establish an institutional culture and standardized system

  • S3 – Sanitize (Seiso)
  • S4 – Standardize (Seiketsu)

  • Safety
  • Theoretical learnings thought will be done thru Workshop and Exercises in selected Pilot areas
  • A 6-S Auditing guidelines is inclusive  in this training

items.Description:
Course contents:

  1. Review of 5S principles

    • Seiri
    • Seiton
    • Seiso
    • Seiketsu
    • Shitsuke

  2. Objectives of 5S audit

  3. The 5S audit process

  4. Audit planning and preparation

  5. Opening meeting

  6. Conducting the audit   

  7. Audit Checklist

  8. Examples of audit findings

  9. Reporting and Closing Meeting

  10. Post-Audit Activities

    • Audit follow-up
    • Publishing the audit findings
    • Reward and recognition

  11. “Live” audit*

  12. Workshop and Exercise
items.Objectives:
By the end of the course, participants are expected to:

  1. understand the purpose and overall process of the 5S audit,
  2. define 5S criteria and rating to be used in the audit,
  3. plan and implement a 5S audit; and,
  4. present the audit findings in a formal and structured manner to the organisation’s management for further action to improve the 5S scores.

items.Audience:
• Operadores de plataformas elevadoras de cualquier ámbito productivo.
  • Otros trabajadores que puedan realizar inspecciones, supervisión de trabajos, emitir permisos de trabajo, etc.
items.Author: SGS Bilbao
items.Description:
TEORÍA:

  1. Legislación y normativa.
  2. Clasificación y tipos.
  3. Características y descripciones.
  4. Aplicaciones.
  5. Seguridad antes de poner en marcha el equipo.
  6. Puesto de mando.
  7. Entorno de trabajo.
  8. Nivelación.
  9. Principales peligros y factores de riesgo.
  10. Medidas de protección y prevención.
  11. Normas de seguridad debidas a otros riesgos.
  12. Puesta en marcha.
  13. Normas específicas de seguridad en el uso.
  14. Normas de seguridad al finalizar los trabajos.
  15. Equipos de protección individual.
  16. Mantenimiento y revisiones.

PRÁCTICA:

  1. Introducción a la máquina.
  2. Reconocimiento del entorno y señalización de la zona de trabajo.
  3. Reconocimiento visual perimetral de la máquina.
  4. Componentes principales: identificación y función.
  5. Comprobaciones e inspección previa al uso.
  6. Puesta en marcha y parada de la máquina.
  7. Procedimientos correctos de operación.
  8. Maniobrabilidad de la máquina en circuito de prácticas.
  9. Rescate y procedimiento de bajada de emergencia.
  10. Procedimiento adecuado para estacionar la máquina en su posición de transporte.

items.Objectives:
• Transmitir los conocimientos fundamentales para operar con plataformas elevadoras
  • Dar a conocer los sistemas de protección que deben cumplir las plataformas elevadoras y las principales prácticas de trabajo seguro.
  • Proporcionar la práctica necesaria para manejar los equipos, y realizarlo de forma segura.

La realización del curso está condicionada a un número mínimo de participantes; en caso de no contar con ese mínimo, el curso será suspendido.
items.Author: SGS Bilbao
items.Description:
1.  Introducción y legislación. 

 

2.  Directivas clave para el Marcado CE de Máquinas. 

 

3.  Marcado CE de Máquinas

  • ¿Qué es?
  • Alcance de la maquinaria y accesorios que requieren Marcado CE
  • ¿A quién afecta?
  • Requerimientos para el procedimiento de Marcado CE

 

4. La Directiva de Máquinas

  • Definiciones: máquina, cuasi máquina, instalación, accesorio de elevación, equipo intercambiable.
  • Exclusiones
  • Procedimientos de obtención de conformidad
  • Requisitos Esenciales de Seguridad y Salud

 

5. Diseño de Máquinas y accesorios

  • Tipo de Normas A, B y C. 
  • Normativa armonizada relevante. 
  • Evaluación de Riesgos. 
  • Validación de los Requisitos Esenciales de Seguridad y Salud. 
  • Expediente Técnico. Visualización de Expediente Técnico
  • Declaración de Conformidad.

 

6. Alcance de modificación sustancial y conjuntos de Máquinas, modernizaciones y aprovechamiento de equipos ya existentes. 

 

7. RD 1215/97 vs Directiva 2006/42/CE. Criterios de aplicación y ejemplos prácticos.

 

8. Funciones de seguridad y sistemas de mando, conforme EN 13849-1.

  • Conceptos generales y terminología.

 

9. Ejemplos, detalles de casos prácticos.
items.Keywords: marcado ce, directiva máquinas, 2006/42/ce
items.Objectives:
La Directiva de Seguridad en Máquinas, 2006/42/CE, establece en los fabricantes, la obligación de validar el cumplimiento de los pertinentes Requisitos Esenciales de Seguridad y Salud que figuran en su Anexo I, antes de proceder a la comercialización o puesta en servicio de maquinas e instalaciones industriales.

Este proceso de marcado CE, implica no sólo la conformidad con la directiva de seguridad en máquinas vigente, sino también con todas las directivas de nuevo enfoque de aplicación.

Objetivos:

  • Familiarizar a los asistentes con el proceso de marcado CE, a través de las Directivas de Nuevo Enfoque o de Enfoque Global.
  • Conocer las necesidades expuestas en la Directiva de Seguridad en máquinas 2006//42/CE, a través de sus Requisitos Esenciales de Seguridad.
  • Dominar el acceso y uso del listado de normas armonizadas, particularizando sobre las más representativas.
  • Analizar las diferencias y aplicación del R.D. 1215/97 vs directiva 2006/42/CE
  • Ser capaz de estructurar y analizar un Expediente Técnico de Construcción, de acuerdo al Anexo VII de la directiva 2006/42/CE.
  • Conocer los conceptos relacionados con sistemas de mando y seguridad de la norma EN 13849-1
items.PDF_Certificate_Description:
1.  Introducción y legislación. 
2.  Directivas clave para el Marcado CE de Máquinas. 
3.  Marcado CE de Máquinas
•¿Qué es?
•Alcance de la maquinaria y accesorios que requieren Marcado CE
•¿A quién afecta?
•Requerimientos para el procedimiento de Marcado CE
4. La Directiva de Máquinas
•Definiciones: máquina, cuasi máquina, instalación, accesorio de elevación, equipo intercambiable.
•Exclusiones
•Procedimientos de obtención de conformidad
•Requisitos Esenciales de Seguridad y Salud
5. Diseño de Máquinas y accesorios
•Tipo de Normas A, B y C. 
•Normativa armonizada relevante. 
•Evaluación de Riesgos. 
•Validación de los Requisitos Esenciales de Seguridad y Salud. 
•Expediente Técnico. Visualización de Expediente Técnico
•Declaración de Conformidad.
6. Alcance de modificación sustancial y conjuntos de Máquinas, modernizaciones y aprovechamiento de equipos ya existentes.

items.Title: 7S Awareness Seminar
7S Awareness Training Workshop

items.Audience:
• Managers, Executives, Supervisors and those who are involved in system implementation, maintenance and actively participating in problem solving activities

  • Personnel who wish to know more about the 8D problem solving method.
items.Description:
The 8 disciplines problem solving process is a problem management tool used for product and process improvement.  It is structured into 8 disciplines, emphasizing on team working together to resolve problems.  It is well accepted problem solving tools within the automotive industries.

The 1-day course is designed primary to enable the participants to have a step by step understanding of the 8D problem solving method including understanding of the Ishikawa diagram analysis and 5 Why analysis method.

 

Course Content

  • The background understanding of the 8D problem solving method
  • The steps involved in the 8 discipline problem solving and improvement process
  • Presentation of Quality tools
  • 8D examples
  • Interactive course involving case studies experience / workshops
items.Keywords: 8 Discipline approach, core tools, productivity
items.Objectives:
Upon successful completion of the course, participants will be able to:

  • Understand basic problem solving method and the application of the problem solving tools
  • Team establishment and clarify responsibility
  • Cause and effect analysis
  • Determine prioritized actions
  • Implement containment, corrective and preventive action to prevent recurrence

items.Audience:
• Profesionales del sector de fabricación de envases y materiales de envasado para el sector alimentario, como Directores de Producción, Calidad y Compras.
  • Consultores especializados.
  • Técnicos destinados a realizar y defender auditorías o inspecciones de seguridad alimentaria

 

La realización del curso está condicionada a un número mínimo de participantes; en caso de no contar con ese mínimo, el curso será suspendido.
items.Author: SGS Alicante
items.Description:
1. Introducción. Desarrollo del estándar.

2. Sistema APPCC

3. Sistema de Gestión de Calidad

4. Normas de instalaciones

5. Control de Producto y Procesos

6. Personal

7. Protocolo de Evaluación
items.Keywords: brc iop, envase, embalaje, material, alimentario, packaging, versión 5, BRIF22
items.Objectives:
Todas las organizaciones que participan en la fabricación de todo tipo de envases y materiales de envasado pueden mostrar su compromiso con la producción de un producto legal, funcional y seguro mediante la obtención de la certificación conforme a la norma BRC IOP. La certificación suelen solicitarla los clientes, como parte de sus procesos de aprobación de proveedores.

Esta formación le prepara para superar con éxito la certificación conforme la norma BRC IOP de envasado alimentario y materiales de envasado; certificación que mejorará  sus credenciales y le ayudará a satisfacer las expectativas de los clientes. Además los asistentes tras finalizar el curso serán capaces de:

 

  • Analizar los fundamentos de los requisitos previos de higiene y el sistema APPCC.

  • Conocer los requisitos específicos de la Norma BRC/IOP para envases y materiales de envasado, como por ejemplo, los relacionados con las instalaciones, el control de producto y procesos, o el personal.

  • Adquirir habilidades para diseñar e implantar eficazmente un Sistema de Gestión acorde a la Norma BRC/IOP.

  • Planificar y desarrollar las auditorías internas, así como defender inspecciones o auditorías externas en base a esta norma.
