items.Author: SGS Barcelona
items.Description:
• INTRODUCCION A LAS G.D.P.
    • Principios generales.
    • Normativa aplicable a la regulación de la distribución de productos PHARMA.

 

  • ORGANIZACIÓN Y GESTIÓN.
    • Dirección técnica.
    • Cualificación del personal.(formación inicial y continuada)
    • Higiene y BPM (BUENAS PRACTICAS DE MANIPULACIÓN)

 

  • INFRAESTRUCTURA Y EQUIPAMIENTO DEDICADO A UNA ÓPTIMA ORGANIZACIÓN Y GESTIÓN.
    • Locales.
    • Atmósferas temperatura controlada.
    • Sistemas automatizados de almacenamiento y distribución/dispensación.

 

  • GESTIÓN DE LA CALIDAD /DOCUMENTACIÓN.
    • Sistema de calidad.
    • Cualificación de proveedores.
    • Cualificación de distribuidores/clientes.
    • Autoinspecciones.
    • Trazabilidad.
    • Nuevas tendencias( e-comerce ) etc.
    • Subcontratación (OUTSOURCING).
    • Gestión del riesgo (planes de contingencia).

 

  • GESTIÓN DE OPERACIONES SUPPLY CHAIN .
    • Recepción mercancías: procedimientos.
    • Almacenamiento: metodología y zonificación de almacenes.
    • Manipulación de las mercancías (picking, packing, etiquetaje)
    • Expedición de la mercancía: procedimientos
  • GESTIÓN Y CONTROL DE LOS MEDIOS DE TRANSPORTE
    • Elección de los medios óptimos de manutención para el transporte.
    • Control del transporte de producto en especiales condiciones.
    • Gestión y optimización de las rutas de distribución.

 

  • LOGISTICA INVERSA
    • Destrucción de productos: caducidades, obsolescencia, etc.
    • Segregación de productos sospechosos.
    • Recuperación de productos.
items.Objectives:
• Entender cómo la contribución de GDP encaja en el marco de la calidad dentro de una organización.
  • Saber cómo los diferentes departamentos colaboran con la planificación de la calidad, la seguridad y la eficacia de los productos farmacéuticos como una responsabilidad multifuncional.
  • Entender los motivos del cumplimiento de las reglas de las buenas prácticas de fabricación (GMP) / buenas prácticas de distribución (GDP), y desarrollar una actitud positiva hacia las GDP en particular.

items.Description:
• Alergias e intolerancias alimentarias
  • Tipos de alérgenos contemplados en la normativa
  • Plan de prevención de riesgos en alergias alimentarias
  • Legislación aplicable y normativas de obligado cumplimiento
  • Gestión de los riesgos alergénicos por parte del sector de la alimentación
  • Obligaciones de los establecimientos de alimentación
items.Keywords: ALERGENOS, CURSO, OTFOOD
items.Objectives:
Este curso cubre las necesidades formativas derivadas del Reglamento Europeo 1169/2011 sobre la información facilitada al consumidor respecto a los alimentos que contengan ingredientes que causen alergias o intolerancias alimentarias que se presenten sin envasar para la venta al consumidor final y a las colectividades, o en el caso de los alimentos envasados en los lugares de venta a petición del comprador o envasados para su venta inmediata en alimentos en alimentos.

 

Objetivos específicos:

 

  • Entender las diferencias entre alergias e intolerancias alimentarias y la posible consecuencia de su presencia accidental o no declarada en los productos.
  • Conocer los diferentes tipos de alergias e intolerancias alimentarias.
  • Interpretar correctamente las etiquetas de los alimentos que contienen alérgenos
  • Aprender a realizar una gestión adecuada de alérgenos en el establecimiento, incorporar buenas prácticas de manipulación de alimentos destinados a personas que sufran una alergia/intolerancia alimentaria y prevenir contaminaciones cruzadas
  • Conocer las obligaciones y sanciones a las que se enfrentan

items.Description:
Amostragem e Análises Químicas

 

  • Conceitos e definições básicas
  • Tipos de Amostragem
  •  Técnicas de Amostragem
  • Definição dos pontos críticos de preparação de amostras
  • Técnicas de redução de massa amostral
  •  Impacto da amostragem nos resultados analíticos


Estudo de Caso/Workshop
Serão realizados estudos de caso/workshop para fixação dos conceitos discutidos em sala. Estes trabalhos exigem a participação de todos os treinandos.

 

CERTIFICADO:
Fornecido para alunos que cumprirem a frequência mínima (75% para temas não registrados e 100% em cursos registrados) e participarem de todos os workshops, conforme abaixo:
 
· Aprovação: para alunos aprovados nos treinamentos com mínimo de 70%;
· Participação: para treinamentos em que não há avaliação ou para alunos reprovados (resultado inferior a 70%).
 
Visando contribuir com ações sustentáveis e gerar maior praticidade ao cliente, o certificado é digital e estará disponível no Portal SGS Academy após o treinamento, sendo o prazo de 60 dias para cursos registrados e 30 dias para demais treinamentos. Caso opte também pelo certificado impresso, basta solicitar ao e-mail br.treinamento@sgs.com mediante taxa de R$ 50,00.
items.Keywords: Amostragem
items.Objectives:
• Abordar atividades relacionadas à amostragem, de forma a manter a confiabilidade dos resultados analíticos das amostras associadas ao processo e às de produto final, caroço e farelo.
  • Capacitar profissionais envolvidos com atividades de amostragem a identificar possíveis erros  por meio de análise de desvios e possíveis tendências analíticas.
items.Title: Amostragem

items.Audience:
• CSR Manager / Executive
  • Any person who is interested in ESG report making
items.Description:
INTRODUCTION:
Ninety-five percent of Global 250 companies are reporting their CSR performances. Together with Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited (HKEx) target on raising the level of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Report issuance from “voluntary” to “comply or explain” in 2015, it is believed that more companies, especially the listed ones, will publish ESG Report.

This course aims to allow the participants to have a better understanding on making a CSR report with reference of useful guidelines – HKEx ESG Reporting Guide and China Association  for Science and Society (CASS) – CSR2.0.

COURSE OUTLINE (1 DAY):

  1. The background of ESG
  2. The framework of ESG
  3. The background of CASS
  4. The framework of CASS – CSR 2.0
     

GENERAL INFORMATION: 
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese (supplemented with English materials)

* Early Bird Discount will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking


PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:

  • More than 6 years working experiences of CSR project, including assessment, training and reporting
  • More than 6 years of training experiences, covering various industries like construction & manufacturing
  • Registered IRCA Lead Auditor (ISO 9001)

 (SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement.)
items.Keywords: CSR, Sustainability, SS/6
items.Objectives:
BENEFITS OF  THIS COURSE :
After completing this course, you will be able to:

  • Familiarize with the background  and framework of ESG
  • Understand CASS – CSR2.0
  • Comprehend the reporting process
  • Choose what guideline is more suitable to you organization

  • Enviado por e-mail até 30 dias após o término do treinamento aos alunos que cumprirem a frequência mínima 80% e participarem de todos os workshops.
  • Obs.: caso opte também pelo certificado impresso, basta solicitar ao e-mail br.treinamento@sgs.com mediante taxa de R$ 50,00.

FORMA DE PAGAMENTO:

  • PJ: NF + boleto com vencimento para 20 dias;
  • PF: Boleto (à vista) ou em até 12x no cartão de crédito (com juros).

POLÍTICA DE DESCONTOS:

  • 5% para inscrições realizadas até 20 dias antes do início do treinamento (não cumulativa).
items.Keywords: ISO 9001, qualidade, SGQ, Mapeamento, indicadores, MASP, Redação, Ações corretivas, Auditor Interno ISO 9001, Redação e Tratamento de Não Conformidades, Ferramentas da qualidade, Analista de Qualidade
items.Objectives:
Auditor Interno ISO 9001:2015

  • Interpretar e aplicar os requisitos da norma ISO 9001:2015;
  • Desenvolver habilidades para avaliação dos requisitos na organização;
  • Compreender a inserção da certificação nos negócios da organização;
  • Conhecer as tendências para a revisão de 2015 da ISO 9001;
  • Desenvolver habilidades de trabalho em equipe;
  • Realizar auditorias internas e em fornecedores de acordo com a norma de referência.

Redação e Tratamento de Não Conformidades

  • Avaliar os impactos de não conformidades mal redigidas e sem o tratamento adequado para o Sistema de Gestão da Qualidade já certificado ou em implementação;
  • Entender os caminhos para a efetiva implementação das ações propostas para correção de problemas identificados nos Sistemas de Gestão da Qualidade;
  • Interpretar corretamente as exigências dos requisitos 6.1, 8.7, 10.2 e 10.3 da Norma ISO 9001:2015.

Ferramentas da Qualidade e Aplicação do MASP

  • Capacitar os participantes no uso da Metodologia 8D, focando a tomada de decisões com base em fatos.
  • Apresentar as principais ferramentas de melhoria e as técnicas de resolução de problemas relacionados a diferentes tipos de deficiências em produtos, processos e serviços.
  • Orientar sobre a utilização do MASP pela organização, de modo a utilizá-lo eficientemente como metodologia para a resolução de problemas e para a melhoria do desempenho da organização.

Mapeamento por Processo e Indicadores

  • Desenvolver o conceito de gestão por processos, identificar os processos de uma organização e os seus indicadores de gestão para promover a sua melhoria contínua com a efetiva satisfação dos seus clientes.
items.Title: Analista da Qualidade

  • PF: Boleto (à vista) ou em até 12x no cartão de crédito (com juros).

items.Keywords: RH, analista, multiplicadores, mapeamento, competência, treinamento, Avaliação, Avaliação da Eficácia, Diretrizes para Treinamento ISO 10015, Formação de Multiplicadores, RH e o Mapeamento das Competências, Entrevista e Seleção Por Competência, Gestão de Pessoas e Resultado, Analista de RH
items.Objectives:
Diretrizes para Treinamentos – ISO 10015:2001:

  • Fornecer ao Gestor  o seu papel  na Gestão e na  Liderança  num processo Estratégico com as diretrizes para implementar  e manter  os programas de treinamento, que atendam e superem as  necessidades  de inovação e crescimento sustentáveis da organização de acordo com a norma ISO 10015:2001. 

Formação de Multiplicadores:

  • Desenvolver habilidades que os capacitem a desempenhar o papel de Instrutores Internos para multiplicação de conhecimentos das Normas da Qualidade e assuntos pertinentes e praticar o uso de equipamentos e tecnologia na dinâmica de sala de aula.

Entrevista e Seleção Por Competência:

  • Estruturar e praticar processo de recrutamento e seleção, através do mapeamento de competências, focando ás estratégias organizacionais e resultado;
  • Organizar informações internas, inclusive dos requisitantes, de acordo com a nova estrutura;
    • Conhecer de forma sistêmica processo de seleção por competências;
    • Desenvolver habilidades para:
  • Dar suporte aos gestores para que conduzam o processo seletivo de forma adequada;
  • Otimizar o processo;
  • Obter informações completas, dos requisitantes, para estruturar as competências do cargo ás reais necessidades da função
    • Definir parâmetros de adequação dos candidatos através da metodologia da entrevista comportamental;
    • Elaborar laudo do processo seletivo e apresentar ao requisitante;
    • Reduzir índices de erros e, consequentemente, custos com contratações equivocadas.

RH e o Mapeamento das Competências:

  • Descrever as atividades dos funcionários, definindo as responsabilidades e a autoridades relativas aos cargos, e promover a adequação entre o ocupante do cargo e a função.
items.Title: Analista de RH

items.Audience: Profissionais com formação técnica, atuantes ou interessados em atuar em indústrias de embalagem (para alimentos) ou na área de pesquisa e desenvolvimento de indústrias de alimentos.

items.Keywords: Analista de Segurança de Alimentos, Analista, food, indústria de alimentos, haccp, fssc, iso 22, 22000, bpf
items.Objectives:
Boas Práticas de Fabricação (BPF/GMP)

  • Conhecer e interpretar os requisitos de toda a legislação nacional atualizada referente a Boas Práticas de Fabricação aplicável à cadeia produtiva de alimentos e de códigos de prática e especificações internacionais como o Código de Práticas Codex Alimentarius CAC/RCP 1 (1969) – Revisão 4 (2003) – Princípios Gerais de Higiene Alimentar e ISO/TS 22002-1;
  • Desenvolver habilidades para a aplicação, manutenção e melhoria destes requisitos na organização;
  • Aplicar as Boas Práticas de Fabricação como um pré-requisito essencial para os sistemas de gestão de segurança de alimentos nas organizações.

Análise de Perigos e Pontos Críticos de Controle (HACCP/APPCC)

  • Interpretar e aplicar os 12 passos do HACCP estabelecidos pelo Codex Alimentarius;
  • Desenvolver habilidades para a manutenção e melhoria destes requisitos na organização;
  • Integrar o sistema HACCP com os sistemas de Gestão existentes na organização.

Auditor Interno ISO 22000 / FSSC 22000 (Indústria de Alimentos)

  • Conhecer os requisitos para certificação FSSC 22000 (Food Safety System Certification)
  • Interpretar e aplicar os requisitos dos documentos de referência para o FSSC 22000: a norma ISO 22000:2005 e a especificação internacional ISO/TS22002-1 referente a programas de pré-requisitos de segurança de alimentos na fabricação de produtos alimentícios, como apoio à Norma ISO 22000:2005;
  • Desenvolver habilidades para avaliação destes requisitos na organização;
  • Compreender a inserção da certificação nos negócios das organizações pertencentes à cadeia produtiva de alimentos;
  • Desenvolver habilidades de trabalho em equipe.

items.Audience:
• Trabajadores del sector construcción o de otros sectores que desarrollan su trabajo en obras de construcción, instalaciones o mantenimiento donde se utilizan andamios.
  • Otros trabajadores que puedan realizar inspecciones, supervisión de trabajos, emitir permisos de trabajo, etc.
items.Author: F&S
items.Description:
1. Marco normativo en materia de andamios.
  • RD 2177/2004, RD 1627/97,…
  • V Convenio Colectivo del Sector de la Construcción
  • Normas UNE de referencia (UNE-EN 12810-1; UNE-EN 12811-1
  • Ejemplos de otras normativas de andamio locales existentes (Orden 2988 CAM, etc…)
  • Marcado CE
  1. Tipos de andamios
  • Andamios que se consideran máquinas
    1. Plataformas suspendidas de nivel variable tanto de accionamiento manual como motorizado. (Andamios colgados móviles).
    2. Plataformas de trabajo desplazables sobre mástil. (Andamios de cremallera o de mástil).
  • Andamios normalizados
    1. Andamios de fachada.
    2. Andamios móviles con ruedas (Torretas).
  • Andamios no normalizados
    1. Andamios tubulares apoyados.
    2. Andamios tubulares descendentes.
    3. Andamios de borriquetas.
  1. Legalización y gestión documental de los andamios.
  2. Normas de Seguridad previas al montaje (Montadores, equipos de protección individual, carga, descarga y acopio de material, verificación del material
  3. Normas de Seguridad durante el montaje y desmontaje (Seguridad Individual, inicio del montaje, proceso de montaje. proceso de desmontaje, accesorios izado y descenso de cargas)
  4. Condiciones de Seguridad del andamio montado (arranques, plataformas de trabajo, barandillas, diagonales, amarres, acceso a las plataformas).
items.Keywords: SEGURIDAD, ANDAMIOS, PREVENCION
items.Objectives:
• Transmitir los conocimientos fundamentales para trabajar de forma segura en andamios
  • Dar a conocer los sistemas de protección deben cumplir los andamios, los equipos de protección que son necesarios y las principales prácticas de trabajo seguro.

 

FIRE & SAFETY – AND

items.Certificate_PDF_Template: 521 - IRCA - Generic Certificate of Successful Completion
items.Description:
Esta formación está diseñada para que los participantes comprendan  los cambios en las normas de sistemas de gestión que surgen como resultado de la adopción del Anexo SL.

El Curso de Transición para Auditores IRCA se divide en dos módulos:
• Anexo SL - Módulo 1 (Genérico se aplica a todas las normas)
• Norma Específica - Módulo 2 (es decir, 9001: 2015, 14001: 2015, etc.)
Con el fin de cumplir con los requisitos de IRCA los participantes en el  Curso de Transición para Auditores deben completar con éxito los módulos 1 y 2.
El módulo 1 sólo se realiza una vez y puede alinearse con cualquier otro módulo 2 Estándar específico.
items.Objectives:
Al finalizar este módulo, los participantes serán capaces de:

• Comprender el Anexo SL como marco para los sistemas de gestión ISO;
• Saber cómo aplicar el Anexo SL a un sistema específico de gestión estándar relevante.
items.Title: Anexo SL – Modulo 1 – Curso De Transición Para Auditores

items.Certificate_PDF_Template: 521 - IRCA - Generic Certificate of Successful Completion

items.Certificate_PDF_Template: 5860 - IRCA - Generic Certificate of Successful Completion (OLD)
items.Description:
Este evento altamente participativo visa dotar os participantes com uma compreensão das alterações das normas de sistemas de gestão que surgem como resultado da adoção do anexo SL.  

Pré-requisitos

É aconselhável que os participantes já conheçam as normas e conceitos de Sistemas de Gestão. 

O IRCA Auditor Transition Course é dividido em dois módulos:

  • Anexo SL – Módulo 1 (aplicação genérica a todas as normas)
  • Normas específicas – Módulo 2 (por ex. 9001:2015, 14001:2015 etc.)

A fim de satisfazer os requisitos do IRCA Auditor Transition Course os alunos devem completar satisfatoriamente os Módulos 1 & 2.

Módulo 1 só precisa ser concluído uma vez e pode ser alinhado com qualquer norma específica -  Módulo 2.
items.Objectives:
Após a conclusão deste curso, os participantes serão capazes de:

  • Entender o Anexo SL como uma estrutura para as normas ISO de sistema de gestão;
  • Saber como aplicar o Anexo SL a uma norma específica do sistema da gestão
items.Title: Anexo SL – Módulo 1 – Transição De Auditores Líderes

items.Audience: Entwickler, Projektverantwortliche, Qualitätsbeauftragte, Prüf- und Zertifizierungsverantwortliche
items.Description:
Bereits seit Februar 2014 ist die IEC 62368-1 “Einrichtungen für Audio/Video, Informations- und Kommunikationstechnik – Sicherheitsanforderungen“ verabschiedet. Sie ersetzt die bisherigen Normen IEC 60950-1 (für IT Geräte) und IEC 60065 (für Audio/Video). Die Übergangsfristen sind für Europa der 20.06.2019 unter der Niederspanungsrichtlinie.

In der Schulung vermitteln wir die grundlegenden Anforderungen an die Produktsicherheit dieser Produktgruppe und erläutern die Unterschiede zu den Vorgängernormen.

Inhalte

  • Aufbau der Norm IEC 62368-1, Gefahrenorientierter Aufbau
  • 3 Block Modell
  • Grundlegender Einblick in die Abschnitte der Norm
  • Unterschiede zu Vorgängernormen
  • Praxisbeispiele zu Anforderungen der Norm
  • Aussicht auf geplante Änderungen (Edition 3)
items.Keywords: Produktsicherheit, Product Safety, IEC EN 62368, IEC 62368-1, IEC 60950-1, IT, AV, IEC 60065, Niederspanungsrichtlinie
items.Objectives: Vermittlung grundlegender Anforderungen an die Produktsicherheit dieser Produktgruppe und Erläuterung der Unterschiede zu den Vorgängernormen.
items.Title: Anforderungen Produktsicherheit für IT / AV Geräte nach IEC EN 62368

items.Objectives:

items.Audience:
• Empresas certificadas y en proceso de certificación o implantación de las normas ISO 9001:2015 e ISO 14001:2015.
  • Futuros Técnicos o Responsables de Calidad y/o Medioambiente, o Técnicos que deseen mejorar habilidades y rendimiento.
  • Empresas que deseen desexternalizar el proceso de auditoría interna: responsables o jefes de otras áreas que vayan a formar parte del equipo auditor interno para dar cumplimiento a los requisitos de independencia y de competencia necesaria.
items.Author: SGS Academy
items.Description:
1. Requisitos de las normas ISO 9001 e ISO 14001 

  • Anexo SL
  • ISO 9001:2015 e ISO 14001:2015. Contenido:
    • Introducción
    • Objeto y campo de aplicación
    • Referencias normativas
    • Términos y definiciones
    • Contexto de la organización
    • Liderazgo
    • Planificación
    • Apoyo
    • Operación
    • Evaluación del desempeño
    • Mejora
  • Proceso de transición

 

 

2. Implantación de un SGI

  • Revisión inicial: comprensión del contexto, determinación de riesgos, aspectos ambientales, requisitos legales
  • Definir, documentar y comunicar la política, los objetivos y programas, y los indicadores de gestión
  • Definir los procesos. Diseñar y comunicar los procedimientos para el SGI
  • Formar y Sensibilizar al personal
  • Verificar la implantación del sistema
  • Revisar el sistema

 

3. Las auditorías

  • Definición. Tipología. Propósito. Claves del éxito. Resultados de una auditoría
  • Fases de una auditoría
  • No conformidades
  • El auditor
items.Keywords: sistema integrado de gestión, implantacion, auditoria, ISO 9001, ISO 14001,VERSIÓN 2015
items.Objectives:
• Analizar los objetivos y requisitos de las normas ISO 9001 e ISO 14001, y adquirir la capacidad necesaria para diseñar, implantar y mantener un Sistema Integrado de Gestión de la Calidad y Gestión Medio Ambiental que cumpla dichos requisitos.
  • Diseñar y optimizar un Sistema que minimice el peso burocrático y se convierta en una herramienta verdaderamente útil y eficaz en la gestión para cualquier organización.
  • Adquirir competencias en la planificación y  realización de Auditorias Internas de Sistemas Integrados de Gestión de la Calidad y el Medio Ambiente mediante el análisis de supuestos prácticos y casos reales.

6. Planificación
7. Apoyo
8. Operación
9. Evaluación del desempeño
10. Mejora

2. Implantación de un SGI
Revisión inicial: comprensión del contexto, determinación de riesgos, aspectos ambientales, requisitos legales
Definir, documentar y comunicar la política, los objetivos y programas, y los indicadores de gestión
Definir los procesos. Diseñar y comunicar los procedimientos para el SGI
Formar y Sensibilizar al personal
Verificar la implantación del sistema
Revisar el sistema 

3. Las auditorías
Definición. Tipología. Propósito. Claves del éxito. Resultados de una auditoría
Fases de una auditoría
No conformidades
El auditor

items.Title: Annex SL & EMS ISO 14001:2015 Auditor Transition Course

items.Audience: This course is suited to anyone working with Management System Standards
items.Description:
Annex SL

This highly participative event is an overview and introduction to the Annex SL framework for a generic management system standard. The training comprises of tutor led presentations and workshops. On completion of this course you will receive an SGS Certificate of Attendance.

Annex SL defines a framework for a generic management system with added relevant discipline specific requirements, thus avoiding future duplications and misinterpretations when auditing against multiple standards and encouraging auditors to use a more ‘holistic’ business approach to auditing. Annex SL is a basis for new revisions, such as ISO 27001:2013 Information Security Management and ISO 22301:2012 Business Continuity. It will also be reflected in the future revisions or new Management Systems Standards, such as the upcoming   ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management Systems, ISO 14001:2015 Environmental Management Systems and ISO 45001 Occupational Health & Safety Management. This Annex will make the integration of multiple standards more fluid and effective.

SGS is in an ideal position to support you through the transition process by providing current information on Annex SL and the changes to the standards as they happen.
items.Keywords: anxftc, Annex, Annex SL, 27001, 14001, 22301, 9001, Annex, annex SL, transition, IRCA, CQI, auditor transition, lead auditor
items.Objectives:
By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
  • Explain the purpose and use by standard writers of Annex SL – Appendix 3
  • Recognise the high level structure of Annex SL
  • Describe the framework for a generic Management System Standard
  • Explain and understand new and revised terms and definitions
  • Understand the benefits of Annex SL
  • Identify changes to your business

items.Description:
This highly participative event is designed to equip participants with an understanding of the changes to management system standards arising as a result of the adoption of Annex SL.  

Prior Knowledge Requirements

Before starting this course, participants are advised to have an understanding and knowledge of the management system standards and concepts.

The IRCA Auditor Transition Course is split into two modules:

  • Annex SL – Module 1 (Generic applies to all Standards)
  • Standard Specific – Module 2 (i.e. 9001:2015, 14001:2015 etc.)

In order to meet the IRCA Auditor Transition Course requirements delegates must successfully complete Modules 1 & 2.

Module 1 only needs to be completed once and can be aligned with any other Standard Specific Module 2.
items.Objectives:
Upon completion of this Module, Learners will be able to:

  • understand Annex SL as a framework for ISO management systems;
  • know how to apply Annex SL to a relevant Standard specific management system.

items.Description:
Het doel van deze training is om deelnemers op de hoogte te stellen van de veranderingen in de ISO-normen. Tevens voorziet deze training de deelnemers van kennis en inzicht in de Annex SL en te begrijpen wat de impact hiervan is op de eigen organisatie en het auditeren van de nieuwe eisen.

 

De Transition Training is opgedeeld in twee modules.

  • Annex SL – Module 1 (van toepassing voor alle ISO-normen)
  • Normspecifiek – Module 2 (i.e. 9001, 14001:2015 etc.)

Om te voldoen aan de IRCA vereisten moeten deelnemers module 1 en 2 succesvol afronden. Module 1 hoeft maar eenmalig gevolgd te worden. Daaropvolgend wordt module 2 gevolgd in de gewenste normvariant.
items.Objectives:
Na het volgen van deze trainingsmodule zijn de deelnemers in staat:

  • De Annex SL te begrijpen als een kader voor ISO management-systemen;
  • De Annex SL toe te passen op diverse managementsystemen.

items.Audience:
Na het volgen van deze training zijn de deelnemers in staat: 
?    De Annex SL te begrijpen als een kader voor ISO management-systemen;
?    De Annex SL toe te passen op diverse managementsystemen.
items.Description:
Level 2, planning en implementatie

De Annex SL is de basisstructuur (ook wel bekend als High Level Stucture) voor alle nieuwe ISO-normen voor managementsystemen. Met de lancering van de nieuwe ISO-normen is aanvullend ook de Annex SL uitgekomen. Het is de bedoeling van de Annex SL om consistentie en conformiteit van alle managementsysteemnormen te bewerkstelligen. In de toekomst hebben managementnormen dezelfde basisstructuur.

In deze training krijgen de deelnemers meer begrip van de Annex SL als raamwerk voor een generiek managementsysteem. Daarbij zal de trainer uitleg over de context van de organisatie en de stakeholders. 

Onze trainers zijn Lead Auditoren die in de dagelijkse praktijk audits uitvoeren hiermee zijn zij in staat om een vertaling te maken vanuit hun praktijkervaring naar de situatie van de deelnemers.

Voorbereiding
Deelnemers moeten ter voorbereiding de Annex SL meenemen naar de training. Indien uw bedrijf nog niet in bezit is dan kunt u deze downloaden http://www.iso.org/iso/annex_sl_excerpt_-_2015__6th_edition_-hls_and_guidance_only.pdf  .
items.Objectives:
De training is bestemd voor medewerkers die verantwoordelijk zijn voor het opzetten, invoeren en beheren van een kwaliteitsmanagementsysteem.

Het is wenselijk dat deelnemers voor aanvang van deze training kennis hebben van managementsystemen en ervaring hebben met ISO-normen.

items.Audience:
This training should be attended by program members and representatives who are working towards professional ESD system implementation or certification; including:

  • Managers / executives / supervisors / personnel who are driving and establishing ESD control plan

  • Personnel who are involved in the implementation and maintenance of ESD control programs
items.Description:
The course aims to provide the foundation material for understanding electrostatics and electrostatic discharge (ESD) and their role in the manufacture and handling of ESD sensitive devices. The fundamental properties of charge, electric fields, voltage, capacitance and current are discussed with a view towards understanding key electrostatic phenomena and electrical processes.  These include charge generation and decay, material properties and induction.  An overview of Human Body Model (HBM) and other ESD common referred models is presented, including how these models impact ESD control programs. 

The course provides an overview of ESD control procedures during handling and manufacturing activities, and an overview of ANSI-ESD-S20.20 program requirements.  The presentation includes many in-class interactive discussions and animated slides. 

Course Content

  • Introduction to ANSI-ESD-S20.20 Management System, Principles and Definitions

  • Understanding the elements of ANSI-ESD-S20.20

  • System Documentation and Develop an ESD Control Plan

  • Plan, Prepare, Execute and Evaluate implementation of an ESD control plan
items.Keywords: ESD, Ansi, s20.20
items.Objectives:
Upon successful completion of the course, participants will:

  • Acquire good understanding of ANSI-ESD-S20.20 requirement

  • Understand requirement to develop an ESD Control Plan

  • Understand properties of an Electrostatic and how static charges are transferred

  • Understand types of static dissipative medium and how working environment influence static charges

  • Understand ESD models (e.g. Human Body Model (HBM) and other common referred models)

  • Be able to plan, prepare, execute and evaluate implementation of an ESD control plan

items.Keywords: Anti Bribery
items.Title: Anti-Bribery Introduction And Awareness

items.Audience:
Target Audience:

- CFO

- ESG Person-in-charge

- Member of anti-bribery team managers, supervisors and Directors 

- Internal Auditors
items.Description:
Chapter 3 of Policy Address 2018 has a new initiative for establishing and/or reviewing anti-bribery management systems on all listed companies in Hong Kong, with the objective of enhancing the disclosure of their anti-corruption measures.  

It aligns the efforts of the publication of ISO 37001 in October 2016 by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). 

Course Outline:

- Introduction of ISO 37001:2016

- Documentations introduction of ISO 37001:2016

- How to conduct assessment of ISO 37001:2016 

Professional Trainer:

LEUNG, Yiu Kei Patrick is the Sustainability Practitioner and he has been in charge of sustainability services more than 8 years including Certification & Assurance Service for Multinational Companies that listed in HK and Government.

Certification:

Delegates who successfully completed the course will be issued a certificate by SGS HK Limited.

General Information:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai / Sheung Wan Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

*Early Bird Price will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking
items.Keywords: Anti-bribery; ISO 37001:2016; SSABM
items.Objectives:
Course Outcome:

This course enables the participants to learn about the best practices for implementing and managing essential components of Anti-bribery Management System as specified in ISO 37001.  

The participant will learn the different components of Anti-bribery Management System, including Anti-bribery Management system scope and boundaries, policies, required procedures, records, measuring performance, management’s commitment, internal audit, management review and continual improvement
items.Title: Anti-bribery Management System for Listed Companies in HK – ISO 37001:2016

items.Objectives:
• Aprofundar a interpretação e aplicação dos 12 passos do HACCP estabelecidos pelo Codex Alimentarius e ISO 22.000;

items.Title: Análise de Perigos e Pontos Críticos de Controle (HACCP/APPCC) Nível II

items.Description:
Conteúdo Programático
 
Introdução ao HACCP
Histórico;
Conceitos e definições básicas.
 
Interpretação dos requisitos e aplicação do HACCP conforme item 7 da norma ISO 22000:2005
7.1    Generalidades
7.2    Programa de pré-requisitos (PPR)
7.3    Etapas preliminares para permitir a análise de perigos
7.4    Análise de Perigos e medidas de controle
7.5    Estabelecimento dos programas de pré-requisitos operacionais (PPR)
7.6    Estabelecimento APPC
7.7    Atualização de informações preliminares e documentos especificando os PPR e o APPC
7.8    Planejamento da Verificação
7.9    Sistema de Rastreabilidade
7.10  Controle de não conformidades
8.2 validaçao das medidas de controle
 
Estudo de Caso: os participantes irão desenvolver um estudo completo de HACCP, em sala de aula, com foco na ISO 22000:2005.

Revisar el marco normativo sobre el Análisis del Ciclo de Vida.
Conocer el Análisis del Ciclo de Vida (ACV) como metodología para evaluar el impacto potencial sobre el medio ambiente de un producto, proceso o actividad a lo largo de todo su ciclo de vida.
Analizar el inventario de datos y las herramientas de software disponibles

Utilizar la Huella Ambiental como metodología para calcular el coste ambiental de una organización, producto o servicio.
Analizar las herramientas de cálculo disponibles y su verificación.
Conocer los mecanismos de compensación de emisiones

items.Audience: Directores, gerentes, jefes de área, supervisores, técnicos especializados, consultores, ingenieros, personal de calidad y procesos, profesionales y en general a todas aquellas personas que requieran conocer herramientas de análisis de problemas dentro de la organización.
items.Description: El Análisis y solución de problemas es más que un grupo de metodologías evolucionadas desde los 70s, es un sistema apoyado mediante herramientas informáticas que ocupa el centro de la gestión de eliminación de causas y su consecuencia. Convirtiéndose en el proceso por el cual es capitaliza los procesos de la compañía.
items.Objectives: Brindar al participante las herramientas y la metodología para identificar y analizar causas primas de los diferentes problemas en la organización, generando en cada uno las competencias para ser un agente de cambio.

Causa – Efecto
Metodología AMEF

items.Title: Análisis de Peligros y Puntos Críticos de Control (APPCC)
items.To-Do_Instructions: Por favor complete el cuestionario de satisfacción

items.Audience: Esta dirigido a todas aquellas personas interesadas en la implantación de sistemas de APPCC en empresas del sector alimentario y su relación con las normas y estándares de seguridad alimentaria.
items.Author: SGS Academy Spain
items.Description:
El APPCC es un sistema que permite identificar peligros especifícos que pueden generarse en cada una de las fases desde la producción al consumo de un alimento y define las medidas preventivas para su control. La finalidad es conseguir alimentos seguros.

Introducción
  • Conceptos previos.

Prácticas higiénicas en la manipulación de alimentos

  • Control de agua.
  • Envasado.
  • Instalaciones, maquinaria y ustensilios.
  • Desinfección, desinsectación y destratización.
  • Control de proveedores.
  • Almacenamiento.
  • Transporte y distribución.
  • Limpieza.
  • Residuos.
  • Normas de higiene de personal.
  • Trazabilidad.

Formación en manipulación de alimentos

  • Practicas correctas de higiene.
  • Factores de contaminación.
  • Normas básicas de higiene y manipulación.

Sistema de análisis APPCC

  • Principios.
  • Riesgos asociados: físicos, químicos y microbiológicos.
  • Análisis e identificación de peligros y medidas preventivas.
  • Definición de limites críticos, medidas de vigilancia y control.
  • Verificación del sistema
items.Objectives:
• Proporcionar las reglas generales para planificar, realizar y documentar los sistemas APPCC.
  • Practicar sobre los conceptos de seguridad alimentaria.
  • Formar a los participantes para poder elaborar o mantener los sistemas de APPCC.
  • Conocer los requisitos del perfil del equipo APPCC.
  • Implantar un Sistema de Gestión en base a los princios de APPCC.
  • Conceptos generales sobre las normas de manipulación de alimentos.

items.Audience:

  • Responsables de mantenimiento
  • Ingenieros
  • Operarios
items.Author: SGS Castellón
items.Description:
La normativa relacionada con la presencia de atmósferas explosivas, afecta a un amplio abanico de empresas de diferentes ámbitos del sector industrial. En las empresas del sector cerámico también se encuentran presentes sustancias que pueden generar un riesgo a analizar en base a lo establecido el RD 681/2003.

 

Programa Formativo:

  1. Normativa de obligado cumplimiento.
  2. Sustancias presentes en la industria del sector cerámico susceptibles de generar riesgos asociados a la presencia de atmósferas potencialente explosivas.
  3. Clasificación de zonas en base al nivel de riesgo.
  4. Requisitos / Obligaciones técnicas.
  5. Equipos eléctricos en las zonas de riesgo:
    • Instalación
    • Inspección
  6. Obligaciones organizativas.
items.Keywords: atex, atmosfera, explosiva, riesgo, incendio, cerámica, cerámico, industria
items.Objectives:
• Analizar la aplicabilidad de la normativa ATEX (Prevención de riesgos asociados a la presencia de atmósferas explosivas) en las industrias pertenecientes al sector cerámico.
  • Identificar las sustancias que pueden provocar una atmósfera explosiva.
  • Comprender las clasificaciones de zonas de riesgo.
  • Entender los criterios para un trabajo seguro en el interior de zonas ATEX.

items.Title: API Q1 Awareness Course

items.Audience: Trabajadores Ayto. de Mairena del Aljarafe
items.Author: SGS Sevilla
items.Description:
1. Las plagas de los cultivos: Daños que producen.

2. Métodos de control de plagas.

3. Medios de protección fitosanitaria: Lucha integrada y lucha biológica.

4. Productos fitosanitarios: Sustancias activas y preparados.

5. Métodos de aplicación de productos fitosanitarios.

6. Equipos de aplicación: Funcionamiento de los diferentes tipos.

7. Limpieza, regulación y calibración de equipos.

8. Mantenimiento y revisiones de equipos.

9. Peligrosidad de los productos fitosanitarios para la salud.

10. Residuos de productos fitosanitarios: Riesgos para el consumidor.

11. Intoxicaciones y otros efectos sobre la salud. Primeros auxilios.

12. Tratamientos fitosanitarios. Preparación, mezcla y aplicación.

13. Riesgos derivados de la utilización de productos fitosanitarios.

14. Nivel de exposición del operario.

15. Medidas preventivas y de protección del operario.

16. Relación trabajo-salud: Normativa sobre prevención de riesgos laborales.

17. Buenas prácticas ambientales. Sensibilización medioambiental.

18. Riesgos para el medio ambiente: Medidas de mitigación.

19. Eliminación de envases vacíos. Sistemas de gestión.

20. Principios de trazabilidad. Requisitos en materia de higiene de los alimentos y de los piensos.

21. Transporte, almacenamiento y manipulación de productos fitosanitarios.

22. Seguridad social agraria.

23. Buena práctica fitosanitaria.

24. Interpretación del etiquetado y de las fichas de datos de seguridad.

25. Normativa que afecta a la utilización de productos fitosanitarios. Infracciones y sanciones.

26. Prácticas de aplicación.

27. Ejercicios de desarrollo de casos prácticos
items.Objectives: Dirigido a las personas responsables de los establecimientos de venta al público de productos fitosanitarios, de los equipos de tratamiento terrestre, y a las personas agricultoras que realicen tratamientos en su propia explotación empleando personas auxiliares y utilizando productos fitosanitarios que no sean o generen gases clasificados como tóxicos o muy tóxicos, según lo dispuesto en el referido Real Decreto 255/2003.
items.PDF_Certificate_Description:
1. Las plagas de los cultivos: Daños que producen.
2. Métodos de control de plagas.
3. Medios de protección fitosanitaria: Lucha integrada y lucha biológica.
4. Productos fitosanitarios: Sustancias activas y preparados.
5. Métodos de aplicación de productos fitosanitarios.
6. Equipos de aplicación: Funcionamiento de los diferentes tipos.
7. Limpieza, regulación y calibración de equipos.
8. Mantenimiento y revisiones de equipos.
9. Peligrosidad de los productos fitosanitarios para la salud.
10. Residuos de productos fitosanitarios: Riesgos para el consumidor.
11. Intoxicaciones y otros efectos sobre la salud. Primeros auxilios.
12. Tratamientos fitosanitarios. Preparación, mezcla y aplicación.
13. Riesgos derivados de la utilización de productos fitosanitarios.
14. Nivel de exposición del operario.
15. Medidas preventivas y de protección del operario.
16. Relación trabajo-salud: Normativa sobre prevención de riesgos laborales.

items.Description: Esta formación proporciona un marco para ayudar en el desarrollo de un sistema de gestión medioambiental (SGM). La formación en aplicación de la norma ISO 14001:2004 se ha diseñado para ayudar a aplicar y mantener una estrategia efectiva de SGM, a la vez que se cumplen los requisitos de la ISO.
items.Keywords:
ISO 14001
ISO19011
Sistema de Gestion Ambiental
items.Objectives:
Al concluir la formación usted será capaz de:

  • evaluar los aspectos e impactos medioambientales como base del "qué gestionar"
  • identificar y gestionar los requisitos legales y otros, para que pueda desarrollar la estrategia, la normativa y los objetivos medioambientales del SGM
  • determinar los controles operativos apropiados
  • desarrollar un programa de formación eficaz
  • elaborar documentación eficaz del SGM

La formación está basada en materiales de estudio de casos y en ejercicios prácticos.

Tenga en cuenta que: Los participantes deberían tener ya conocimientos básicos de la norma ISO 14001:2004.

Póngase en contacto con SGS hoy mismo para aprender más sobre los beneficios de la formación en aplicación de la norma ISO 14001 de SGS.
items.Title: Aplicación  Sistemas de gestión medioambiental - ISO 14001

items.Audience: El curso va dirigido a todas aquellas personas que tengan alguna responsabilidad directa o indirecta en alguna de las dimensiones de la RSC de su empresa, departamentos de responsabilidad social, comunicación, reputación corporativa, relaciones con inversores, acción social, recursos humanos, etc.
items.Description: Esta formación proporciona un marco para ayudar en el desarrollo de un sistema de responsabilidad social. La norma ISO 26000 está destinada a la aplicación de un desarrollo sostenible que se integre en toda la organización.
items.Keywords:
Responsabilidad Social
ISO 26000
items.Objectives:
Al concluir la formación usted será capaz de:                                                                                                          
Reconocer y explicar las ventajas de adoptar la norma ISO 26000                                                         
Identificar y dar prioridad a las cuestiones principales de responsabilidad social
Identificar e implicarse con las partes interesadas pertinentes.
Utilizar los sistemas existentes para garantizar la gestión de los principios y las cuestiones principales.
Identificar las carencias en los requisitos de formación interna y conocimientos.
Establecer los objetivos de mejora pertinentes.
La formación está basada en materiales de estudio de casos y en ejercicios prácticos.
La formación puede ampliarse en un día para que incluya formación básica en evaluación del rendimiento de una organización en relación con la norma ISO 26000.
Los participantes también pueden combinar esta formación con la de sensibilización de la norma ISO 26000 de un día y la formación de auditoría de dos días para crear una formación modular de cinco días.
Tenga en cuenta que: Debe disponer de unos conocimientos básicos respecto de la norma ISO 26000, equivalente a asistir a la formación de sensibilización de la norma ISO 26000 de SGS.
Póngase en contacto con SGS ahora mismo para obtener más información sobre la formación de implementación de la norma ISO 26000 de SGS.
items.Title: Aplicación - Responsabilidad social - ISO 26000

items.Audience: Personal en general y líderes involucrados en el diseño o implementación de Sistemas de Gestión en Seguridad y Salud en el Trabajo.
items.Description:
El Sistema de Gestión de la Seguridad y Salud en el Trabajo, reglamentado por el Decreto 1443 de 2014, determinó los elementos que este sistema, los cuales son consistentes con los requisitos de la norma internacional OHSAS 18001.

El Sistema de Gestión de la Seguridad y Salud en el Trabajo SG-SST tiene su fundamento legal en la Ley 1562 de julio 11 de 2012. El artículo 1º de dicha Ley determinó que el Programa de Salud Ocupacional “en lo sucesivo se entenderá como el Sistema de Gestión de la Seguridad y Salud en el Trabajo SG-SST”, definiéndolo como “un proceso lógico y por etapas, basado en la mejora continua y que incluye la política, la organización, la planificación, la aplicación, la evaluación, la auditoría y las acciones de mejora con el objetivo de anticipar, reconocer, evaluar y controlar los riesgos que puedan afectar la seguridad y salud en el trabajo”.

En desarrollo del anterior precepto, se expidió el Decreto 1443 de julio 31 de 2014 “Por el cual se dictan disposiciones para la implementación del Sistema de Gestión de la Seguridad y Salud en el Trabajo (SG-SST)”, convirtiéndose el mencionado Decreto en el referente a seguir en Colombia para el diseño, implementación y ejecución del Sistema. Dicho decreto dispuso plazos perentorios para que las entidades públicas y privadas implementen dicho sistema: Dieciocho (18) meses para las empresas de menos de diez (10) trabajadores; b) Veinticuatro (24) meses para las empresas con diez (10) a doscientos (200) Trabajadores; c) Treinta (30) meses para las empresas de doscientos uno (201) o más trabajadores; contados a partir de la fecha de expedición del decreto, es decir, el 31 de julio de 2014.
items.Objectives:
- Desarrollar en el participante habilidades, conocimientos y herramientas teóricas y prácticas necesarias para el diagnóstico, diseño, implementación y mejora del sistema de gestión de la seguridad y salud en el trabajo, basado en la norma internacional OHSAS 18001:2007 y el Decreto 1443 de 2014.

- Desarrollar las habilidades para ejecutar auditorías internas a un sistema de gestión en seguridad y salud ocupacional de acuerdo a los requerimientos de la normas OHSAS 18001:2007 e ISO 19011:2011.
items.Title: Aplicación de la Legislación en Seguridad y Salud Ocupacional incluido el decreto 1072 de 2015 Y Auditor interno en OHSAS 18001 – Salud y Seguridad en el Trabajo

APMG Accredited ISO 20000 Foundation Training

items.Audience:
• Staff working within an IT service provider organization who requires a basic understanding of the standard,
  • Staff working within service providers who are already certified to ISO/IEC 20000 or those considering its implementation.
 
PREREQUISITES:
There are no pre-requisites for this course, although a basic knowledge of Service Management concepts will be helpful.
items.Description:
ISO/IEC 20000 certification is awarded after audits conducted by Registered Certification Bodies, which ensures that a service provider designs, implements and manages an IT Service Management system in line with the requirements of the standard.
 
This course provides a basic insight in the specifications and code of practice for ISO/IEC 20000 and covers the second edition of the standard (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2011) which cancels and replaces the first edition (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2005).
Some of the main differences are as follows:

  • Closer alignment to ISO  9001
  • Closer alignment to ISO/IEC 27001
  • Changed terminology to reflect international usage
  • Clarification of the requirements for the governance of processes operated by other parties
  • Clarification of the requirements for defining the scope of the ITSMS
  • Clarification of the application of PDCA methodology in ITSMS, including the service management processes, and the services
  • Introduction of new requirements for the design and transition of new or changed services

 
Students who have attended this course are suitably prepared to successfully take the associated ISO/IEC 20000 Foundation certification test which is one of the possible pre-requisites for the Practitioner qualification.
 
COURSE APPROACH:
Participants will learn the principles and core elements of the ISO/IEC 20000 standard for IT Service Management through interactive approach combining lecture, discussion and handouts for participants to prepare the ISO/IEC 20000 Foundation certification exam.
 
COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Students will receive a ISO/IEC 20000 Foundation classroom workbook containing all of the presentation materials, course notes and sample exams.
 
PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 
CERTIFICATION:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.
 
About the Examination:
Multiple choice -

  • 40 questions per paper
  • 26 marks required to pass (out of 40 available) - 65%
  • 60 minutes duration
  • Closed book

 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Discount will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking
 
CREDITS:
Upon successfully awarded with the ISO/IEC 20000 Foundation certificate, the student will be recognized with 1 credit of the 6 complementary credits available to put towards the ITIL Expert certification.
 
Project Management Institute – Professional Development Units (PDUs) = 14
 
REMARK:

  1. The APMG-International ISO/IEC 20000 and Swirl Device logo is a trade mark of The APM Group Limited.
  2. The SGS course on this page is offered by Quint Wellington Redwood.
items.Keywords: 20000,IEC 20000,ISO 20000,Foundation,IT, (IT/11)
items.Objectives:
At the end of this course, the student will be able to understand the scope, objectives and high level requirements of the ISO/IEC 20000 standard and how it is used in a typical IT service provider organization, together with the main elements of the certification process.
 
Specifically, the student will understand:
 
  • The background of ISO/IEC 20000
  • The scope and purpose of Part 1, 2, 3 and 5 of ISO/IEC 20000 and how these can be used
  • The key terms and definitions used
  • The fundamental requirements for an ITSMS and the need for continual improvement
  • The processes, their objectives and high level requirements in a typical IT service provider scenario
  • Applicability and scope definition requirements
  • The purpose of internal and external audits, their operation and the associated terminology.
  • The operation of the APMG Certification Scheme
  • The relationship with best practices and related standards

items.Title: APMG Accredited ISO/IEC 20000 IT Service Management - Foundation Training

items.Audience:
This course is aimed at existing third-party or internal auditors who wish to understand the specific requirements of auditing IT Service Management System for conformance with the ISO/IEC 20000 standard.
 
PREREQUISITES:
Candidates are required to have a minimum of three years experiences of auditing in an IT environment since the course does not cover generic principles of IT Management System audit.
items.Description:
Client often request that their (internal or external) IT Service Providers can prove that they are able to provide the required service quality and have appropriate service management processes in place.
Based on processes, ISO/IEC 20000 is an internationally recognized standard for IT Service Management that specifies requirements for the service provider to plan, establish, implement, operate, monitor, review, maintain and improve an IT Service Management System (ITSMS). The requirements include the design, transition, delivery and improvement of services to fulfill agreed service requirements.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
The course covers the second edition of the standard (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2011) which cancels and replaces the first edition (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2005).
Some of the main differences are as follows:

  1. closer alignment to ISO  9001 & ISO/IEC 27001
  2. changed terminology to reflect international usage
  3. clarification of the requirements for the governance of processes operated by other parties and the requirements for defining the scope of the SMS
  4. Clarification of the application of PDCA methodology in ITSMS, including the service management processes, and the services
  5. introduction of new requirements for the design and transition of new or changed services

Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).

items.Title: APMG Accredited ISO/IEC 20000 IT Service Management – Auditor Training

items.Audience:
This course is aimed at existing third-party or internal auditors who wish to understand the specific requirements of auditing IT Service Management System for conformance with the ISO/IEC 20000 standard.
 
PREREQUISITES:
Candidates are required to have a minimum of three years experiences of auditing in an IT environment since the course does not cover generic principles of IT Management System audit.
items.Description:
Client often request that their (internal or external) IT Service Providers can prove that they are able to provide the required service quality and have appropriate service management processes in place.
Based on processes, ISO/IEC 20000 is an internationally recognized standard for IT Service Management that specifies requirements for the service provider to plan, establish, implement, operate, monitor, review, maintain and improve an IT Service Management System (ITSMS). The requirements include the design, transition, delivery and improvement of services to fulfill agreed service requirements.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
The course covers the second edition of the standard (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2011) which cancels and replaces the first edition (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2005).
Some of the main differences are as follows:

  1. closer alignment to ISO  9001 & ISO/IEC 27001
  2. changed terminology to reflect international usage
  3. clarification of the requirements for the governance of processes operated by other parties and the requirements for defining the scope of the SMS
  4. Clarification of the application of PDCA methodology in ITSMS, including the service management processes, and the services
  5. introduction of new requirements for the design and transition of new or changed services

 
PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).

items.Title: APMG Accredited ISO/IEC 20000 IT Service Management – Auditor Training

items.Audience:
This course targets to help the practitioners, managers and consultants involved in an ITSMS implementation and/or on-going activities based on ISO/IEC 20000.
 
 
PREREQUISITES:
Candidate must hold one of the following qualifications to qualify to sit the Practitioner exam: ISO/IEC 20000 Foundation or ITIL Foundation.
items.Description:
This course provides sufficient understanding of ISO/IEC 20000 and its application to be able to analyse and apply the gained knowledge to a range of activities that would support organizations in conforming to the requirements of Part 1, and achieving and retaining ISO/IEC 20000 certification.
The course covers the second edition of the standard (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2011) which cancels and replaces the first edition (ISO/IEC 20000-1:2005).
 
Some of the main differences are as follows:

  • Closer alignment to ISO  9001
  • Closer alignment to ISO/IEC 27001
  • Changed terminology to reflect international usages
  • Clarification of the requirements for the governance of processes operated by other parties
  • Clarification of the requirements for defining the scope of the ITSMS
  • Clarification that the PDCA methodology applies to the ITSMS, including the service management processes, and the services
  • Introduction of new requirements for the design and transition of new or changed services

Students who have attended this course are suitably prepared to successfully take the associated ISO/IEC 20000 Practitioner certification examination.
 
COURSE APPROACH:
The course provides experience-based guidelines and concepts regarding ISO20000 implementation, with special emphasis on the ‘soft’ aspects of changing an organization.
 
This, undoubtedly, will allow for the development of essential skills to support the decision making process and, allow for the drawing up of detailed implementation approach for the participating organization.
 
PROFESSIONAL TRAINER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 
CERTIFICATION:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Discount will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking


About the Examination:
Complex Multiple Choice -

  • 4 questions per paper
  • 20 marks available per question
  • 40 marks required to pass (out of 80 available) - 50%
  • Three hours duration
  • Open book (a copy of Part 1 is permitted)

 
CREDITS:
Upon successfully achieving the ISO/IEC 20000 Practitioner certificate, the student will be recognized with 1.5 credit of the 6 complementary credits available to put towards the ITIL Expert certification.
 
Project Management Institute – Professional Development Units (PDUs) = 21

items.Keywords: 20000,IEC 20000,ISO 20000,Practitioner,IT,(IT/13)
items.Objectives:
At the end of this course, the student will be able to understand and be able to analyze and apply the content of ISO/IEC 20000 within currently certified organizations or those wishing to implement an ITSMS in preparation for initial certification. Specifically, the student will be able to:
  • Understand the purpose, use and application of Part 1, 2, 3 and 5 of the standard
  • Assist and advise organizations in the achievement of conformance to ISO/IEC 20000-1 and certification
  • Understand, explain and advise on issues regarding applicability, eligibility and scope definition
  • Understand and explain the relationship between ISO/IEC 20000 and ITSMS best practices in common use and related standards
  • Explain and apply the requirements of Part 1
  • Explain the use of technology and tools to support the implementation and improvement of an ITSMS, the achievement of certification and the ongoing demonstration of conformance to Part 1
  • Advise and assist in ISO/IEC 20000 certification readiness assessments
  • Produce a gap analysis supported by an improvement and implementation plan
  • Understand, create and apply a service management plan
  • Assist and advise organizations on the implementation of continual improvement processes
  • Prepare organizations for an ISO/IEC 20000 certification audit using the regulations of the APMG Certification Scheme

items.Title: APMG Accredited ISO/IEC 20000 IT Service Management – Practitioner Training

items.Audience:
Business Management, IT /IS Auditors, Internal Auditors, Information Security and IT Practitioners; Consultants, IT/IS Management looking to gain an insight into the Enterprise Governance of IT and looking to be certified as a COBIT Implementer or Assessor.
 
PREREQUISITES:
No mandatory prerequisites although some experience in IT or related fields is recommended
items.Description:
This three day, instructor-led IT Governance Foundation Course provides an overview of the main concepts of IT Governance according to COBIT 5, ISACA ’s latest governance framework, and how they can be applied. COBIT 5 provides a comprehensive framework that assists enterprises create optimal value from IT by maintaining a balance between realizing benefits and optimizing risk levels and resource use.
 
COBIT 5 enables IT to be governed and managed in a holistic manner for the entire enterprise, taking in the full end-to-end business and IT functional areas of responsibility, considering the IT-related interests of internal and external stakeholders. This course and the COBIT 5 Foundation certificate are mandatory for additional COBIT 5 training, including the COBIT 5 Implementation Course and Assessor Program Training.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
Module 1 – The key features of COBIT 5
Module 2: The COBIT 5 principles
Module 3: The COBIT 5 enablers
Module 4: Introduction of COBIT 5 implementation
Module 5 – Process capability assessment model
Module 6 – Exam
 (For more detail of course outline, please contact us at 3543 7900 or hk.academy@sgs.com)
 
COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Students will receive a COBIT 5 Foundation classroom workbook containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.
 
PROFESSIONAL SPEAKER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 
CERTIFICATE:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Discount will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking
 
Course Delivery: Classroom
Reference Materials: Additional reference materials are not required for this course.
 
About the Examination:
The exam is closed book with fifty (50) multiple choice questions. The pass score is 50% (25 out of 50 questions). The exam lasts 40 minutes.
 
CREDITS:
Upon successfully achieving the COBIT 5 Foundation certificate, the student will be recognized
Project Management Institute – Professional Development Units (PDUs) = 21
 
REMARKS: The SGS course on this page is offered by Quint Wellington Redwood.
items.Keywords: APMG,COBIT, (IT/20)
items.Objectives:
At the end of this course, you will be able to:
  • Understand the COBIT 5 Product Architecture
  • Analyze the IT management issues and challengers that affect enterprises
  • Identify the 5 Key Principles of COBIT 5 for governance and management of Enterprise IT
  • Know how COBIT 5 enables IT to be governed and managed in a holistic manner for the entire enterprise
  • Know how the COBIT 5 processes and the Process Reference Model (PRM) help guide the creation of the 5 Principles and the 7 Governance and Management Enablers
  • Realize the basic concepts for the implementation of COBIT 5
  • Understand the components and purpose of the Process Reference Guide
  • Understand the basic concepts of a RACI and how they are used in COBIT 5
  • Understand the basic concepts of the new Process Assessment Model
  • Know the COBIT 5 guides and how they interrelate

items.Title: APMG-International Accredited COBIT® 5 – Foundation with Case Study

items.Audience:
IT Managers, Operational staff, and anyone requiring a deeper knowledge of or who are involved in the Operational Support & Analysis cluster of processes and functions.
 
PREREQUISITES:
An ITIL Foundation certificate and preferably two years working experiences in an IT Service Management environment.
items.Description:
ITIL® is comprised of five core publications: Service Strategy, Service Design, Service Operations and Continual Service Improvement. These 5 cores promotes alignment with the business as well as improves operational efficiency. The official ITIL qualification scheme describes two streams, the Service Lifecycle Stream and the Service Capability Stream.
 
The Service Lifecycle stream focuses on ITIL practices within the Service Lifecycle context. The prime focus is the Lifecycle itself as well as the process and practice elements used within it.
 
The Service Capability stream is for those who wish to obtain an in depth understanding of ITIL processes and roles. Attention to the Service Lifecycle is illustrated as a part of the curriculum but the primary focus is on the process activities, execution and use throughout the Service Lifecycle.
 
The ITIL® OSA (Operational Support & Analysis) course is a part of the ITIL® Intermediate Capability certification stream. The course prepares candidates to take the ITIL® Operational Support & Analysis Intermediate exam as well as provides valuable knowledge that can be implemented in the workplace.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
1. Introduction
2. Event Management
3. SERVICE Desk
4. Incident Management
5. Problem Management  
6. Request Fulfillment
7. Access Management
8. Functions
9. Technology and Implementation Consideration
10. Exam Preparation
(For more detail of course outline, please contact us at 3543 7900 or hk.academy@sgs.com)
 
COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Students will receive an ITIL Operational Support & Analysis classroom workbooks containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.
 
PROFESSIONAL SPEAKER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 
CERTIFICATE:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.
 

Course Delivery: Classroom
Reference Materials: Core set of 5 ITIL books (It is recommended)
 
About the Examination:
Format: Multiple choice, scenario-based, gradient scored questions.
Number of Questions: 8
Pass Score: 28/40 or 70%
Exam Delivery: paper based Exam
Duration: 90 minutes
Open/Closed Book: Closed Book
 
CREDITS:
Upon successfully achieving the ITIL Operational Support & Analysis certificate, the student will earn 4 credits in the ITIL® qualification scheme.
 
Project Management Institute – Professional Development Units (PDUs) = 35
 
REMARKS: The SGS course on this page is offered by Quint Wellington Redwood.

  • The purpose, goal and objectives of the Request Fulfillment Process
  • The purpose, goal and objectives of the Access Management Process

items.Title: APMG-International Accredited ITIL® Capability OSA Course

items.Audience:
IT Professionals, IT Support Staff, Application, Project and Business Managers, Any member of an IT team involved in the delivery of IT Services
 
PREREQUISITES:

items.Description:
The ITIL® Foundation course is the entry level certification course for IT Service Management Best Practices training in ITIL. This course covers the latest version of core ITIL best practices presented from a lifecycle perspective. The course introduces the principles and core elements of IT service management (ITSM) based on ITIL.
ITIL is comprised of five core publications: Service Strategy, Service Design, Service Transition, Service Operations and Continual Service Improvement. These 5 cores promote alignment with the business as well as improve operational efficiency.
This course is delivered using an exciting case study designed to further enhance and cement the candidates understanding of ITIL. Students who have attended this course are suitably prepared to successfully take the associated ITIL Foundation certification test which is a requirement for attending any of the further learning courses (ITIL intermediate level training) available in this track.

COURSE OUTLINE:
1. Introduction
2. Service Strategy
3. Service Design
4. Service Transition
5. Service Operation
6. Continual Service Improvement
7. Exam preparation
(For more detail of course outline, please contact us at 3543 7900 or hk.academy@sgs.com)

COURSE APPROACH:
Participants will learn the principles and core elements of the service lifecycle approach to IT Service Management according to ITIL.
An interactive approach is used combining lecture, discussion and case study experience to prepare participants for the ITIL Foundation certification exam as well as providing valuable practical knowledge that can be rapidly applied in the workplace.
Quint Wellington Redwood’s integrated case study deepens the participant’s appreciation of how ITIL best practices can be applied in order to improve IT performance.

COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Students will receive ITIL Foundation classroom workbooks containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.

PROFESSIONAL SPEAKER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)

CERTIFICATE:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.

Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

  • Identify the principles and concepts of IT Service Management based on ITIL.

items.Title: APMG-International Accredited ITIL® Foundation Training with Case Study

items.Audience:
IT Professionals, IT Support Staff, Application, Project and Business Managers, Any member of an IT team involved in the delivery of IT Services
 
PREREQUISITES:
There are no pre-requisites for this course, although a basic knowledge of Service Management concepts will be helpful.
items.Description:
The ITIL® Foundation course is the entry level certification course for IT Service Management Best Practices training in ITIL. This course covers the latest version of core ITIL best practices presented from a lifecycle perspective. The course introduces the principles and core elements of IT service management (ITSM) based on ITIL.
ITIL is comprised of five core publications: Service Strategy, Service Design, Service Transition, Service Operations and Continual Service Improvement. These 5 cores promote alignment with the business as well as improve operational efficiency.
This course is delivered using an exciting case study designed to further enhance and cement the candidates understanding of ITIL. Students who have attended this course are suitably prepared to successfully take the associated ITIL Foundation certification test which is a requirement for attending any of the further training courses (ITIL intermediate level training) available in this track.

COURSE OUTLINE:
1. Introduction
2. Service Strategy
3. Service Design
4. Service Transition
5. Service Operation
6. Continual Service Improvement
7. Exam preparation
(For more detail of course outline, please contact us at 3543 7900 or hk.academy@sgs.com)

COURSE APPROACH:
Participants will learn the principles and core elements of the service lifecycle approach to IT Service Management according to ITIL.
An interactive approach is used combining lecture, discussion and case study experience to prepare participants for the ITIL Foundation certification exam as well as providing valuable practical knowledge that can be rapidly applied in the workplace.
Quint Wellington Redwood’s integrated case study deepens the participant’s appreciation of how ITIL best practices can be applied in order to improve IT performance.

COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Students will receive ITIL Foundation classroom workbooks containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.

PROFESSIONAL SPEAKER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)

CERTIFICATE:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.


Course Delivery: Classroom
Reference Materials: Additional reference materials are not required for this course

About the Examination:
The exam is closed book with forty (40) multiple choice questions. The pass score is 65% (26 out of 40 questions). The exam lasts 60 minutes.

CREDITS:
Upon successfully achieving the ITIL Foundation certificate, the student will be recognized with 2 credits in the ITIL® qualification scheme.

Project Management Institute – Professional Development Units (PDUs) = 21

REMARKS: The SGS course on this page is offered by Quint Wellington Redwood.

items.Description:
ITIL is comprised of five core publications: Service Strategy, Service Design, Service Transition, Service Operations and Continual Service Improvement. These 5 cores promotes alignment with the business as well as improves operational efficiency. The official ITIL® qualification scheme describes two streams, the Service Lifecycle Stream and the Service Capability stream.
 
The Service Lifecycle stream focuses on ITIL practices within the Service Lifecycle context. The prime focus is the Lifecycle itself as well as the process and practice elements used within it. The Service Capability stream is for those who wish to obtain an in depth understanding of ITIL processes and roles. Attention to the Service Lifecycle is illustrated as part of the curriculum but the primary focus is the on the process activities, execution and use throughout the Service Lifecycle.
 
The ITIL® SO (Service Operation) course is part of the ITIL® Intermediate Lifecycle certification stream. The course prepares candidates to take the ITIL® Service Operation Intermediate exam as well as provides valuable knowledge that can be implemented in the workplace.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
1. COURSE INTRODUCTION
2. PRINCIPLES
3. PROCESSES
4. ACTIVITIES
5. ORGANIZATION
6. TECHNOLOGY CONSIDERATIONS
7. IMPLEMENTATION AND IMPROVEMENT
8. CHALLENGES, CRITICAL SUCCESS FACTORS AND RISKS
9. EXAM PREPARATION
(For more detail of course outline, please contact us at 3543 7900 or hk.academy@sgs.com)

Students will receive an ITIL Service Operation classroom workbook containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.

items.Audience:
Organizations or Individuals seeing the need for a controlled approach to managing projects (including Project managers, consultants and support staff)
 
PREREQUISITES:
There are no prerequisites for this course
items.Description:
PRINCE2® is a process-based approach for project management providing an easily tailored and scalable method for the management of all types of projects. PRINCE2® is recognized as a world-class international product and is the de facto standard method for project management throughout the world. The PRINCE2® method is in the public domain, offering nonproprietary, best practice guidance on project management.
 
The PRINCE2® Foundation course will provide delegates with a detailed knowledge of the PRINCE2® methodology including the seven processes, seven themes and seven principles central to running a project using the PRINCE2® method. The successful completion of the Foundation exam will give the delegate a recognized Foundation qualification. The Foundation level measures whether a delegate would be able to act as an informed member of a project management team using the PRINCE2® method within a project environment supporting PRINCE2®.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
Principles

  • Continued business justification
  • Learn from experience
  • Defined roles and responsibilities
  • Manage by stages
  • Manage by Exception
  • Focus on products
  • Tailor to suit the project environment

 
Themes

  • Business Case
  • Organization
  • Quality
  • Plans
  • Risk
  • Change
  • Progress

 
Processes

  • Starting up a Project
  • Directing a Project
  • Initiating a Project
  • Controlling a Stage
  • Managing Product Delivery
  • Managing Stage Boundaries
  • Closing a Project

COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Two weeks prior, students will receive Pre-Read material to prepare themselves for the course. At the beginning of the course, students will receive a PRINCE2® Foundation classroom workbook containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.
 
PROFESSIONAL SPEAKER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 
CERTIFICATE:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials

* Early Bird Discount will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking
 
Course Delivery: Classroom
Reference Materials: PRINCE2® Foundation Pre-Read
 
About the Examination:
The exam is closed book with 75 multiple choice questions. 5 of the 75 questions are under trial and will not contribute to your overall score. The pass score is 50% (35 out of the 70 questions). The exam lasts 60 minutes and Paper based.
 
CREDITS:
Project Management Institute – Professional Development Units (PDUs) = 21
 
REMARKS: The SGS course on this page is offered by Quint Wellington Redwood.
items.Keywords: APMG,Prince2, (IT/18)
items.Objectives:
Following the completion of the course, participants will be able to:
  • Learn, understand and use the most important concepts of the PRINCE2® method.
  • Monitor a project within the boundaries of the Project Plan.
  • Participate effectively in a project in accordance with the PRINCE2® method.
  • Describe the purpose and major content of all roles, the seven themes, the seven processes and the sub-processes, and the seven principles.
  • State which management products are input to, or output from the seven processes.
  • State the main purpose, and key contents, of the major management products.
  • State the relationships between processes, deliverables, roles and the management dimensions of a project.
  • Pass the Foundation Exam.
  • Lay a firm Foundation knowledge to allow delegates to move onto Practitioner Level.
  • Understand the level of responsibility, authority and accountability held by those involved in the project.
  • Articulate the steps needed to guide the project through controlled, well managed and visible sets of activities to achieve the desired results.
