items.Description:
PRINCE2® is a process-based approach for project management providing an easily tailored and scalable method for the management of all types of projects.
 
PRINCE2® is recognized as a world-class international product and is the defacto standard method for project management throughout the world.
 
The PRINCE2® method is in the public domain, offering nonproprietary, best practice guidance on project management.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  • Initiating a Project
  • Directing a Project
  • Managing a Stage Boundary

COURSE APPROACH:
The course comprises a mixture of input sessions, group exercises and examination based practical work. All delegates are encouraged to actively participate during the practical sessions to gain the full benefit during the training.
 
During the course, delegates will undertake a number of mock examinations and gain feedback on the progress towards eventual success. To prepare effectively for the PRINCE2® Practitioner exam, delegates should be prepared to undertake revision and exam preparation work in the evening.

items.Audience:
Professional working for both client and service provider organization in the IT Industry who have little experience in outsourcing.
 
PREREQUISITES:
There are no pre-requisites for this course, although a basic knowledge of IT outsourcing concepts will be helpful.
items.Description:
The Sourcing Governance Foundation course provides a basic knowledge of what the main concepts of Outsourcing and Sourcing Governance are and how they can be applied. Outsourcing IT services has changed the management context for providing the business with the IT services it needs. Operational control is transferred into management of commercial relationship, contracts and coordination of the services from specialized suppliers. Best practice shows that implementing and operating a Sourcing Governance Function will require staff awareness and understanding of the key principles and concepts of outsourcing and sourcing governance. In this course, an interactive approach is used combing lecture, discussion and exercises.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:
  1. Introduction to Outsourcing
  2. Preparing to Outsource
  3. Supplier Selection and Due Diligence
  4. Developing the Outsourcing Financial Case and Pricing
  5. Contracting and Negotiation
  6. Managing the transition and outsourced environment
  7. Demand Supply Governance Framework
  8. Design a DSO
  9. Exam Prep
 
International Association of Outsourcing Professionals® (IAOP®) has created the Sourcing Governance Foundation certification. Undertaking the course and successfully passing the examination qualifies an individual for COS-FP (Certified Outsourcing Specialist™ - Foundation Principles) certification from the International Association of Outsourcing Professionals® (IAOP®).
 
The Certified Outsourcing Specialist – Foundation Principles designation distinguishes individuals are grounded in the basic knowledge and skills in the field of outsourcing. It powerfully demonstrates that they possess exposure to and general knowledge required to design, implement and manage outsourcing initiatives that have a high probability of achieving an organization’s intended outcomes.
 
COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Students will receive a Sourcing Governance Foundation classroom workbook containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.
 
PROFESSIONAL SPEAKER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 
CERTIFICATE:

About the Examination:
The exam is closed book with forty (40) multiple choice questions.
The pass score is 70% (28 out of 40 questions). The exam lasts 60 minutes.

Upon successfully achieving the Sourcing Governance Foundation certificate, the student will be recognizedIOAP 25 Certification Points and

The Sourcing Governance Foundation course provides a basic knowledge of what the main concepts of Outsourcing and Sourcing Governance are and how they can be applied. Outsourcing IT services has changed the management context for providing the business with the IT services it needs. Operational control is transferred into management of commercial relationship, contracts and coordination of the services from specialized suppliers. Best practice shows that implementing and operating a Sourcing Governance Function will require staff awareness and understanding of the key principles and concepts of outsourcing and sourcing governance. In this course, an interactive approach is used combing lecture, discussion and exercises.
 
COURSE OUTLINE:

  1. Introduction to Outsourcing
  2. Preparing to Outsource
  3. Supplier Selection and Due Diligence
  4. Developing the Outsourcing Financial Case and Pricing
  5. Contracting and Negotiation
  6. Managing the transition and outsourced environment
  7. Demand Supply Governance Framework
  8. Design a DSO
  9. Exam Prep

 
International Association of Outsourcing Professionals® (IAOP®) has created the Sourcing Governance Foundation certification. Undertaking the course and successfully passing the examination qualifies an individual for COS-FP (Certified Outsourcing Specialist™ - Foundation Principles) certification from the International Association of Outsourcing Professionals® (IAOP®).
 
The Certified Outsourcing Specialist – Foundation Principles designation distinguishes individuals are grounded in the basic knowledge and skills in the field of outsourcing. It powerfully demonstrates that they possess exposure to and general knowledge required to design, implement and manage outsourcing initiatives that have a high probability of achieving an organization’s intended outcomes.
 
COURSE STUDENT MATERIAL:
Students will receive a Sourcing Governance Foundation classroom workbook containing all of the presentation materials, course notes, case study and sample exams.
 
PROFESSIONAL SPEAKER:
Mr. Rocky Lam (Principal Consultant of Quint Wellington Redwood), APMG-International approved ISO/IEC20000 Accredited Trainer (Foundation, Auditor, Practitioner Courses).
(SGS Hong Kong Ltd. reserves the right of final tutor arrangement)
 
CERTIFICATE:
Delegates who successfully complete the course and pass the written examination will be issued a Certificate by APMG-International.
 
GENERAL INFORMATION:
Venue: T.S.T. / Wan Chai Training Centre / TBC
Medium: Cantonese supplemented with English materials


* Early Bird Discount will be offered to participant whose enrolment is made one month prior to the course or online booking

Course Delivery: Classroom
Reference Materials: Additional reference materials are not required for this course.
 
About the Examination:
The exam is closed book with forty (40) multiple choice questions.
The pass score is 70% (28 out of 40 questions). The exam lasts 60 minutes.
 
CREDITS:
Upon successfully achieving the Sourcing Governance Foundation certificate, the student will be recognizedIOAP 25 Certification Points and
 
Project Management Institute – Professional Development Units (PDUs) = 14
 
REMARKS: The SGS course on this page is offered by Quint Wellington Redwood.

items.Description:
a. Introduction

- Brief introduction to ISO 14001

- Terms and Definitions and basic terminology in EMS

- Risk-based thinking and framework of Environmental Management System

b. Application of Risk-Based Thinking under requirements ISO 14001: 2015

- Clause 4.0 Context of the organization

- Understanding the Organization and its context

- Determine external issues includes environmental issues that affecting

organization

- Determine internal issues includes environmental conditions that affected

by organization

- Understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties

- Determine the requirements of interested parties that are relevant with EMS

- Determine the requirements could become compliance obligation

- Determine the scope of EMS

- Environmental Management System

- Clause 6.0 Planning

- Actions to address risks and opportunities

- Risk Management for the context of the organization

- Taking actions to address external and internal issues, requirements of

interested parties that are relevant to the organization

- Compliance obligation

- Environmental objectives and planning to achieve them

- Clause 9.0 Performance evaluation

- Monitoring, measurements, analysis and evaluation

- Internal audit

- Management review

- Clause 10.0 Improvement

- Nonconformity and Corrective action

- Continual improvement

c. Introduction to ISO 31000

- Scope and Principles

- Risk Management Framework

- Internal/External Context

- Risk Management Policy

- Organization Process, Resources, Communication

- Implementation, Monitoring and Review

- Risk Management Process

- Risk Assessment & Risk Treatment

- Monitoring, Review and Recording

- Attributes of Enhanced Risk Management

- Integration with other management system 

- Challenges and improvement

d. Risk Management

- Establishing the context

- Conduct risk assessment, includes risk identification, risk analysis and risk

evaluation

- Implement risk treatment

items.Audience: Prerequisites:        Must have a working knowledge of SPC and MSA or have completed Understanding and Implementing MSA and SPC training plus have a working knowledge of Excel®.
items.Description:
Improve your understanding of the integration of statistical process control (SPC) and measurement systems analysis (MSA) into ISO/TS 16949 and discover how to develop a higher quality process control system by selecting and applying the appropriate statistical tools.

Through a combination of instructor-led training and team exercises, you learn how SPC and MSA can be applied to a manufacturing environment. The goal is to illustrate how these techniques can be incorporated into a system to provide for not only process improvement, but also product improvement.

 

Important: The course requires you to come with a laptop loaded with Excel®. It is also recommended that you download the following demos: QI Macros and Minitab (latest version) before arriving to the class.
items.Keywords: quality, spc, core, tool, tools, 16949, iso, ts, iso/ts, manager, team, auditor, implementation, fmea, risk, reduction, statistic, statistical, process, control, automotive, auto, excel, minitab, integrate, 9001, quality, msa, spc
items.Objectives:
• Improve the performance of your quality management system by practicing the basics of SPC, how SPC and MSA are interrelated, and the fundamental tools/techniques for both SPC and MSA.
  • Develop and execute plans to implement SPC and MSA, including which tools/techniques are applicable for differing circumstances.
  • Calculate and interpret following the steps in the SPC and MSA manuals.
  • Compare and contrast Prevention versus Detection
  • Identify Common and Special Causes of Variation
  • Utilize X-bar and R Charts: Construction, Setting Limits, Analysis, Process Control, Individual and Moving Range Charts: Construction, Setting Limits, Analysis, Process Control
  • Interpret Process Capability: Pp, Ppk, Cp, Cpk, Analysis
  • Read Attribute Charts: Proportion Nonconforming (p) Charts and Nonconformities (c) Charts; Construction, Setting Limits, Analysis, Process Control
  • Enable Process Stability
  • Define Measurement Systems and the Measurement Process
  • Interpret Measurement Studies for Stability, Bias, and Linearity with Examples
  • Interpret Measurement Studies for Repeatability and Reproducibility with Examples
  • Identify Measurement Uncertainty
  • Interpret Measurement Studies for Attributes with Examples
  • Relate SPC and MSA to ISO 9001:2008 and ISO/TS 16949:2009

CERTIFICADO:
Fornecido para alunos que cumprirem a frequência mínima (75% para temas não registrados e 100% em cursos registrados) e participarem de todos os workshops, conforme abaixo:
 
· Aprovação: para alunos aprovados nos treinamentos com mínimo de 70%;
· Participação: para treinamentos em que não há avaliação ou para alunos reprovados (resultado inferior a 70%).
 
Visando contribuir com ações sustentáveis e gerar maior praticidade ao cliente, o certificado é digital e estará disponível no Portal SGS Academy após o treinamento, sendo o prazo de 60 dias para cursos registrados e 30 dias para demais treinamentos. Caso opte também pelo certificado impresso, basta solicitar ao e-mail br.treinamento@sgs.com mediante taxa de R$ 50,00.

items.Description:
The quality of In-House Training is EVERYTHING. It enables your company to keep up with the latest industry practice, keep on top of ever-changing technical standards and comply with current legal and regulatory obligations. It furnishes your employees with the skills and knowledge to transform your business.

Yet, maintaining the same level of learning across your organization can be complex, especially when dealing with numerous training providers. That’s why your company needs to ensure that all employees receive consistent, effective, high-quality training.

Transforming PEOPLE & BUSINESS with SGS ACADEMY: Further Excellence in Training to meet your company's needs

As a global leader in professional training, we offer you the very best in professional development training and customized training solutions. Our unrivaled experience and expert tutors ensures that you benefit from consistent training and development at every level of your organization.

With a proven track record delivering in-house, the world’s largest companies and government organizations trust us to train their professionals. So can you.

Our courses cover everything from safety to quality, compliance to sustainability, brand protection to risk management. Whatever your industry, whatever the subject, we can help you:

  • Keep up-to-date with the latest industry best practice, technical standards and current legal and regulatory compliance expectations
  • Gain the skills and knowledge you need to move forward
  • Learn how to manage and improve environmental impact
  • Identify, manage and reduce risk by meeting legal duty-of-care and health and safety obligations
  • Develop and retain talent through improved management and leadership development programs
  • Understand how to enhance the quality and efficiency of management systems and standards
  • Improve productivity, integrity and performance throughout the supply chain
  • Build a more responsible and sustainable future
  • Learn in a way that suits your needs, learning styles and goals with a range of flexible solutions, including public courses, in-house training, e-learning and virtual learning
items.Keywords: in house, SGS Academy, Further Excellence, Training, tutor, expert trainers, skills, staff, employee, management
items.Objectives:
TRAINING CUSTOMIZED TO YOUR EXACT REQUIREMENTS

When it comes to tailored training, we can even work with you to define your training needs and deliver customized training solutions to meet your exact learning requirements. Plus, with expert trainers that are experienced practitioners in their fields, our training moves beyond theory, giving you valuable real-world insights. To talk to us about how the SGS Academy can help you with your Training Requirements, Contact Us TODAY hk.academy.admin@sgs.com to see what we can do for you. We’re here to help!

Let us know your Training topic, Number of delegates, Type and Level of staff or Aims for the training. We will then contact you within 3 working days with a quotation.

items.Description:
The aerospace industry must meet the highest levels of safety whether you work in design and manufacture or offer overhaul and repair services. Quality in the aerospace industry, from commercial to defense aviation, is measured against the AS 9100 standard series.

AS 9100 aerospace standards, developed by the International Aerospace Quality Group (IAQG), covers the entire supply chain. This includes companies that design and manufacture equipment and supply accessories or replacement parts, as well as those that offer supply and maintenance or overhaul and repair services. The standard is universally adopted, but has a different name on different continents. AS 9100 is used in the Americas, EN 9100 in Europe and in the Asia-Pacific region JISQ 9100.

Associated Standards

AS 9100 is the core standard for aerospace certification, but we can also guide you through the associated standards, published by the Society of Automotive Engineers, that relate to different segments of the industry as necessary:

  • AS 9110 – for Maintenenace and Repair Organisations
  • AS 9120 – aerospace stockists and pass-through distributors
  • AS 9003 – outsourced inspection and test quality system providers

In addition to certification services, we offer in-depth training to explain the requirements of AS 9100 and the associated quality management standards. Contact your local SGS office to find the course schedule for your region.

We also offer a selection of services to help you manage quality and develop a culture of continuous improvement:

  • Simultaneous audit and certification of your QMS systems with other management systems you have implemented
  • Customized audit solutions against bespoke quality performance criteria. SGS can help develop criteria or simply check performance against existing measures

Demonstrate your commitment to aerospace standards with an AS9100 standard audit from SGS.

 

This training is designed for you to have gain a solid understanding of the documentation requirements of AS 9100C.  It also provides a robust framework for documenting your organization's quality management system.

Topics:

  • Introduction
  • Terms and definitions
  • Quality objectives
  • Quality policy
  • Quality manual
  • Mandatory procedures
  • Records
  • Effective planning, operation and control
  • Documenting procedures and work instructions
  • Workshops

  • Prepare your organization's quality manual, procedures and work instructions

items.Description:
AS 9110 is based on AS 9100 and adds specific requirements that are critical for the maintenance in the aerospace industry, particularly commercial, private, and military aircraft. This standard defines the quality system requirements based on AS9100:2000 with additional criteria for maintenance, repair and overhaul facilities in the industry.  

This course is designed for those who aim to have a deeper understanding of the requirements of the standard specifically in terms of internal audit requirements and practices.

Topics:
  • Review on the requirements of AS9110
  • Approaches in Auditing Procedures for the different AS9110 Clauses
  • Planning an audit
  • Conducting an audit
  • Reporting results
  • Follow-up

Procedures for planning and conducting audits and reporting audit results shall be done during the workshops plus actual audit of some of the documented procedures.
items.Keywords: Aerospace, AS9110b, aviation supply chain
items.Objectives: This course aims to hone internal auditors of the organization, providing delegates with knowledge on the requirements/clauses of the standard. This course also trains Internal Quality Auditors on the preparation, conduct and reporting of internal and supplier system audit.
items.Title: AS 9110b Internal Audit Course

items.Audience: Participants should come from the departments which will be included in the quality systems. These are Production, Quality Control, Purchasing Materials, Engineering, Sales Marketing and Training or their equivalent.
items.Description:
Many aircraft components are designed and manufactured to last 50 years or more.  As a result of this long life cycle, the aerospace industry recognizes that proper repair, maintenance and overhaul (MRO) are vital for the continued safe operation of aircraft.  In response to these unique needs, aerospace industry stakeholders developed the AS9110 Standard industry to control repair and maintenance procedures, quality management, and minimum skills and qualifications of those conducting MRO procedures.

The AS 9110 standard sets criteria for businesses providing commercial, private and military aircraft maintenance, repair and overhaul. This standard also applies to companies manufacturing aircraft parts and components seeking Parts Manufacturing Approval (PMA) from the FAA. AS9110 does not replace, but complements your other regulatory and contractual requirements.   SGS provides aviation maintenance inspections and AS9110 Certification, which provides you with a number of important benefits:

  • A complete understanding of the initial and ongoing requirements of AS9110 for your operation and your suppliers
  • More efficient documentation management procedures result in increased efficiency and cost savings
  • Identification of areas of improvement in your organization

SGS is the world’s leading certification, inspection and verification organization. We have the depth and breadth of experience in the aerospace industry to verify that your maintenance, repair and overhaul operations meet AS9110 requirements. We also ensure that you understand the standard and how it impacts on your operational procedures.

When you certify to AS9110, you demonstrate your commitment to safety and quality Partner with SGS for reliable, comprehensive certification that is recognized throughout the aerospace industry.

 

This training is designed for you to have gain a solid understanding of the documentation requirements of AS 9110B.  It also provides a robust framework for documenting your organization's quality management system.

Topics:

  • Introduction
  • Terms and definitions
  • Quality objectives
  • Quality policy
  • Quality manual
  • Mandatory procedures
  • Records
  • Effective planning, operation and control
  • Documenting procedures and work instructions
  • Workshops
items.Keywords: AS 9110B Documentation Course Requirements for Aviation Maintenance Organizations
items.Objectives:
Upon completion of this course, you should know how to:

  • Understand the documentation framework and requirements of the standard
  • Develop and implement a documentation plan
  • Prepare your organization's quality manual, procedures and work instructions

items.Description:
Many aircraft components are designed and manufactured to last 50 years or more.  As a result of this long life cycle, the aerospace industry recognizes that proper repair, maintenance and overhaul (MRO) are vital for the continued safe operation of aircraft.  In response to these unique needs, aerospace industry stakeholders developed the AS9110 Standard industry to control repair and maintenance procedures, quality management, and minimum skills and qualifications of those conducting MRO procedures.

The AS 9110 standard sets criteria for businesses providing commercial, private and military aircraft maintenance, repair and overhaul. This standard also applies to companies manufacturing aircraft parts and components seeking Parts Manufacturing Approval (PMA) from the FAA. AS9110 does not replace, but complements your other regulatory and contractual requirements.   SGS provides aviation maintenance inspections and AS9110 Certification, which provides you with a number of important benefits:

  • A complete understanding of the initial and ongoing requirements of AS9110 for your operation and your suppliers
  • More efficient documentation management procedures result in increased efficiency and cost savings
  • Identification of areas of improvement in your organization

SGS is the world’s leading certification, inspection and verification organization. We have the depth and breadth of experience in the aerospace industry to verify that your maintenance, repair and overhaul operations meet AS9110 requirements. We also ensure that you understand the standard and how it impacts on your operational procedures.

When you certify to AS9110, you demonstrate your commitment to safety and quality Partner with SGS for reliable, comprehensive certification that is recognized throughout the aerospace industry.

 

Topics:

* Background and development of AS9110

* Provides understanding of AS9110 elements and implementation, requirements and certification

* Terms/Definitions related to AS9110

* Certification Process

 

Training Methodology:

* Lectures

* Group Discussion

items.Objectives:
This course provides delegates with the basic understanding of ISO AS9110B and its benefits. Attendees will also learn about implementation and auditing requirements on the maintenance of aerospace vehicles, aircrafts or associated components including commercial, private and military.

items.Title: AS 9110C Internal Audit Course Requirements for Aviation Maintenance Organizations

items.Audience: This course is useful as an introduction for anyone who wants to be involved in the development, implementation and maintenance of the safety management systems.
items.Author: SSC Australia
items.Description: This training will provide you with an overview of the purpose and requirements of OHSAS 18001 for occupational health and safety. We provide you with an overview of the purpose and requirements of OHSAS 18001 and how it can improve your business methods. By the completion of the training you will be able to describe the purpose of an Occupational Health & Safety Management System (OH&SMS). You will also be able to explain the purpose, requirements and reasoning for OHSAS 18001:2007, the related legislative framework and how the standard aids the continual improvement of the OH&SMS.
items.Keywords: OHSAS 18001, AS/NZ 4801, ASNZ4801, 18001, 4801, Occupational Health and Safety, OH&S, OHSAS, Management Systems.
items.Objectives:
The course is an introduction for anyone involved in the development, implementation and management of a SMS based on OHSAS 18001. If you plan to complete other OHSAS training, such as internal auditing and the Lead Auditor Training, you will receive during this course the knowledge and understanding of OHSAS 18001 upon which to build auditing skills.

The course comprises presentations and workshop exercises.

Contact SGS now for further information on SGS OHSAS 18001 Awareness Training. Email Us
items.Title: AS/NZS 4801/OHSAS 18001 - Occupational Health and Safety Management Systems - Awareness Training

items.Audience: This course is useful as for anyone who wants to be involved in the development, implementation and conducting internal audits of the safety management system.
items.Author: SSC Australia
items.Description: AS/NZS 4801/OHSAS 18001 Internal Auditor Training from SGS – develop the skills to conduct and compile internal audits.
items.Keywords: OHSAS 18001, AS/NZ 4801, ASNZ4801, 18001, 4801, Occupational Health and Safety, OH&S, OHSAS, Management Systems, Internal Auditing.
items.Objectives:
This training has been designed to equip participants with the knowledge and skills needed to assess and report on the conformance and effective implementation of an occupational health and safety management system.

On completion of this training you will be able to:

  • Describe the responsibilities of an internal auditor and describe the role of internal audit in the maintenance and improvement of management systems, in accordance with OHSAS 18001:2007
  • Explain the purpose and structure of OHSAS 18001:2007
  • Explain the principles, process and selected techniques used for the assignment and management of occupational health & safety aspects and impacts, including the significance of these for OHSAS auditors
  • Plan and prepare for an internal audit, gather audit evidence through observation, interview and sampling of documents and records
  • Write factual audit reports that help to improve the effectiveness of the management system
  • Suggest ways in which the effectiveness of corrective action might be verified

The training comprises presentations, workshops and role-play exercises.

Why choose OHSAS 18001 internal auditor training from SGS?

Our courses are delivered by tutors who are quality management system experts and experienced trainers. Your knowledge and skills will be developed through an interactive and practical approach to learning.

Contact SGS now for more information on SGS OHSAS 18001 Internal Auditor Training. Email Us

items.Audience:
Individuals whose organizations design, develop, or provide aviation, space and defense products and services; and organizations providing post-delivery activities, including the provision of maintenance, spare parts, or materials for their own products and services.


PREREQUISITES:

Prior knowledge of:

  • PDCA-based Management Systems: 
  • Quality Management Basics
  • AS9100D Requirements 
Virtual learners require hardware with internet connection and audio connection
items.Author: UK
items.Description:
Through a series of interactive sessions and hands-on workshops, develop the knowledge and skills required to perform an internal audit of part of a quality management system based on AS9100D, report on the effective implementation and maintenance of the management system in accordance with ISO 19011, and contribute to the continual improvement of the management system.  


Topics include: Process-Based QMS, Auditing for Continual Improvement, Audit Definitions and Principles, Audit Planning and Preparation, Audit Performance, Audit Report Writing and Follow-Up, Auditor Competence and Certification
items.Keywords: AS, 91000D, PDCA, QMS, internal audit, quality management system, report, implementation, maintenance, ISO, 19011, continual improvement, aviation, space, aerospace, principles, planning, preparation, performance, follow up, competence, certification, defense, spare parts, elearning, onsite, virtual, as, 9100, d, training, e-learning, online, virtual, 19011, aero, aerospace, transportation, audit, auditing, pdca, quality, qms,
items.Objectives:
Upon successful completion, Learners will be able to:

  1. With reference to the PDCA cycle, explain the process-based QMS model for AS 9100, and the role of internal audit in the maintenance and improvement of quality management systems.
  2. Explain the role and responsibilities of an auditor to plan, conduct, report and follow up an internal quality management system audit, in accordance with ISO 19011.
  3. Plan, conduct, report, and follow-up an internal audit of part of a quality management system based on AS 9100D, and in accordance with ISO 19011.

items.Title: AS9100 Rev D Aerospace Quality Management Systems Internal Auditor Training

items.Audience: Executives and Upper Level Management
items.Description: The Executive Understanding program is a series of individual courses that an organization can pick and choose what is covered to fit their customized needs.  There are 5 independent modules including:  Executive Briefing, Describing the System, Factors for Successful Implementation, QMS Requirements Overview, and Planning for Implementation.  Choose which modules fit your needs and time allowance, and we will provide a highly experienced consultant to explain the benefits and necessary resources for your company’s commitment to AS9100: 2009 (AS9100C, EN9100, JISQ9100).
items.Keywords: as, 9100, as9100c, 9100c, iso, 9001, quality, aero, aerospace, executive, understand, standard, en, jisq, management, upper, system, 9100, implementation, planning, top, process, approach, conflict, resolution, problem, solving
items.Objectives:
AVAILABLE MODULES: Learning Objectives

 

Module 1:  Executive Briefing (2 hours)

  • Identify Top management responsibilities
  • Define a Quality Management Systems
  • Map Processes
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the purpose and intent of the Standard

 

Module 2:  Describing the System (4 hours)

  • Plan responsibilities
  • Map the organization utilizing a process based approach
  • Analyze a system of processes through the identification and analysis of individual processes
  • Create Turtle diagrams
  • Demonstrate an understanding of Process Approach

 

Module 3:  Factors for Successful Implementation (1 hour)

  • Identify Executive commitment
  • Identify Organizational culture
  • Resolve Conflict
  • Demonstrate skills in problem solving, communication, team and cross functional management implementation

 

Module 4:  QMS Requirements Overview (1-2 hours)

  • Demonstrate an understanding of the standard and related requirements

 

Module 5:  Planning for Implementation (1-2 hours)

  • Plan Strategically
  • Plan Tactics
  • Plan Operations
  • Analyze the mission
  • Set objectives to achieve the vision

items.Title: AS9100C Executive Understanding

items.Audience: This seminar is designed for Management Representatives, AS9100C Implementation Teams, Internal Auditors and others who would like to develop judgment and decision-making in AS9100C and learn the auditing process for first, second, and third party auditors.  An extensive understanding of the AS9100C requirements and/or work experience in applying AS9100C is recommended.
items.Description:
This seminar fully covers the AS9100C requirements in addition to the requirements of the AS9100C, which is the quality management standard for Aviation, Space and Defense organizations. Other topics include audit systems, the auditing process and audit instruments; the documentation process, conducting an audit, writing the audit report, and taking corrective action. Auditing case studies to develop skills for identifying nonconformities will be used.
Aerospace Process Approach Auditing has three main components – Process Auditing, Customer Focus and Leadership Auditing – each of which must follow the requirements laid out in AS9101D and the Aerospace Auditor Transition Training (AATT). This course will give instruction and guidance on conducting the Process Audit using the PEAR form and Turtle Diagrams

This three-day course is recognized by Exemplar Global under the TPECS scheme, and meets the knowledge criteria requirements for the Internal QMS Auditor grade or lower. Attendees who successfully demonstrate competence during this course will achieve a Certificate of Attainment for the following competency units:
  • RABQSA-QM
  • RABQSA-AU
items.Keywords: aerospace, aviation, understanding, introduction, quality, assurance, management, standard, systems, system, as, 9100, c, 9100c, iso, 9001, 2008, compliance, auditor, exemplar, global, tpecs, rabqsa, auditor, internal, audit, auditing, training
items.Objectives:
Seminar Goals:
·         Understand the application of Quality Management Principles in the context of ISO 9001:2008 and/or AS9100C.
·         Relate the quality management system to the organizational products, including services, and operational processes.
·         Understand the application of the principles, procedures and techniques of auditing.
·         Understand the conduct of an effective audit in the context of the auditee’s organizational situation.
·         Understand the application of the regulations, and other considerations that are relevant to the management system, and the conduct of the audit.
·         Practice personal attributes necessary for the effective and efficient conduct of a management system audit.

items.Description:
This five-day course is recognized by Exemplar Global under the TPECS scheme meeting the knowledge competency requirements for the Lead QMS Auditor grade or lower. This seminar fully covers the ISO 9001 requirements in addition to the requirements of AS9100C, which is the quality management standard for Aviation, Space and Defense organizations.

Other topics include audit systems, the auditing process and audit instruments; the documentation process, conducting an audit, writing the audit report, and taking corrective action. Auditing case studies to develop skills for identifying nonconformities will be used.

Note: The Aerospace Auditor Transition Training (AATT) must also be completed in order to become a certified Aerospace Auditor.

Aerospace Process Approach Auditing has three main components – Process Auditing, Customer Focus and Leadership Auditing – each of which must follow the requirements laid out in AS9101D. This course will give instruction and guidance on conducting the Process Audit using the PEAR form and Turtle Diagrams.

Attendees who successfully demonstrate competence during this course will achieve a Certificate of Attainment for the following competency units:
  • Exemplar Global-QM
  • Exemplar Global-AU
  • Exemplar Global-TL

  • Understand the conduct of an effective audit in the context of the auditee’s organizational situation.

ระดับวิศวกร                                                                       

ระดับบริหาร
items.Description:
เพื่อให้ครอบคลุมเนื้อหาที่สามารถนำไปใช้งานได้จริง ขอนำเสนอการสัมมนา โดยมีจุดมุ่งหมายเพื่อ.....

  1. เรียนรู้แนวคิดและหลักการสำคัญของระบบจัดการคุณภาพ ISO 9001:2015
  2. เรียนรู้ข้อกำหนดและแนวทางการจัดทำระบบจัดการ AS9100D โดยละเอียด
  3. ให้ทราบวิธีการประยุกต์ใช้ระบบ AS9100D โดยเน้นให้เกิดความรู้ ความเข้าใจและการประยุกต์ใช้อย่างมีประสิทธิภาพ
  4. สามารถพัฒนาเอกสารในระบบจัดการคุณภาพให้สอดคล้องตามข้อกำหนดของ AS9100D
  5. ให้คำแนะนำขั้นตอนในการพัฒนาและรักษาความต่อเนื่องของระบบจัดการคุณภาพ AS9100D
items.Objectives:
AS9100DD: Quality Systems - Aerospace (AS9100:20016) เป็นมาตรฐานระบบจัดการคุณภาพที่พัฒนาขึ้นมาใหม่ เพื่อให้เป็นมาตรฐานระบบจัดการคุณภาพเกี่ยวกับอุตสาหกรรม อวกาศ การบินและการทหาร โดยพัฒนาขึ้นมาจาก ISO 9001: 2015   โดยมีเป้าหมายสำคัญ คือ การพัฒนาให้เกิดมาตรฐานระดับโลกของอุตสาหกรรม อวกาศ การบิน และการทหาร ที่นำไปสู่การยกระดับคุณภาพและการลดต้นทุนตลอดทั้งซัพพลายเชน (Supply chain)  รวมถึงการลดจุดอ่อนในการใช้ระบบจัดการ ISO 9001 มาประยุกต์ใช้ในองค์การทางด้านอวกาศ การบินและการทหาร ที่ไม่สามารถตอบสนองต่อกฎระเบียบ มาตรฐานทางด้านความปลอดภัย (Safety) ความน่าเชื่อถือไว้วางใจ(Reliability) และความสามารถในการบำรุงรักษา(Maintainability) อย่างเพียงพอ รวมถึงการที่ข้อตกลงเฉพาะ (Specific requirements) ต่างๆในระดับโลกก็ได้ถูกกำหนดเอาไว้รวมกันในมาตรฐาน AS9100D ฉบับนี้

สิ่งสำคัญที่เป็นหัวใจของ AS9100D คือระบบจัดการคุณภาพและความเสี่ยง เพื่อทำให้มั่นใจได้ว่าจะต้องไม่เกิดความผิดพลาดใดๆในการออกแบบและการผลิต ของผลิตภัณฑ์อวกาศ การบินและการทหาร ดังนั้นการนำเอาข้อกำหนด AS9100D มาใช้อย่างถูกต้องและมีประสิทธิผลจึงเป็นสิ่งสำคัญของทีมงานที่รับผิดชอบในองค์กร
items.Title: AS9100D Aerospace Standard - QMS Requirements (SS0431) (2 Days) - On site

ระดับหัวหน้างาน

ระดับบริหาร
items.Description:
เพื่อให้ครอบคลุมเนื้อหาที่สามารถนำไปใช้งานได้จริง จึง ขอนำเสนอการสัมมนา โดยมีจุดมุ่งหมายเพื่อ.....

  • ให้ทราบแนวทางการประยุกต์ใช้ของระบบคุณภาพและวิธีการตรวจติดตามอย่าง เหมาะสมของแต่ละข้อกำหนด
  • เข้าใจการวางแผนและการดำเนินการตรวจติดตาม
สามารถตรวจติดตามโดยใช้เทคนิคที่อบรมอย่างมีประสิทธิภาพ
items.Objectives: เทคนิคการตรวจติดตาม ของ AS9100D มีความแตกต่างเป็นอย่างมากจากการตรวจติดตามของ AS9100C เพราะต้องการความรู้และความเข้าใจทั้งข้อกำหนดของ ISO 9001:2015 , AS9100D, AS9104 และมาตรฐานเฉพาะของอุตสาหกรรมการบินอวกาศ ดังนั้นจึงจำเป็นอย่างยิ่งที่ทีมผู้ตรวจติดตามต้องได้รับการแนะนำและเพิ่มเติมแนวคิดและเทคนิคใหม่ในการตรวจติดตาม ซึ่งการอบรมหลักสูตรนี้ได้ถูกจัดทำเพื่อสร้างให้เกิดผู้ตรวจติดตามที่มีคุณภาพ สามารถตรวจติดตามได้ครอบคลุมข้อกำหนดที่เกี่ยวข้องทั้งหมด

items.Objectives: AS9100D: Aerospace Standard (AS9100:2016) เป็นมาตรฐานระบบจัดการคุณภาพที่พัฒนาขึ้นมาใหม่ เพื่อให้เป็นมาตรฐานระบบจัดการคุณภาพเกี่ยวกับอุตสาหกรรม อวกาศ การบินและการทหาร โดยพัฒนาขึ้นมาจาก ISO9001: 2015  โดยมีเป้าหมายสำคัญ คือ การพัฒนาให้เกิดมาตรฐานระดับโลกของอุตสาหกรรม อวกาศ การบิน และการทหาร ที่นำไปสู่การยกระดับคุณภาพและการลดต้นทุนตลอดทั้งซัพพลายเชน (Supply chain)  รวมถึงการลดจุดอ่อนในการใช้ระบบจัดการ ISO 9001 มาประยุกต์ใช้ในองค์การทางด้านอวกาศ การบินและการทหาร ที่ไม่สามารถตอบสนองต่อกฎระเบียบ มาตรฐานทางด้านความปลอดภัย (Safety) ความน่าเชื่อถือไว้วางใจ (Reliability) และความสามารถในการบำรุงรักษา(Maintainability) รวมถึงการที่ข้อกำหนดเฉพาะ (Specific requirements) ต่างๆในอุตสาหกรรมการบินระดับโลกอย่างเพียงพอ ดังนั้นการนำเสนอภาพรวมความแตกต่างที่สำคัญของมาตรฐาน AS9100D และขั้นตอนการนำไปประยุกต์ จึงเป็นสิ่งที่จำเป็นสำหรับทีมงานเพื่อที่จะเตรียมความพร้อมในการดำเนินการจัดทำและรักษาระบบได้อย่างมีประสิทธิภาพ
items.Title: AS9100D Overview (SS0430) (1 Day) - On site

items.Author: US
items.Description: The objective of this course is to provide learners with the knowledge and skills required to understand the structure and intent of a Quality Management System based on AS9100D and report on the effective implementation and maintenance of the management system in accordance with ISO 19011 and to contribute to the continual improvement of the management system. The course refers to AS9100D as the Management System Standard that provides the context for internal audit in aerospace industry.
items.Keywords: AS9100D, aerospace, quality, quality management, quality management system, QMS, foundation, ISO 9000, ISO, 19011, ISO 19011,
items.Objectives:
•  Explain the purpose and intent of the ISO 9000 series of Standards
  • Outline the structure, content, and requirements of AS9100D
  • Explain the relationships between the clauses of AS9100D
items.Title: AS9100D Revision 2016 Aerospace QMS Foundation Training

items.Audience:
Any member of an AS9100D implementation team, representatives from key functional groups involved in an organization's quality management system, and anyone interested in understanding the structure and intent of a Quality Management System based on AS9100D.

Before starting this course, learners are expected to have the following prior knowledge:

  • Understand the Plan-Do-Check-Act cycle
  • Have basic knowledge of the concepts of quality management and the relationship between quality management and customer satisfaction
  • Understand commonly used quality management terms and definitions, as given in ISO 9000

The course refers to AS9100D as the Management System Standard that provides the context for internal audit in aerospace industry.

items.Description:
Curso USEPA Tipo 1:
 Informações sobre asbesto;
 Efeitos do Asbesto a saúde;
 Programas de proteção ao trabalhador;
 Localização do MCA no prédio;
 Reconhecimento do estrago e deterioração do MCA;
 O programa O&M para o especifico prédio (incluindo procedimentos de
emergência)

Curso USEPA Tipo 2:
Tipo 1, com adição de:
 Práticas de trabalho adequadas relacionadas ao asbesto;
 Descrição dos métodos adequados para manusear o MCA, Incluindo o
tratamento e eliminação de resíduos;
 Uso, cuidado e teste de ajuste do respirador;
 Colocação de vestuário de proteção, uso e manuseio do mesmo;
 Exercícios práticos para técnicas como trabalho com saco com luvas e uso e
manutenção de aspirador com filtro HEPA;
 Procedimento correto apropriado e correto para descontaminação.
items.Title: Asbestos

items.Audience: Delegates are not expected to have any knowledge of asbestos management systems prior to attending this course.
items.Description:
The aim of this Course is to provide participants with an overview of the purpose and requirements of the Control of Asbestos Regulations and the knowledge necessary to draw up policies and plans for managing asbestos in buildings.

 

By the end of this course, participants will be able to:

  • Understand their duties under CAR
  • Select and order asbestos surveys
  • Understand the various asbestos management options
  • Produce asbestos management plans and policies
  • Prepare emergency response plans
  • Appreciate the requirements and standards placed upon asbestos removal contractors
  • Understand the role and value of UKAS analysts
  • Utilise skills and consultants to prepare robust remediation schemes
items.Objectives: Participants who successfully complete this programme will gain an understanding of how to prepare and run asbestos management systems within their organisation and arrange suitable responses to asbestos problems.
items.Title: Asbestos - Policies Plans, Management & Removal Training Course

items.Audience: Delegates are not expected to have any knowledge of asbestos management systems prior to attending this course.
items.Description:
The aim of this Course is to provide participants with an overview of the purpose and requirements of the Control of Asbestos Regulations and the knowledge necessary to draw up policies and plans for managing asbestos in buildings.

 

By the end of this course, participants will be able to:

  • Understand their duties under CAR
  • Select and order asbestos surveys
  • Understand the various asbestos management options
  • Produce asbestos management plans and policies
  • Prepare emergency response plans
  • Appreciate the requirements and standards placed upon asbestos removal contractors
  • Understand the role and value of UKAS analysts
  • Utilise skills and consultants to prepare robust remediation schemes
items.Objectives: Participants who successfully complete this programme will gain an understanding of how to prepare and run asbestos management systems within their organisation and arrange suitable responses to asbestos problems.
items.Title: Asbestos - Policies Plans, Management & Removal Training Course

items.Audience:
Participants who successfully complete this programme will gain an understanding of how avoid or minimise exposure to asbestos, how to avert potential asbestos emergencies. They will know what is required of them, their employers and clients with regards to provision of information regarding asbestos and the steps to be taken to protect themselves, colleagues and building occupants while carrying out their work.

 

Delegates are not expected to have any knowledge of asbestos or asbestos regulations prior to attending this course. Under the Control of Asbestos Regulations, anyone who will or is likely to encounter asbestos in the course of their work must undertake this training.
items.Description: This course is delivered under membership of Independent Asbestos Training Providers IATP (equivalent to UKATA)
items.Objectives:
The aim of this Course is to provide participants with an active awareness of  the hazards of asbestos in the workplace and how to manage them. Participants will learn why asbestos was used, where it comes from, where to find it in buildings and what to do about it if they do encounter suspect asbestos materials in the course of their work.

This is known as Category A Awareness.

 

By the end of this course, participants will be able to:

 

  • Understand where asbestos comes from and why it was used.
  • Know the different types of asbestos and their properties
  • Recognise which materials might contain asbestos
  • Take appropriate steps in an emergency
  • Ask the right questions to obtain asbestos information relevant to their work.
  • Appreciate the requirements of the Control of Asbestos Regulations
  • Understand what asbestos management plans are and how they are devised.
items.Title: Asbestos Statutory Awareness Training Course

items.Title: Asbestos Statutory Awareness Training Course

items.Audience:
• Implementers and users

  • Group manager/PMO manager

  • Property manager

  • System auditors

  • Field Inspector

  • Any individual or representative of an organization who wishes to understand the concepts of Management Systems, specifically the intentions and requirements of the ASC CoC.
items.Objectives: The aim of this course is to allow delegates to gain an in-depth understanding of the practical implementation of the standards, and learn how to carry out their responsibilities.  The course gives a clear overview of the requirements of ASC Coc – ASC Fishery Product with examples of how the standard may be applied.  It also includes the planning, conducting and implementation stages of the implementation process with reference to ASC CoC. The course provides the balance between theory and interactive workshops that develop the necessary knowledge and skills to conduct the implementation of the ASC CoC.
items.Title: ASC (Aquaculture Stewardship Council) COC Awareness (1 Day) - On Site
Asean Guidelines for Cosmetic Good Manufacturing Practice Internal Audit (2 Day)-On Site

items.Audience:
A todo el personal vinculado en Compañías, Laboratorios, Termoeléctricas, que su materia prima tengan como base el Carbón:
 
  • Geólogos.
  • Gerentes de exploración.
  • Ingenieros de Minas.
  • Ingenieros Químicos.
  • Auxiliares de Patio, Laboratorios y Mina.
  • Personal de manipulación y análisis de bases de datos.
items.Description: La necesidad de la industria minera - Carbón, de medir y evaluar procedimientos, analizar y determinar el aseguramientos de la calidad; de lo proveedores y ensayos en el laboratorio; nos lleva a diseñar un programa de capacitación basado en nuestra experiencia y conocimiento del sector. Pudiendo así impartir bajo normas, técnicas y muestreos, procedimientos internacionales establecidos que ayudan a optimizar recursos y tiempo.
items.Objectives:
• El objetivo principal de este curso es colectar de la manera más apropiada muestras a partir de las diferentes necesidades y métodos usados en la industria minera, para finalmente poder ser certificables a nivel mundial. 
  • Identificar los análisis de laboratorio así como las prácticas para aseguramiento de la calidad en el muestreo, análisis de laboratorio, procesamiento de información en bases de datos.
  • Analizar estadísticamente los datos de laboratorio para la identificación de errores generados en el muestreo, en el laboratorio o en digitación de datos.
items.Title: Aseguramiento de Calidad – Asociado al Carbón (In Company)
Aseguramiento de la Calidad en la norma ISO 17025 numeral 5.9 (In Company)

items.Audience: El seminario-taller está dirigido a personal técnico y profesional que tiene bajo su responsabilidad la función metrológica en la Organización. También al personal técnico que realiza las actividades de verificación y calibración de instrumentos de medición al interior de la Organización.
items.Description: Al terminar el seminario-taller, el participante estará en capacidad de planificar, implementar, mantener y mejorar un Sistema de Aseguramiento y Gestión Metrológica acorde con los requerimientos exigidos por las Normas ISO-9001, NTC-ISO-10012, ISO-TS-16949 (QS-9000), ISO 17025, ISO-14000,  HACCP y BPM.
items.Keywords:
Metrología y gestión metrológica.
ISO 9001: 2000.
NTC - ISO - 10012
Calidad del producto y/o servicio
items.Objectives:
• Comprender los fundamentos teóricos básicos de la metrología y la gestión metrológica y su importancia en los procesos de implementación de los diversos sistemas de gestión.
  • Brindar herramientas para que las organizaciones den cumplimiento al requerimiento 7.6 de Norma ISO-9001:2000. Teniendo como referencia y orientaciones de la Norma NTC-ISO-10012.
  • Identificar las variables críticas y los instrumentos de medición a controlar e implementar y mejorar los procesos de medición necesarios para garantizar la calidad del producto y/o servicio.
items.Title: Aseguramiento y gestión metrológica

items.Audience:
A personal  interesado en la gestión y control de los instrumentos de medición de empresas de producción y de servicios y todo aquel interesado en asegurar las mediciones que realiza.

Certificados:

La emisión y entrega de los certificados se hará en un plazo máximo de  quince (15) días después de haber  culminado el curso, habiéndose procesado las asistencias, participaciones y las evaluaciones.
El certificado se emitirá bajo las siguientes modalidades:
- Participación: Se considerará la asistencia al curso, siempre y cuando esta sea mayor o igual al 75% de la duración del curso.
- Aprobación: Al finalizar el curso se evaluará a los participantes y se considerará como aprobado a aquellos participantes que obtengan un puntaje igual o mayor al 75% del total. También se considerará la evaluación continua (participación, puntualidad, aptitud y desempeño).

Precio incluye IGV
items.Description:
El curso se ocupa de dar a conocer los conceptos de la metrología relacionada con control de calidad y gestión de calidad.
La presente asignatura comprende el conjunto de conocimientos relacionados con el fundamento científico de la metrología, estandarización y certificación, que se emplean como herramientas en los procesos productivos, para asegurar la calidad de los productos y procesos. La asignatura está orientada a que el alumno obtenga los conocimientos sobre los fundamentos de la metrología, de los métodos y herramientas de las mediciones usadas para el control de piezas de las máquinas; la reglamentación de la precisión, de los errores de forma y posición de las piezas de las máquinas, del sistema único de tolerancias y ajustes de piezas metal mecánicas.

Contenido:

- Conceptos de la metrología relacionada con control de calidad y gestión de calidad.
- Requisitos de las normas de gestión relacionados con los equipos de seguimiento y medición.
- Campos de la metrología.
- Definiciones utilizadas en metrología.
- Los medios de medición y su clasificación.
- La trazabilidad metrológica.
- Las características metrológicas.
- Los patrones metrológicos, usos y características.
- ¿Calibrar o verificar?
- ¿Cuándo calibrar los equipos?
- Cómo determinar los criterios de aceptación para los equipos.
- Las mediciones y la incertidumbre.
- Propiedades estadísticas de los sistemas de medición.
- Los certificados de calibración. Contenido.
- Los certificados de calibración. Interpretación.

Se intercalará el contenido teórico con el desarrollo de talleres aplicativos
items.Objectives:
- Dar a conocer los conceptos de metrología y sus aplicaciones prácticas.
- Proporcionar los criterios básicos sobre calibración y verificación en la gestión de los instrumentos de medición.
- Interpretar los requisitos metrológicos relacionados en las normas ISO 9001, ISO 14000, ISO/IEC 17025, ISO/IEC 17020.
- Establecer los equipos y/o instrumentos de medición a calibrar y/o verificar.
- Establecer los requisitos para tener confianza en las mediciones realizadas.
- Conocer los requisitos que debe cumplir un certificado de calibración de acuerdo a lo establecido por la norma ISO/IEC 17025.
- Interpretar, evaluar y aplicar correctamente un certificado de calibración.

items.Audience:
This course is relevant to those who want to have a solid grasp of environmental aspect identification and environmental impact evaluation, particularly those involved in the development, implementation and improvement of ISO 14001. 

Note:  SGS shall provide only generic information and advice which are freely available in the public domain.

SGS will not provide company-specific advice towards any development and implementation of managements systems for eventual certification, which contravenes requirements of the IAF Guidance (i.e. provision of consultancy services).
items.Description:
This course gives you a solid understanding of identification of environmental aspects and impact evaluation based on the implementation of ISO 14001:2004 Environmental Management System. 

Knowledge of environmental aspects (elements of an organization's activities or products or services that can interact with the environment) and environmental impacts (any change to the environment, whether adverse or beneficial that result from an organization's environmental aspects) are important to the implementation of your environmental management system.

Topics:

  • Introduction, definition and objective on developing Aspect & Impact Evaluation
  • Basic concepts and its importance in the organization
  • Documenting and recording Aspect & Impact Evaluation
  • Tools on Developing Aspect & Impact Evaluation
  • Roles and Responsibilities of Employees on developing Aspect & Impact Evaluation
  • Workshops on developing Aspect & Impact Evaluation
items.Keywords: Aspect Impact Assessment of ISO 14001:2015
items.Objectives:
Upon completion of this course, you are expected to:

  • Understand the basic concepts and importance of aspect identifcation and impact evaluation in the context of ISO 14001
  • Document and record aspect and impact evaluation
  • Use the tools to develop aspect and impact evaluation
  • Describe the roles and responsibilities of employees in Aspect and Impact Evaluation

items.Description: Through an interactive learning approach, this training course is designed to help you apply risk-based thinking skills and risk management system knowledge, in order to assess and effectively manage risk in your management system
items.Keywords: risk, management, 31000, risk-based, thinking, corrective, action, root, cause, quality, tools, introduction, virtual, online, elearning, assess, understand, training, core, system, iso, fmea, pdca, 5-why, 5, why, bowtie, fishbone, ICAM, pdpc, fault, fault tree, analysis, analyze, supply, chain, supplier, matrix
items.Objectives:
1. Analyze a management system to determine if risk is properly identified and minimized
  2. Describe the benefits of risk management to your operation
  3. Relate risk management to processes and supply chains
  4. Identify internal and external impacts of risks on your supply chain and customer satisfaction
  5. Analyze real-world situations to determine if risk is sufficiently managed
  6. Learn to create and use a risk matrix
  7. Conduct a risk assessment
  8. Use recognized approaches and valuable tools to minimize operational risk, including fault tree analysis, FMEA, PDPC, 5 Why, ICAM, Bowtie, and Fishbone Diagramming

items.Audience: Curso dirigido a grupos de 20 personas interesadas en conocer sobre el tema de diferentes rangos en la estructura organizacional.
items.Description: A través de la historia, el teléfono como medio de comunicación ha sido utilizado desde 1877, sin embargo éste medio como canal para prestación de servicios y orientación al usuario ha ocasionado el surgimiento de necesidades claras de entrenamiento para las personas dedicadas al servicio de atención telefónica, dadas las condiciones físicas que limitan el contacto visual con los usuarios, la carga emocional de quien solicita el servicio y la multiplicidad de comunicaciones en red que se desarrollan de manera simultánea al momento de prestar el servicio.
items.Keywords: Prestación del servicio.
items.Objectives: Adoptar herramientas metodológicas y conceptuales para la cualificación en el desempeño de las personas  responsables de la prestación de dicho servicio dentro de la organización

items.Audience: Profesionales que atienden y prestan servicio al cliente en entornos de alta conflictividad, con fuertes intereses subyacentes, altas expectativas de calidad en el trato y el servicio, y altos niveles de exigencia en esta materia por parte de sus empresas y organizaciones.
items.Author: SGS Madrid
items.Description:
MÓDULO 1

1.1. Trato y tratamiento

* El objetivo final de un profesional del grupo:

- Más allá de tratar al paciente

- La influencia de nuestros prejuicios en nuestro comportamiento con los pacientes y sus familiares

1.2. La calidad de la relación a través de la influencia en los demás:

* Los pilares de la influencia en los demás  

* Las tres leyes de la teoría del Iceberg para influir de forma positiva

* La importancia de desarrollar una cuenta corriente emocional con el paciente y su entorno familiar y cómo hacerlo

1.3.Las herramientas de comunicación para desarrollar la relación:

*El viaje al filtro, la importancia de las preguntas para conectar. La fuerza de las preguntas.

*La importancia de la empatía en las situaciones agresivas de comunicación: el acuse de recibo

*La escucha activa: Oír o escuchar, ¿dónde está la diferencia?

1.4. Conclusiones y definición del plan de acción

 

MÓDULO 2

2.1. Informe oral y control de la puesta en práctica

2.2. La importancia de la asertividad en las relaciones con el paciente y su entorno:

* ¿Qué es la asertividad? ¿qué consecuencias tienen no ser asertivo?  

* ¿Cómo ser asertivo en las situaciones delicadas? Elementos de la asertividad

2.3. La comunicación de noticias negativas:

* ¿Cómo hacerlo?

* Cómo ayudar al paciente y/o familiares en esos momentos difíciles

* Saber decir NO con eficacia a pruebas médicas innecesarias o cuando no se puede acceder a las peticiones del paciente

2.4. La gestión de las reclamaciones, incidencias y conflictos:

* De nuestros pacientes

* Una oportunidad de convertir al paciente en promotor

2.5. La gestión del conflicto personal: el autodominio:

* ¿Cómo gestionar las situaciones de estrés para controlar nuestro comportamiento en situaciones difíciles?

2.6. Conclusiones y definición del plan de acción final
items.Keywords: Atención, Trato, Profesional Sanitario
items.Objectives:
Dotar a los profesionales de herramientas y metodología para:

  • Reflexionar sobre su estilo de comunicarse y relacionarse con el paciente.
  • Hacerles conscientes de la importancia de convertir al paciente en promotor y una referencia del servicio y del hospital.
  • Darles herramientas concretas de comunicación y gestión de situaciones difíciles o conflictivas.

 

Al final del entrenamiento los participantes habrán trabajado actitudes para:

  • Ser conscientes de la importancia de influir en las personas de nuestro entorno como vía para convertir al paciente en referencia.
  • Generar confianza en el paciente para ayudarle a superar situaciones difíciles.
  • Profundizar en herramientas de comunicación y empatía para fortalecer la relación con pacientes y familiares.
  • Saber como dirigir una entrevista clínica conciliando tiempo disponible con excelencia en el trato.
  • Saber comunicar decisiones o noticias difíciles reduciendo el impacto negativo que producen.
  • Gestionar conflictos y reclamaciones desde la asertividad
  • Generar un clima de trabajo basado en la actitud positiva.

items.Objectives:

  • Dar a conocer los sistemas de protección que las zonas clasificadas ATEX deben cumplir: la evaluación del riesgo, la clasificación de zonas, los procedimientos de trabajo, la utilización de EPI, la protección colectiva, etc.
items.Title: ATEX: Conceptos generales

items.Audience: • Responsables y técnicos de mantenimiento, Ingenieros, técnicos prevención que forman parte del servicio de prevención de la empresa y mandos intermedios.
items.Description:
• Fundamentos
  • Marco legal
  • Clasificación de zonas:
    • Gas y vapor
    • Polvo
  • Evaluación del riesgo de explosión
  • Requisitos del marcado de equipos ATEX
  • Análisis de potenciales focos de ignición (UNE-EN-1127-1)
  • Técnicas de control del riesgo de explosión
  • Selección de equipos a utilizar o instalar en zonas ATEX
    • Evaluación de conformidad
    • Documentación exigible al fabricante
  • Requisitos de marcado
    • Modos de protección eléctricos (familia normativa IEC 60079)
    • Modos de protección mecánicos (familia normativa EN 13463)
Requisitos de instalación eléctrica en zonas ATEX (ITC-BT-29)
items.Objectives:
• Transmitir los conocimientos fundamentales para el diseño y el trabajo de mantenimiento en zonas clasificadas con riesgo ATEX.
  • Dar a conocer los sistemas de protección que las zonas clasificadas ATEX deben cumplir: la evaluación del riesgo, la clasificación de zonas, los procedimientos de trabajos, la utilización de EPI, la protección colectiva, etc.
  • Dar a conocer los sistemas de protección que deben contemplar las zonas de trabajo con riesgo ATEX.
  • Dar a conocer las especificaciones que deben cumplir  los equipos instalados en zonas ATEX.
items.Title: ATEX: Diseño y mantenimiento de instalaciones con riesgo ATEX

items.Audience:
Empresas que cuentan con un DPCE de acuerdo al Real Decreto 681/2003 sobre la protección de la salud y la seguridad de los trabajadores expuestos a los riesgos derivados de atmósferas explosivas.
Todo el personal que realice trabajos o acceda a las zonas clasificadas ATEX.
items.Description:

  • Procedimientos de trabajo

  • Sensibilizar a las personas implicadas en la importancia de colaborar en la aplicación del DPCE

Para o calculo da carga horária dos cursos online, nossa área pedagógica analisa a média de tempo que o aluno levará para participar de todas as atividades propostas na plataforma e também o eventual tempo de estudo fora da plataforma, quando o aluno precisa realizar uma pesquisa para realização de exercícios. Obs.: os recursos acima podem ser aplicados em parcialmente nos cursos, assim como poderão ser utilizados outros recursos instrucionais no treinamento.

items.Title: Atualização ISO 9001:2015 - Registre seu Interesse

items.Audience:
• Gestores de Qualidade e Segurança de Alimentos em organizações pertencentes à cadeia produtiva de alimentos;

  • Pessoal das áreas de qualidade, produção, distribuição e armazenamento de empresas de alimentos.

 

Pré requisito:

  • Ter realizado treinamento de ou ter conhecimento consistente sobre o esquema de certificação FSSC22000.
items.Description:
• Introdução ao FSSC 22000
  • O Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI)
  • FSSC 22000
  • Parte 0 – Termos e Definições
  • Requisitos para certificação FSSC 22000

Interpretação e aplicação dos requisitos da Parte 02 do Esquema de certificação FSSC 220000 – versão 04.

1) Gestão de serviços
2) Supervisão do pessoal
3) Gestão dos materiais fornecidos
4) Gestão dos recursos naturais (apenas para produção animal)
5) Defesa dos alimentos
6) Prevenção da fraude em alimentos
7) Formulação de produtos (apenas para alimentos para cães e gatos)
8) Gestão de alérgenos
9) Rotulagem do produto
10) Monitoramento ambiental
11) Uso do logotipo.
items.Keywords: 22000, FSSC, atualzação, atualização fssc, alimentos
items.Objectives:
• Conhecer os requisitos para certificação FSSC 22000 (Food Safety System Certification) – versão 04.
  • Interpretar e aplicar os requisitos adicionais do documento Parte 02 que compõe a certificação FSSC22000 – Versão 04. 
  • Discutir as mudanças nas auditorias para a nova versão do esquema de certificação FSSC 22000 – Versão 04.
  • Desenvolver habilidades para avaliação destes requisitos na organização;
items.Title: Atualização ISO FSSC 22000
